description: When you are as rich as Apple and you want to make investors happy, you issue debt. That is what the company has donefor investors over the last year and a half. OnTuesday, Apple issued debt for the first time in euros.

title: Appeals Court Is Urged to Strike Down Program for Collecting Phone Records
description: WASHINGTON  A conservative legal activist urged a federal appeals court Tuesday to strike down the National Security Agencys program that collects Americans phone records in bulk, calling it perhaps the biggest violation of freedom and constitutional rights in history and warning the judges that if they did not step in, Americans would take to the streets in revolt.

title: Why Sand Is Disappearing
description: BERKELEY, Calif.  TO those of us who visit beaches only in summer, they seem as permanent a part of our natural heritage as the Rocky Mountains and the Great Lakes. But shore dwellers know differently. Beaches are the most transitory of landscapes, and sand beaches the most vulnerable of all. During big storms, especially in winter, they can simply vanish, only to magically reappear in time for the summer season.

title: Oklahoma Supreme Court Blocks 2 Abortion Laws
description: The Oklahoma Supreme Court on Tuesday blocked two new laws that critics say may have made it difficult for women to obtain abortions in the state.

title: Turner Hires Kevin Reilly, Ex-Fox Executive, to Run TNT and TBS
description: Turner Broadcasting has landed one of the most prominent names in television programming in recent years, announcing on Tuesday that Kevin Reilly will become president of the TNT and TBS cable networks and the chief creative officer of Turner Entertainment.

title: Strong Film and Cable Profit at Fox Tempered by Network TV
description: LOS ANGELES  Movie studio and cable network growth resulted in better-than-expected quarterly profit at 21st Century Fox. But weakness at the Fox broadcast network continued to bedevil the company.

title: 2014 Election Coverage of New York, Connecticut and New Jersey Races
description: Our coverage of Election Day (so far) in the New York area:

title: Thomas Sneddon, 73, Dies; Prosecuted Michael Jackson Case
description: Thomas W. Sneddon Jr., a former district attorney who tried and failed twice to convict Michael Jackson on child molestation charges and became the target of a bitter song on one of the pop stars albums, died on Saturday in Santa Barbara, Calif. He was 73.

title: Kentucky Election Highlights
description: Senator Mitch McConnell, the ranking Republican member of the Senate, managed to win his sixth full term, defeating Alison Lundergan Grimes, his Democratic challenger, in one of the most closely watched races in the country.

title: Scottish Club Hamilton Academical Combines Soccer and Sobriety
description: HAMILTON, Scotland  Twelve miles outside of Glasgow, at the tiny New Douglas Park soccer stadium, Colin McGowan was talking about divine intervention.

title: 1965: The War Over G.I. Joe
description: This feature looks at the first time famous names or terms appeared in The Times. Have an idea for someone or something you would like to read about? Send a suggestion in the comments section.

title: Election 2014: How the Turks See Us
description: ISTANBUL  ASIDE from a few thousand American service personnel at the military bases in Izmir and Incirlik, there are no votes in the midterm elections from Turkey. But standing at the edge of the Bosporus, with Russian tankers steaming past his fishing lines, Nazim Yanikdag expressed frustration with President Obamas policies in the Middle East.

title: Pakistani Christian Couple Are Tortured and Burned to Death by Angry Mob
description: LAHORE, Pakistan  An enraged mob tortured a Pakistani Christian couple and incinerated their bodies in a brick kiln in eastern Pakistan on Tuesday after they were accused of burning a Quran, police officials said.

title: Republicans, Meet Science
description: Just days before the midterm elections, we got the latest alarm: The globe is heating up like a griddle, and were just lolling here like eggs.

title: Filtering Out the Jargon of Politics
description: A new computer tool lets you plug in the text of any politicians speech and, with one click, it draws red lines through jargon. It is called Polifiller, as in political filler, and searches for phrases in what it calls the Hall of Shame.

title: Invesco Fund Treads Risky Path as Major Investor in Distressed Corporate Debt
description: When a unit of a Texas power giant filed for bankruptcy this year, investors did not go looking for bargains. Because the company was saddled with $40 billion in debt from a boom-era buyout in 2007, the virtual buyer beware tag on its leveraged loans kept even the most brazen risk-seekers at bay.

title: Lorenzo Albacete, Theologian and Confidant of Popes, Dies at 73
description: Msgr. Lorenzo Albacete, a former aerospace researcher turned Roman Catholic priest who became one of the Vaticans most articulate, unofficial defenders in the United States, died on Oct. 24 in Dobbs Ferry, N.Y. He was 73.

title: South Carolina Election Highlights
description: Nikki R. Haley, a Republican who at 42 is the nations youngest governor, won re-election in South Carolina. She defeated Vincent Sheheen, a longtime Democratic state senator, who lost narrowly to her in 2010 by just 4.5 percentage points.

title: Ohio Election Highlights
description: Gov. John R. Kasich of Ohio won re-election easily, with the help of a series of missteps and uncomfortable revelations by the Democratic candidate, Ed FitzGerald. Mr. FitzGerald, the Cuyahoga County executive, lost staff members and donors after reports that two years before, the police had found him in a parked car at 4:30 a.m. with a woman who was not his wife. Mr. FitzGerald, a former F.B.I. agent, said that nothing untoward had occurred. His campaign was further damaged by the news that he had been driving for years without a valid license. Mr. FitzGeralds campaign never recovered, and Mr. Kasich enjoyed a double-digit lead in the two months leading up to the election.

title: Oregon Moves Up in College Football Playoff Rankings, With Top 3 Unchanged
description: On Tuesday morning, the former Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice wrote on Twitter, Today, we have the opportunity to exercise one of our most precious rights ... the right to vote. Go to your local polls and cast your ballot!

title: Harsher Rule in Turkey
description: To the Editor:

title: A Living Wage in Denmark, and in America
description: To the Editor:

title: The Telecommuting Option
description: To the Editor:

title: Steinways Early Days
description: To the Editor:

title: Pass Go, Take Pictures
description: Revisiting the Atlantic City streets that were immortalized in Monopoly.

title: Climate Change: Questions for Colleges
Saudi Arabia Takes Action After Shiites Are Attacked
description: Saudi Arabian security officials moved aggressively on Tuesday to crush an outbreak of anti-Shiite violence, arresting 15 people in six cities and killing two others in connection with what the Interior Ministry called a terrorist ambush on mosque worshipers in a minority Shiite community.

title: Fire Destroys Family-Owned Cannoli Factory in Mount Vernon
description: MOUNT VERNON, N.Y.  Anthony J. Artuso Sr. stood outside the burned-out ruin of his familys cannoli factory on Tuesday and lamented his luck.

title: Exposing the Bangalore Techie
description: TWO men, both in technological fields, were in the news last week because of their homosexuality. The first was Tim Cook of Apple, whose coming-out essay in Bloomberg Businessweek made headlines because it established him as the first openly gay C.E.O. of a Fortune 500 company. The announcement generated considerable optimism that with his influence and visibility he would be a force for far-reaching advocacy in years to come.

title: Pursuing a Degree While Balancing Chronic Illness and Classes
description: Slung over Renny Vilorios shoulder is a fabric bag that rarely leaves his side; its contents keep him breathing. A second accessory complements his ensemble: a backpack, loaded with textbooks.

title: Fight Poverty, Not Cooking
description: For many people, cooking is fraught  thats the core message of The Joy of Cooking?, an article written by three academics that appeared in the latest issue of the journal Contexts, based on 150 interviews with families from all walks of life. The interviews and most of the authors conclusions are convincing.

title: Tennessee Election Highlights
description: Gov. Bill Haslam, a Republican, did not face a serious challenge in his re-election bid, easily defeating his opponent, a retired construction worker named Charles V. Brown, listed on the ballot as Charlie, who barely campaigned.

title: To Angry Voters, Washington Comes Out the Biggest Loser
description: WHEAT RIDGE, Colo.  Jane Dempsey has been out of work since 2007, but she still has faith in the Colorado economy. What she has lost heart in, she said after casting her vote at the municipal building here Tuesday morning, are the public officials representing her in the nations capital.

title: Wary of Losing Rams, St. Louis Is Set to Huddle on Stadium
description: ST. LOUIS  For beleaguered Rams fans, it was the happiest of celebrations: Last month, the team that won the franchises only Super Bowl title gathered for a 15th-anniversary reunion. Marshall Faulk, Kurt Warner and four dozen other members of the Greatest Show on Turf were bathed in cheers from fans who have watched a lot of losing teams since that magical season.

title: Donald Saddler, Dancer, and a Choreographer on Broadway, Dies at 96
description: Donald Saddler, a dancer and choreographer whose career lasted more than 60 years and embraced opera, television, movies, ballet and Broadway, where he won two Tony Awards, died on Saturday in Englewood, N.J. He was 96.

title: West Virginia Election Highlights
description: Representative Shelley Moore Capito became the first woman elected to the Senate from West Virginia and will become the states first Republican senator since 1959.

title: Bloody and Belittled Shiite Ritual Draws Historic Parallels
description: BAGHDAD  The blood oozing from the cuts in the top of Ali Rassouls head on Tuesday had crusted in streaks around his eyes and ears and soaked the front of his long, white gown.

title: Voters Second Thoughts on Hope and Change
description: A decade after President Obama made his national political debut with an appeal for Americans to put aside their divisions, the midterm elections on Tuesday delivered a resounding rejection of his call for consensus. Mr. Obamas poor poll numbers dragged down candidates and hastened his partys decline in the South and the West, as Democrats watched their hold on the Senate slip away.

title: Pennsylvania Election Highlights
description: Gov. Tom Corbett, the Republican and first-time incumbent, lost his race for re-election to Tom Wolf, a Democratic businessman. Mr. Wolf, who runs a building company specializing in kitchen cabinets, had criticized Mr. Corbett for letting education funds fall  even as the governor pushed through more than $300 million in business tax cuts that were enacted in 2011 and 2012.

title: When Red Wings Are on the Ice, Minds Are on Gordie Howe
description: OTTAWA  Gordie Howe is in Texas recovering from a stroke and fighting the effects of dementia. But wherever the Detroit Red Wings go these days, he is with them.

title: Alabama Election Highlights
description: Gov. Robert Bentley, a Republican, won a second term with ease, carried by widespread job approval and strong annual job growth that trumped concerns about that trumped concerns about rising unemployment. He fended off a nominal challenge from Parker Griffith, a former congressman who has switched from Democrat to Republican and back again. The states unemployment rate, which fell to 6.6 percent in September, is among the highest in the nation. But it has fallen from 9.1 percent in January 2011, when Mr. Bentley took office with a pledge not to take a salary until unemployment dropped below 5.2 percent. A majority of voters were unconvinced that they should replace Mr. Bentley with Mr. Griffith, who lacked money and name recognition.

title: New Jersey Election Highlights
description: Senator Cory Booker, a Democrat, has won his first full term after arriving through a special election last year to fill the seat vacated by the death of Frank R. Lautenberg. His election continues the Democrats 38-year Senate winning streak in the state.

title: Andrew Cuomo Is Re-elected New York Governor, but Loses Clout
description: This was the election in which Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo had every reason to think he would outdo his father.

title: As the Climate Changes, Voters Go for Coal
description: It was just two days ago that a United Nations panel on climate change issued a frightening warning about the dangers of global warming.

title: Conflicts in the Sharing Economy
description: It can be hard to stay grounded in reality when talking about the sharing economy. Businesses like Airbnb say they are making the world more efficient by connecting buyers and sellers of services in ways never possible before. Critics argue that these businesses cant violate rules that apply to everyone else.

title: Delaware Election Highlights
description: Delaware loves Democrats, so it was no surprise that Chris Coons, the incumbent senator, coasted to victory over his Republican challenger, Kevin L. Wade.

title: Illinois Election Highlights
description: In a state where registered Democrats far outnumber Republicans and President Obamas approval rating has stayed near the 50 percent mark, Bruce Rauner, a wealthy Republican businessman, managed to push out the Democratic governor, Pat Quinn, in a close and nasty contest.

title: Irish Agog That Joe Kernen, CNBC Host, Missed Their Exit From U.K.
description: The head of Irelands Industrial Development Agency, which is devoted to promoting foreign investment, became an unlikely viral video star after a bizarre appearance on CNBC on Monday.

title: New York Election Highlights
description: The solidly blue state of New York delivered for Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, a Democrat running for a second term. Mr. Cuomo won despite an array of challenges, including the muted enthusiasm he often draws from New York voters and an explosive report earlier this year about his handling of a statewide ethics panel, which he created and then abruptly shut down.

title: Maine Election Highlights
description: Gov. Paul R. LePage, a Republican running for a second term, defeated his Democratic opponent, Representative Michael H. Michaud, who conceded the race shortly after midnight.

title: Mitch McConnells Victory Speech
description: Senator Mitch McConnell, Republican of Kentucky, spoke after defeating Alison Lundergan Grimes, the Democratic candidate.

title: Vermont Election Highlights
description: Gov. Peter Shumlin, a Democrat seeking a third two-year term, finished with a narrow lead over the Republican candidate, Scott Milne, but failed to get more than 50 percent of the vote. Under the state Constitution, the race will be decided in January by the Vermont Legislature, which is controlled by Democrats.

title: Arkansas Election Highlights
description: The Republicans flipped a key Senate seat in Arkansas, when Tom Cotton, a Republican congressman, defeated the Democratic incumbent, Mark Pryor. The race had been watched as one of the key competitions for control of the chamber.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Nov. 4, 2014
In Rapidly Changing World, Nets Strive for an Important Constant
description: The Nets owner, Mikhail D. Prokhorov, made a rare appearance at Barclays Center on Monday, when the Nets routed the Oklahoma City Thunder in their home opener.

title: Election 2014: What Do the Midterms Tell Us About 2016?
description: The 2014 election will be a four-part test that will tell us more than who will win control of the Senate.

title: Given Chance, Mets Juan Lagares Hauls In a Gold Glove
description: After the Mets signed Juan Lagares out of the Dominican Republic at 17, he struggled in his first three years in their system as a shortstop. In those years, playing perhaps the most difficult position in baseball, he made 69 errors.

title: Surveys of Voters Signal Dismay With Both Parties
description: Politically divided Americans were in dour agreement about much as they voted in this years midterm elections  broadly distrustful of government, overwhelmingly disapproving of Congress, convinced that the nations economic system favors the wealthy and doubtful that the next generation will inherit a better economic future.

title: In New Hampshire, Jeanne Shaheen Beats Scott Brown to Keep Senate Seat
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Senator Jeanne Shaheen barely fended off an aggressive challenge for her United States Senate seat Tuesday from Scott Brown, a Republican and former senator from Massachusetts.

title: South Dakota Election Highlights
description: Mike Rounds, a former governor, picked up a critical seat for Republicans. In a surprisingly unpredictable three-way race to replace Senator Tim Johnson, a retiring Democrat, Mr. Rounds slipped ahead of Rick Weiland, a former congressional aide and regional director of the Federal Emergency Management Agency, and Larry Pressler, a former Republican congressman and senator who ran as an independent.

title: The World Is Fast
description: Weve just had a nonsense midterm election. Never has more money been spent to think so little about a future so in flux. What would we have discussed if wed had a serious election? How about the biggest challenge were facing today: The resilience of our workers, environment and institutions.

title: Republicans Extend House Control as Democratic Holdouts Fall
description: Republicans expanded their majority in the House of Representatives, riding a wave of dissatisfaction with President Obama to victories on Tuesday that will embolden Speaker John A. Boehner as he tries to manage a rebellious Tea Party caucus.

title: Republicans Hold the Top 2 Prizes in Governor Races
description: Republicans won the two most intensely followed, high-stakes governors races of the year as Rick Scott of Florida and Scott Walker of Wisconsin won re-election on Tuesday in states that both parties are looking to as a gauge of voter sentiment in the run-up to the 2016 presidential campaign.

title: Texas Election Highlights
description: Greg Abbott, the states attorney general, went into Election Day with such a powerful electoral advantage over State Senator Wendy Davis that the race was called moments after the polls closed.

title: Coach Botched Challenge, but Red Flags Are Easy to Find
description: There is no disputing that the Giants are in a desperate, downward spiral. The collapse has been so comprehensive that there are a multitude of places to point the finger of blame.

title: Arkansas Votes for Higher Minimum Wage, and a Republican
description: Arkansas just voted to raise its minimum wage to $8.50 an hour, up from $6.25. It also voted to elect a new Republican senator, Tom Cotton, who voted in the House against raising the national minimum wage to $10.10.

title: Alison Lundergan Grimes Concedes Race
description: Alison Lundergan Grimes, the Democratic Senate candidate from Kentucky, spoke after being defeated by Senator Mitch McConnell.

title: Mississippi Election Highlights
description: The re-election of Senator Thad Cochran, a Republican, came as no surprise in this conservative state, but it concealed unpredictable currents in Mississippi politics.

title: Knicks Offense Runs Aground Against Wizards, and a Promising Start Follows Suit
description: As defenders pressed them on the perimeter and passing lanes disappeared, the Knicks searched for space against the Washington Wizards on Tuesday. Space for shots. Space to breathe. They found very little of either.

title: Keeping Informed With CNBC
description: Ive said some harsh things about the quality of analysis on CNBC. But at least watching it keeps you informed about tough questions like which currency European nations use. Or maybe not

title: Indiana Election Highlights
description: Indiana displayed its strong Republican leanings as Representative Jackie Walorski, a Republican supported by Tea Party activists, easily defeated the Democrats best hope for capturing a House seat here, and Representative Andr Carson, a Democrat, had to fend off a surprisingly tough challenge.

title: President Obama Left Fighting for His Own Relevance
description: WASHINGTON  Two things were clear long before the votes were counted on Tuesday night: President Obama would face a Congress with more Republicans for his final two years in office, and the results would be seen as a repudiation of his leadership.

title: New Hampshire Election Highlights
description: Jeanne Shaheen, a Democrat and former governor of New Hampshire, held on to her seat in the Senate despite a spirited campaign by Scott P. Brown. Mr. Brown had served as a senator from Massachusetts, and moved to New Hampshire last year after being beaten by Elizabeth Warren in a Senate contest. Despite a talent for retail campaigning and his arguments that he had strong roots in the state, Mr. Brown suffered under the burden of a carpetbagger label. Exit polls showed the issue was important: When asked Has Brown lived in N.H. long enough? a majority of voters said no  and some nine out of 10 of those voters expressed support for Ms. Shaheen.

title: North Carolina Election Highlights
description: In one of the nations most closely watched races, Thom Tillis, the Republican speaker of the North Carolina House, narrowly won a Senate seat against Kay Hagan, a first-time Democratic senator. For months, Ms. Hagan, a prime Republican target, led in the polls, but Mr. Tillis closed the gap in the final days of the race.

title: Michigan Election Highlights
description: Representative Gary Peters, a Democrat, battled through a surprisingly close race with Terri Lynn Land, a former Republican secretary of state, in a state that had gone twice for President Obama. Mr. Peters pulled ahead as Election Day approached in spite of dissatisfaction with an uneven economic recovery. Americans for Prosperity, a conservative political advocacy group supported by the Koch brothers, had backed away as the Democratic Senatorial Campaign Committee pumped even more money into holding the seat vacated by Carl Levin, the longtime Democratic senator.

title: Louisiana Election Highlights
description: Mary L. Landrieu, the Democratic incumbent, and her Republican challenger, Representative Bill Cassidy, will face off in a runoff election scheduled for Dec. 6; no candidate in the race was able to capture at least 50 percent of the vote as state law requires.

title: Alex Rodriguez Could Be Called to Testify in His Cousins Case
description: Alex Rodriguezs unprecedented doping ban is over, but his legal woes could linger well into spring training, when he will be in the midst of a potentially awkward reunion with a Yankee team he hasnt played for since September 2013.

title: Wyoming Election Highlights
description: It was expected to be a fascinating showdown: Senator Michael B. Enzi, a three-term Republican, was staring down a primary fight with Liz Cheney, the elder daughter of former Vice President Dick Cheney and one of the most well-known names in the state. But Ms. Cheneys candidacy failed to gain traction, amid grumbling that she should not have taken on a well-liked member of her party and that she had not lived in the state for decades. When she dropped out in January, citing serious health issues in her family, Mr. Enzis outlook became rosier. His Democratic challenger, Charlie Hardy, a former Roman Catholic priest, missionary and educator, did not pose a real threat in this crimson bastion.

title: Missouri Election Highlights
description: The fallout from the death in August of Michael Brown, an unarmed black teenager who was shot by a white police officer in Ferguson, a St. Louis suburb, made for an unexpectedly close race for St. Louis County executive. The Democratic candidate, Steve Stenger, eked out a victory over his Republican opponent, Rick Stream, with fewer than 2,000 votes.

title: Michael Grimm Overcomes Democrats Campaign to Capture His Congressional Seat
description: Staten Islanders have picked their poison.

title: Rhode Island Election Highlights
description: The Democratic candidate for governor, Gina M. Raimondo, pulled off a difficult victory on Tuesday, becoming the states first female governor despite having made powerful enemies among public employees unions when she overhauled the state pension system as state treasurer.

title: Oklahoma Election Highlights
description: For the first time in the states history, both of Oklahomas Senate seats were in play. One of the races was held out of the usual rotation because of the retirement of Tom Coburn, a Republican. James Lankford held that seat for the Republicans, defeating Constance N. Johnson, a Democrat, and Mark Beard, an independent.

title: Eric Schneiderman Re-elected Attorney General of New York
description: Attorney General Eric T. Schneiderman of New York won re-election on Tuesday, according to The Associated Press, fending off his Republican challenger, John P. Cahill, in a race that attracted relatively little attention.

title: Arizona Election Highlights
description: The Republican nominee, Doug Ducey, has won the governors race, filling the seat left by Gov. Jan Brewer, who is leaving office because of term limits. Mr. Ducey, the state treasurer, is a former executive for Cold Stone Creamery, the ice cream company. Despite his lack of experience in the public sector, Mr. Ducey characterized his position at the company as a valuable leadership role, and his campaign produced an advertisement that included testimonials from Cold Stone franchise holders. Mr. Ducey earned the support of high-profile Republicans, including Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey, who campaigned for him in early October.

title: Election 2014: Europe Looks Beyond Obama
description: LONDON  He had to laugh. A senior official at one of the worlds leading foreign ministries was describing how he had been in a meeting with a counterpart from the Middle East, who was telling him that the United States no longer mattered the way it used to, in that region especially.

title: Colorado Election Highlights
description: In unpredictable Colorado, the contest for an open Senate seat was a real nail-biter  one that helped determine which party controls the chamber. Cory Gardners unseating of Mark Udall, a Democrat, helps push Colorado back into the Republican fold.

title: Virginia Election Highlights
description: Dave Brat, who upset the House majority leader Eric Cantor in the Republican primary, won the seat in the Seventh District. The surprising primary result left a race between two relative political neophytes, and Mr. Brat beat Jack Trammell, a Democrat. Both are members of the faculty of Randolph-Macon College, a small liberal-arts institution in Ashland.

title: Health Care in the Hands of the Court
description: Two and a half years ago, the Supreme Court upheld the Affordable Care Act by a single vote. This year alone, between 8 million and 11 million Americans have been able to get health insurance that they did not have before, according to a new analysis by The Times.

title: New Mexico Election Highlights
description: The Republican governor, Susana Martinez, is poised to play a significant role in national politics after she won re-election against her Democratic challenger, Attorney General Gary King. Ms. Martinez, who became the nations first Latina governor in 2010, gained prominence when the Republicans gave her a prime-time platform at their 2012 convention. New Mexico, with an electorate that is estimated to be about 35 percent Hispanic, is still suffering the effects of the Great Recession. Its unemployment rate remains well above the national average, but Democrats failed to make the case that Ms. Martinez was to blame.

title: Mary Landrieu of Louisiana Is Pushed to Runoff in Senate Race
description: NEW ORLEANS  Extending an expensive and largely negative campaign for one more month, voters in Louisiana sent Mary Landrieu, a Democrat and three-term United States senator, and her Republican challenger, United States Representative Bill Cassidy, into a runoff election set for Dec. 6.

title: Historical Lessons for a President Forced to Deal With a Hostile Congress
description: So what does President Obama do now? Modern presidential history suggests at least three plans of action for a president faced with an opposition House and Senate.

title: Rick Scott Fends Off Charlie Crist in Testy Florida Governors Race
description: BONITA SPRINGS, Fla.  Rick Scott, a Republican, was elected to a second termas the governor of Florida on Tuesdayby the slimmest of margins after a heated and expensive campaign against his predecessor, Charlie Crist.

title: Thanks to Giacometti, Sothebys Hits Its Highest Total Ever at Fall Opening
description: Sothebys salesroom went dead quiet on Tuesday night, the audience members visibly at the edge of their seats when Giacomettis Chariot, a 1950 bronze of an elongated female, came on the block at the Impressionist and Modern evening sale, the opening to the fall season. The provenance of Chariot was pristine; it was being sold by Alexander Goulandris, a member of the Greek shipping family, and the sculpture was among the artists rarest.

title: Election Night Winners
description: It was a happy night for Republican candidates for Senate, as well as for New Yorks Democratic governor and a New Jersey Democratic senator.

title: Florida Election Highlights
description: Gov. Rick Scotts narrow re-election in one of the nations most expensive races means that state government remains firmly in Republican hands. As the nation learned in 2000, that control can influence the outcome of a presidential election.

title: Nebraska Election Highlights
description: Ben Sasse, a Tea Party favorite making his first run for public office, won election to the United States Senate, and another Republican, Pete Ricketts, was elected governor.

title: Montana Election Highlights
description: Democrats lost a Senate seat they had held for a century to Representative Steve Daines, the states only congressman. Democrats had been poised to lose after the incumbents unexpected retirement, a campaign-killing plagiarism scandal and the last-minute nomination of a political newcomer.

title: David Perdue Wins Senate Seat, and Nathan Deal Is Re-Elected as Georgia Governor
description: ATLANTA  David Perdue won Georgias open Senate seat on Tuesday and Nathan Deal, his fellow Republican, was re-elected governor, dealing decisive blows to moderate Democratic challengers from famous political families who had hoped to force the races into runoffs.

title: Chris Benz on Assuming the Mantle at Bill Blass
description: I was living a kind of pastoral life in Brooklyn, says the designer Chris Benz of his whereabouts when he got the call to take the reins at Bill Blass. Benz, 32  whose colorful eponymous line last showed at New York Fashion Week two years ago  has high hopes for the revival of the storied fashion house, which will return to the runways for spring/summer 2016. I think that Bill Blass has had some ups and downs since Mr. Blass passed away in 2002, Benz says. It had a moment to breathe  and an update doesnt feel rushed.

title: A Los Angeles Ladies-Only Dinner Club Migrates to New York
description: The week before last, the Los Angeles-based artist Zoe Crosher emailed a number of her female friends in the art and food worlds: Please join us for the inaugural New York City meeting of The Fainting Club. She started the club  so named, she explains, after an encounter shed had where a group of incredibly fabulous women all came together to help one of the ladies, who fainted  in March. The incident made her appreciate how powerful we were as a group and prompted her to begin throwing luncheons in her city. This latest dinner party, which took place last Thursday, was her first step to expand the organization outside of California.

title: In Defense of Technology
description: As products and services advance, plenty of nostalgists believe that certain elements of humanity have been lost. One contrarian argues that being attached to ones iPhone is a godsend.

title: Negativity Wins the Senate
description: Republicans would like the country to believe that they took control of the Senate on Tuesday by advocating a strong, appealing agenda of job creation, tax reform and spending cuts. But, in reality, they did nothing of the sort.

title: Kansas Election Highlights
description: Longtime Republican Senator Pat Roberts was re-elected after one of the tightest, most hotly contested races in the country, which ended as yet another blow to Democrats.

title: Word of the Day | bluff
description: bluff \blf\ noun, adjective and verb

title: Calls Grow to Broaden Search for Next U.N. Leader
description: UNITED NATIONS  There is no job description for the worlds top civil servant, except to solve its messiest problems. There are no campaign rules, nor is there any list of qualifications, except what is left unsaid: He (and it has always been a he) must be palatable to the world powers.

title: The Bad Air in Our Gyms
description: With chilly weather settling in and darkness arriving before most peoples workdays end, many of us are shifting our workouts indoors, a practice that is much better for us than abandoning exercise for the winter. But a new study of air quality in gyms raises some interesting questions about whether the places in which we work out are as healthy as they should be.

title: De Blasio Still Faces Uphill Battle in Trying to Connect With Cuomo
description: For the most dysfunctional couple in New York politics, it was a chance for a feel-good moment after a feel-bad year.

title: Mark Udall of Colorado Loses Senate Seat to Cory Gardner, a Republican
description: DENVER  Colorado voters elected Representative Cory Gardner, the Republican challenger, as their new senator on Tuesday, rejecting the incumbent Mark Udall as a Democrat too closely tied to President Obama and as a candidate who ran a one-note campaign focused on the politics of abortion.

title: In Rebuke to Democrats, Voters Return Control of New York Senate to G.O.P.
description: In a decisive rebuke to efforts by Democrats to dominate both houses of the New York State Legislature, voters elected Republicans to a clear majority in the State Senate on Tuesday, handing them a wave of victories upstate and on Long Island, and returning the party to full control in a chamber it long dominated.

title: Georgia Election Highlights
description: David A. Perdue defied expectations by winning more than the required 50 percent of the vote to avoid a runoff with Michelle Nunn, a Democrat and the daughter of the popular former Senator Sam Nunn.

title: Nevada Election Highlights
description: Brian Sandoval, a Republican, easily won a second term as governor in a race against Robert E. Goodman, a Democrat who is a trade expert and relative political unknown. Mr. Sandoval served as a United States District Court judge before running for governor in 2010.

title: Republicans First Step Was to Handle Extremists in Party
description: WASHINGTON  It was late spring, and Republican leaders knew that if they wanted to win the Senate, they needed to crush the enemy: not Democrats, but the rebels within their own party.

title: Gov. Scott Walker Wins Re-election in Wisconsin, and Hope of Higher Office
description: WEST ALLIS, Wis.  Scott Walker, the Republican who made a national name for himself by clashing with labor unions, won a second term as governor of this state on Tuesday, keeping alive the possibility that he may be among the candidates for president in 2016.

title: Bake Sales and Inequality
Scott Walkers Victory Speech
description: Gov. Scott Walker, Republican of Wisconsin, gave an impassioned defense of his policies after defeating Mary Burke, the Democratic candidate.

title: Higher Minimum Wage Passes in 4 States; Florida Defeats Marijuana Measure
description: Voters in four states on Tuesday supported measures to raise their minimum wages, bringing the number of states that have passed such laws to 29 and reflecting widespread dissatisfaction with Congresss failure to increase the federal minimum of $7.25.

title: Massachusetts Election Highlights
description: The race for governor continued a longstanding pattern: Massachusetts is among the most reliably Democratic states in other contests, but Republicans tend to do well in races to be the states chief executive.

title: North Dakota Election Highlights
description: Representative Kevin Cramer, a Republican, won a second term in North Dakotas sole House seat. He defeated State Senator George Sinner, a Democrat whose father was the states governor from 1985 to 1992. They both described themselves as pragmatists, with Mr. Cramer, 53, criticizing his fellow Republicans for the government shutdown.

title: With Same Candidates as in 10, Race for Connecticut Governor Is Again Tight
description: The bitter race for governor of Connecticut was too close to call early on Wednesday, but Gov. Dannel P. Malloy appeared to open a lead against the Republican challenger, Thomas C. Foley, with results still coming in from the states heavily Democratic cities.

title: Whats on TV Wednesday
description: 10 P.M. (BBC America) THE GAME When a defecting K.G.B. agent in 1972 London reveals a plot that could change the course of the Cold War, Daddy (Brian Cox), the head of MI5, assembles a team to investigate  prompting the Soviets to activate sleeper agents across Britain. But then Joe Lambe (Tom Hughes), Daddys prized operative, becomes obsessed with the reappearance of his nemesis and risks letting his quest for revenge jeopardize the operation. The cast is rounded out by Paul Ritter as the head of counterespionage; Victoria Hamilton as his deputy; Jonathan Aris as her husband; Shaun Dooley as a Special Branch detective; and Chloe Pirrie as the secretary. The shows creator, Toby Whithouse, examines a possible traitor in each of the six episodes, part of the networks Dramaville programming block.

title: Wisconsin Election Highlights
description: In winning re-election, Gov. Scott Walker, a hero to conservatives and a villain to liberals for his campaign against public employee unions, keeps alive speculation that he could be a Republican contender for national office.

title: Hubert de Montille, French Winemaker, Dies at 84
description: Hubert de Montille, an influential grape grower and winemaker who revived his familys estate to make it a leader in the Cte de Beaune in Burgundy, France, died on Saturday in Alsace. He was 84.

title: Sam Brownback and Pat Roberts, Both Republicans, Undefeated in Kansas
description: TOPEKA, Kan.  The Democratic surge that was supposed to end Republican control of Kansas never happened.

title: Oregon Election Highlights
description: In challenging Senator Jeff Merkley, a Democrat, Monica Wehby, a pediatric neurosurgeon, fought to become the first Republican to win a statewide race in more than a decade, branding herself as a middle-of-the-road conservative. In the end, however, it appears she was unable to convince voters that she was the right fit for this blue state. She was also plagued by accusations that she plagiarized portions of her health care plan from other candidates.

title: Utah Election Highlights
description: Mia Love narrowly won the Fourth Congressional District for Republicans on her second try, giving the party control of the states entire congressional delegation. Her victory coincides with the retirement of the states lone Democratic congressman, Representative Jim Matheson, to whom she narrowly lost in 2012. Ms. Love, a former mayor of Saratoga Springs, Utah, and the daughter of Haitian immigrants, was declared the winner with fewer than 5,000 votes separating her from her Democratic opponent, Doug Owens, a corporate defense lawyer and the son of a former congressman.

title: Idaho Election Highlights
description: Gov. C.L. (Butch) Otter, a Republican, won a third term, beating Anthony Joseph Balukoff, known as A.J., who was determined to become the states first Democratic governor in 20 years.

title: Making the President Small
description: Democrats counting on favorable demographic trends to carry their party to victory in 2016 should consider three significant developments reflected in the outcome of Tuesdays elections.

title: The Evaporating Democratic Majority
description: For Republicans, what counts as victory? I asked in my pre-election post, and now we have an answer: This counts. Control of the Senate with room to spare, easy victories in what were supposed to be tight purple-state races and even easier victories in red states, an unexpected nailbiter in Virginia and an upset win in North Carolina, Rick Scott and Scott Walker re-elected, gubernatorial wins all over the map in deep blue states, a historically-large House majority  its a wave, its a thumping, its whatever metaphor you favorto describe a major repudiation of the president and his party.

title: Minnesota Election Highlights
description: Gov. Mark Dayton, a Democrat, beat Jeff Johnson, a Republican, in a race that had tightened in the days leading up to the election. Governor Dayton has said it would be his last campaign.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: All they do is fight between each other and dont get anything done. So we  and I  need something different in there. Everything needs to change.

title: Corrections: November 5, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Hawaii Election Highlights
description: The victory by David Ige, a Democratic state senator, was not surprising in this deep blue state. He pummeled the incumbent governor in the primary and garnered support from the states major unions, as well as elderly and Japanese-American voters. While he had to fend off criticism that he offered little in the way of new policy direction, his chances were bolstered by a split opposition: Duke Aiona, a Republican former lieutenant governor, and Mufi Hannemann, a former mayor of Honolulu, who ran as an independent.

title: Toyotas Quarterly Profit Jumps
description: TOKYO  As quarterly earnings surged, Toyota issued a rosier outlook for the year, forecasting record profit on rising sales and a weaker Japanese currency.

title: Iowa Election Highlights
description: State Senator Joni Ernst, a Republican, defeated Representative Bruce Braley, a Democrat, and will take the seat being vacated after 30 years by Senator Tom Harkin, a liberal Democrat and longtime ally of organized labor.

title: Mark Warner Hangs On to Slim Senate Lead in Virginia
description: A Virginia electorate angry at President Obama made its displeasure known on Tuesday, and Mark Warner, the states popular former governor and current Democratic senator, was holding on to a slim lead over his Republican opponent early Wednesday.

title: W.N.B.A. Star Scratched in Knife Attack in China
description: An American basketball star playing in China was assaulted by a man with a knife on Monday but said she was only scratched in the encounter.

title: Cory Gardners Victory Speech
description: Representative Cory Gardner, Republican of Colorado, spoke after defeating Senator Mark Udall.

title: Rick Scotts Victory Speech
description: Gov. Rick Scott, Republican of Florida, spoke after defeating Charlie Crist, a former Republican governor who was running as a Democrat.

title: David Perdues Election Night Speech
description: David Perdue, the Republican Senate candidate from Georgia, defeated the Democrat Michelle Nunn.

title: Joni Ernsts Victory Speech
description: Joni Ernst, Republican of Iowa, spoke after defeating Representative Bruce Braley, a Democrat.

title: Jeanne Shaheens Victory Speech
description: Senator Jeanne Shaheen, Democrat of New Hampshire, spoke after defeating Scott Brown, the Republican candidate.

title: Michelle Nunns Concession Speech
description: Michelle Nunn, the Democratic Senate candidate from Georgia, spoke after being defeated by David Perdue, the Republican candidate.

title: Greg Ormans Concession Speech
description: Greg Orman, the Independent Senate candidate from Kansas, spoke after being defeated by Senator Pat Roberts.

title: Maryland Election Highlights
description: Larry Hogans stunning upset over Lt. Gov. Anthony G. Brown, a Democrat, was the icing on the cake for the Republican Governors Association as most Republican incumbents in other states fended off strong challengers. Though the race was close, with the Democratic Governors Association making a hefty investment to try to protect the seat, Mr. Brown had been expected to win in the state President Obama carried with 62 percent of the vote in 2012.

title: Test Yourself | Taylor Swifts 1989
description: Below are the first six paragraphs of the Oct. 23 music review, A Farewell to Twang.

title: ING Group Moves Up Final Payment of Bailout Money to Dutch Government
description: LONDON  The Dutch financial services firm ING Group said on Wednesday that it would make a final repayment six months earlier than expected of the billions of euros in state aid it received during the financial crisis.

title: Inside the Vigilante Fight Against Boko Haram
description: Long before the Islamist militant group Boko Haram kidnapped nearly 300 schoolgirls from Chibok in April, Abba Aji Kalli watched his country descend into madness. Kalli lives in Maiduguri, a city of more than one million and the capital of Borno State, just 80 miles from Chibok, in Nigerias impoverished northeast. For months before the girls were taken, refugees flooded into Maiduguri, fleeing almost-daily Boko Haram raids on nearby villages. The militants arrived on motorcycles and Toyota Hilux trucks, sometimes in the middle of the night, sometimes in broad daylight, destroying homes and businesses and killing villagers. By May, a month after the kidnappings, the rebels were coming closer, striking surrounding villages and towns. Maiduguri could only be next.

title: Pass Go, Take Pictures
description: Illinois Avenue is the place to go if you want cash for gold  though be advised that the street is now known as Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Boulevard. If your marriage is on the rocks, head over to Pacific Avenue, where A.C. Dolls, a premier gentlemans club, advertises divorce parties. And on Virginia Avenue, there is yet another casino.

title: Would You Want to Be a Space Tourist?
description: Last weeks crash of Virgin Galactics SpaceShipTwo, killing one test pilot and seriously injuring the other, was a new setback for commercial spaceflight. Still, the prospect of space tourism seems quite real.

title: Party Investigators Warn Officials in Zhejiang Province Against Religion
description: Communist Party investigators have warned officials in the eastern province of Zhejiang, where several Christian churches have been demolished or forced to remove prominent crosses over the past year, against practicing religion. The brief message was included in a statement from the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection describing its recent tour of the province.

title: For Israel, Two-State Is No Solution
description: JERUSALEM  Recent events in the Middle East are a reminder of how the old models of peace between Israel and the Palestinians are no longer relevant. The time has come to rethink the two-state solution.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: States Benefiting Most From Obamas Health Law Elected Republicans
description: In places where the uninsured rate plummeted this year, Republicans still scored big electoral victories.

title: New York Today: Political Parties
description: Good morning on this warm Wednesday.

title: District of Columbia Election Highlights
description: The District of Columbia has taken big steps on marijuana policy this year, decriminalizing some possession of the drug last summer before voters on Tuesday approved legalizing it by a wide margin. Adults will be allowed to have up to two ounces of marijuana and cultivate some plants for personal use, though the ballot measure would not permit sales; however, the City Council has already started looking into passing a law that would.

title: Has the World Forgotten the Central African Republic?
description: A forgotten crisis. Thats how the Council on Foreign Relations defines the state of affairs in the Central African Republic  a landlocked stretch of scrubland and dry forest wedged between Chad and the Democratic Republic of Congo.

title: Dannel Malloy, in Repeat, Wins a Close Election for Connecticut Governor
description: By the standards of Connecticuts long-conflicted relationship with Gov. Dannel P. Malloy, the tense wait on Tuesday night for returns in his re-election effort was a cakewalk.

title: The Most Detailed Maps Youll See From the Midterm Senate Elections
description: Maps of precinct-level results from some of the closest Senate races.

title: The Most Detailed Maps Youll See From Yesterdays Senate Elections
description: Maps of precinct-level results from some of the closest Senate races

title: Facing Up to the Reality of a Layoff
description: Once again, we have decisions to make. I have given my latest problem a lot of thought the problem of losing money because we dont really have enough work for about three people.

title: Counting the Varied Costs of Chinas Dependence on Coal
description: The Natural Resources Defense Council has presented research that attempts to take on the Herculean task of quantifying the environmental, social and economic toll of Chinas reliance on coal.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Riding Wave of Discontent, G.O.P. Takes Senate
description: In Riding Wave of Discontent, G.O.P. Takes Senate, Jonathan Weisman and Ashley Parker write about the results and implications of Tuesdays election.

title: 2 Drivers Plow Into Israelis, Fueling Fears of New Palestinian Uprising
description: JERUSALEM  Amid soaring tensions fueled by religious fervor and Palestinian anger over control of East Jerusalem, two drivers on Wednesday plowed their cars into Israelis in separate episodes, killing one police officer and injuring three soldiers.

title: Son of South Korea Ferry Owner Is Convicted of Stealing Millions
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The eldest son of the South Korean business mogul who controlled the company that ran the Sewol ferry, which sank in April, leaving more than 300 people dead, was convicted of embezzlement on Wednesday and sentenced to three years in prison.

title: Carlyle to Buy Dealogic for $700 Million
description: The Carlyle Group and other investors have agreed to buy Dealogic, a software and data company catering to investment banks, for about $700 million.

title: Morning Agenda: Wall St. After G.O.P. Victory
description: Republicans took control of the Senate on Tuesday night and expanded their hold on the House, in a rebuke of President Obama that will reshape the political landscape for his final two years in office, The New York Times writes. Propelled by economic dissatisfaction and anger toward the president, Republicans grabbed Democratic Senate seats in North Carolina, Colorado, Iowa, West Virginia, Arkansas, Montana and South Dakota to gain their first Senate majority since 2006. With at least a nine-seat gain and most likely more, House Republicans will have close to 245 seats, the largest Republican majority since the Truman administration.

title: The Reporter as a Hero, Not a Joke
description: For someone who spent 118 days imprisoned in Iran after reporting on the disputed 2009 election there, Maziar Bahari has a surprising sense of humor about the subject.

title: Today in Politics
description: Special Edition: Washington Wakes to a Republican Reality

title: Daily Clip Report
description: Good morning. Here is Daily Clip Report, a collection of articles about The Times and the media sent by email each morning to senior executives and newsroom editors. The email is produced by the Corporate Communications Department at The Times.

title: James Baldwin, a Stranger and Me
description: Dear Diary:

title: France Approves G.E. Deal for Alstoms Energy Business
description: PARIS  The French government gave formal approval on Wednesday to General Electrics $13.5 billion deal for the energy business of Alstom, the French power and transportation company.

title: Mark Udalls Concession Speech
description: Senator Mark Udall, Democrat of Colorado, spoke after being defeated by Representative Cory Gardner in the race for United States Senate.

title: Kay Hagans Concession Speech
description: Senator Kay Hagan, Democrat of North Carolina, spoke after being defeated by State Representative Thom Tillis. The Senate race was the most expensive in United States history.

title: Mary Landrieus Election Night Speech
description: Incumbent Senator Mary Landrieu, Democrat of Louisiana, spoke after learning that she will face a December runoff against Representative Bill Cassidy.

title: Free of Ebola, Nurses Aide Leaves Spanish Hospital
description: MADRID  A nurses aide who was the first person known to have contracted the Ebola virus outside Africa was released from a Madrid hospital on Wednesday, almost a month after she tested positive for the disease.

title: Thom Tilliss Victory Speech
description: State Representative Thom Tillis, Republican of North Carolina, spoke after defeating Senator Kay Hagan. The Senate race was the most expensive in United States history.

title: The Strange Case of States Penchant for Casinos
description: On Tuesday, voters in five states considered proposals to significantly expand legal gambling and approved three of them. The two defeated proposals, in California and Colorado, had something in common: They faced strong opposition bankrolled by gambling operators that would have competed with the newly authorized gambling.

title: The Tornado Election
description: The clichd term for what happened last night is wave election, but if natural phenomena are going to be evoked, the more accurate expression is tornado election, leading to widespread destruction in weird, jagged patterns that are often difficult to explain when its over.

title: The Restaurant Dishes Come to Your Door
description: The options for people who have no time to cook and dont want to go out to eat every night can be disappointing. A group of entrepreneurs, including David Chang of the Momofuku restaurants, is starting a company that plans to make high-quality restaurant food that it expects to deliver in as little as 15 minutes.

title: The Democrats Southern Problem Reaches a New Depth
description: For decades, Southern Democrats could count on winning local and statewide offices, even though the voters in their states would often withhold support for the Democrat in presidential races. No longer.

title: Time Warner Profit Beats Third-Quarter Estimates
description: Three months after rebuffing Rupert Murdochs takeover effort, Time Warner beat analysts expectations with its third-quarter earnings and revenue, suggesting that the companys insistence on remaining independent may yet reward investors.

title: 1914: Republicans Sweep Elections
description: NEW YORK  The Congressional elections have resulted in what might be properly termed a sharp warning to the Administration of President Wilson. The returns show that the Democratic majority in the House of Representatives will be not more than 21. They will retain the Senate. The present House has a Democratic majority of 115 and is divided as follows: DEMOCRATS  290; REPUBLICANS  127; PROGRESSIVES  18. This means that the Republicans have carried some sixty districts which returned Democratic representatives in 1912. The New York Herald, European Edition, Nov. 6, 1914

title: After Election, Obama Vows to Work With, and Without, Congress
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama shook off an electoral drubbing on Wednesday and said he was eager to find common ground with Republicans during the final two years of his presidency, but he swiftly defied their objections by vowing to bypass Congress and use his executive authority to change the nations immigration system.

title: Christopher Bailey Makes a (Mini) Movie
description: Renaissance men or control freaks?

title: Election 2014: Gun Sense
description: The saddest ritual cycle in modern life is a school shooting. Kids get killed. Yellow ribbons, balloons and guidance counselors appear. Everyone wonders why and how. And then, we shrug and feel helpless that nothing can be done because the all-powerful gun lobby will move mountains to ensure that crazy people can always get a firearm.

title: Election 2014: President Obama Is Not a Happy Warrior
description: I love voting. I love pretty much everything about it. My polling place is and has been for many years the Alfred E. Smith School, P.S. 163, an elementary school. The voting booths are arrayed around a mottled, parquet gym floor, and there are always mothers running a bake sale outside to raise money for the school.

title: 12 Recipes for Pickles, No Canning Required
description: As long as theyre eaten within a week or two, there are countless pickles that you can make quickly and easily.

title: A Writer Is Moved to Learn More About Anne Frank
description: Joseph Berger wrote a piece today about Anne Franks surviving relatives and friends, and how, on notable anniversary dates, they are invited to talk about the young woman they knew and about their own often harrowing stories. He explains what drew him to the story.

title: Bryan Ferry Reflects on Some of His Album Art
description: Music has to take you to another place, capture some particular mood, so it just seems crazy to not get involved in the visuals, says Bryan Ferry who, as both a solo artist and the frontman of Roxy Music, has been behind some of the most influential music  and album covers  of our time. A former student of the English Pop artist Richard Hamilton and a noted aesthete (not for nothing did he name his 1978 release The Bride Stripped Bare, after a Marcel Duchamp masterwork), Ferry has overseen every aspect of the imagery that has defined his career. That tradition has endured all the way up to Avonmore, his latest solo release, which features an old portrait of the 69-year-old Brit.

title: How an Entrepreneur Learned to Sell Quinoa in the Land of Grits
description: In 1985, after many years in the fast-food business, Richard Thomas took a 180-degree turn and opened a health food restaurant, R. Thomas Deluxe Grill, on Peachtree Street in Atlanta. It struggled for 10 years, and then it became a local institution.

title: 1964: Are Big Hairdos Out of Style?
description: NEW YORK  Everybody knows that the big hairdo has been out of style for at least a year. Out, my eye. You have only to look around the restaurants at noon, or the charity halls at night to see how far in it still is. The evening hairdos are bigger and more imposing than ever. Naturally, theyre a bit different. The do happens at the back of the head, where there are all kinds of things like puffy chignons, lacquered curls, ringlets like the Empress Eugenie, feathers, flowers or what not. A girl with an un-trimmed head looks like a sparrow among the peacocks.  By Eugenia Sheppard for the New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Nov. 6, 1964

title: Audi Recalls 102,000 Cars for Airbag Defect
description: Audi is recalling almost 102,000 A4 and S4 sedans and Allroad station wagons from the 2013-15 model years because a software problem could cause the front airbag to malfunction, according to a report the automaker posted Wednesday on the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration website.

title: Digging to Freedom
description: The 25th anniversary of the fall of the Berlin Wall would hardly seem the occasion for an entrancing picture book, but the British author-illustrator Tom Clohosy Coles Wall is just that. The narrator is a little boy stuck in East Berlin with his mother and sister, while his father has ended up in the West. Out of this wrenching scenario Cole has fashioned a tight little narrative that has all the ambient foreboding of a fairy tale, the sense of children at the mercy of enormous, irrational, half-understood forces. But with a morose, shadowy palette of midnight blues and browns and a flat, elongated look that calls to mind Cold War poster art, its clear that the evil lurking is a distinctly modern one: jackboots and rifles, not malevolent spells, but whats the difference to a child whose parent has been taken away?

title: Raising Invisible Kids: Not Everyone Needs to Be Famous
description: From the oft-lamented explosion of reality TV to the social media platforms nearly all of us participate in, we are in the age of the over-share. The message today is that recognition equals value, attention equals success.

title: Kuwaiti Released From Guantnamo Under New Review System
description: WASHINGTON  A Kuwaiti man held by the United States without trial for nearly 13 years in Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, was released early Wednesday, the military said. His repatriation was the first transfer to result from a new system of parole-board-like hearings to periodically review whether it is still necessary to keep holding prisoners.

title: Quiet Island, With Change Coming
description: When Yarin and Talia Katz first came to the United States from Israel, they spent a year sampling various parts of New York City and New Jersey with monthly rentals. In 2011, when they were ready to settle down, Mr. Katz said, We pretty much knew we wanted to move to Roosevelt Island.

title: Artificial Intelligence as a Threat
description: Ebola sounds like the stuff of nightmares. Bird flu and SARS also send shivers down my spine. But Ill tell you what scares me most: artificial intelligence.

title: What Democrats Dont Get About the Minimum Wage
description: Democrats have greatly misunderstood the politics of the minimum wage in a way that hurt them in the 2014 elections.

title: Gigi Jordan Convicted of Manslaughter, Not Murder, in Sons Killing
description: It was, to say the least, an unusual murder defense.

title: Aftermath of Attack in Jerusalem
description: A witness and a spokesman for the Israeli police described the scene after a Palestinian man rammed his car into people near a light-rail station in Jerusalem on Wednesday.

title: A Dive Into Darkness
description: Wolverine seems ageless, but Hugh Jackman is definitely aging.

title: What You Get for ... $1,700,000
description: LITCHFIELD, CONN.

title: Bound for Pluto, Carrying Memories of Triton
description: On Aug. 25, 1989, the Voyager 2 spacecraft slipped over the north pole of Neptune, then the most distant planet in the solar system, swerved south at Neptunes big moon Triton and left the known worlds forever.

title: A Captured Ice Moon
description: Neptunes moon Triton was the last stop on Voyager 2s tour of the outer planets. It is one of the coldest objects in the solar system and a big brother of Pluto, which NASA will visit next year.

title: Lydie Salvayre Is Awarded Goncourt Prize
description: PARIS  The writer Lydie Salvayre, the daughter of Spanish exiles, on Wednesday won Frances most prestigious literary award,the Goncourt Prize, for a novel set in the first summer of the Spanish Civil War.

title: Washington Election Highlights
description: With no governor to elect nor Senate seat to fill, it was a pair of conflicting ballot measures regulating background checks for firearms that drew attention and quite a bit of outside money during this campaign season.

title: A Celebration of E. B. White at Symphony Space
description: A starry roster of film, television and theater actors  including Naomi Watts, David Hyde Pierce, Liev Schreiber, Michael Potts and Jane Curtin  will read from E. B. Whites stories and poetry at Symphony Space on Nov. 16. The program, Terrific Tails: A Celebration of E. B. White, is a collaboration between Symphony Space; the Manhattan branch of First Book, an organization that provides new books to disadvantaged children; and Harper Collins.

title: Newly Empowered, Mitch McConnell Promises an End to Gridlock
description: Fresh from his own re-election victory and his partys powerful showing nationwide, Senator Mitch McConnell on Wednesday pledged to break the stalemate in Washington as newly empowered congressional Republicans moved quickly to demonstrate that they can get things done. Were going to pass legislation, Mr. McConnell said at a news conference in Louisville, Ky. This gridlock and dysfunction can be ended.

title: Lessons for Obamas Final Two Years From Reagan, Clinton and Bush
description: A president in the final two years of an eight-year run in the White House. Congress held by an opposing party that loathes the occupant of 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue. A staff that is depleted and exhausted by six-plus years of governing.

title: House Hunting in ... New Zealand
description: A FOUR-BEDROOM CONTEMPORARY WITH VIEWS OF WELLINGTON HARBOR

title: G.O.P. Leaders New Role Could Take Strained White House Ties to Next Level
description: After Oval Office meetings with the four congressional leaders, President Obama has often turned to his staff and asked of the Senate minority leader, Mitch McConnell, What angle do you think hes playing?

title: Why Elections Make Us Miserable (for a Little While)
description: If Tuesdays election didnt go the way you hoped, you might assume that those of the opposite political persuasion are as gleeful right now as you are despondent. But that may not be the case: A new study suggests that elections bum out their losers far more than they cheer up their winners, and its findings may have implications for the ways campaigns try to win us over.

title: Lacma Gala Honors Quentin Tarantino and Barbara Kruger
description: LOS ANGELES  Id rather go to hell than have my picture taken, the artist Barbara Kruger said over cocktails at the annual Art & Film gala last Saturday to benefit the Los Angeles County Museum of Art, otherwise known as Lacma.

title: A Hotel Week for Los Angeles
description: As the season of mad discounts approaches, travelers can once again look to Hotel Week N.Y.C. for a chance to score a cheaper stay in one of the citys finer establishments.

title: In Brooklyn, Never-Before-Seen Warhol Films Meet Titans of Indie Rock
description: A lot of people think of early Warhol films as being minimal, says Geralyn Huxley, a film curator at the Andy Warhol Museum in Pittsburgh. Specifically, she is referring to Exposed: Songs for Unseen Warhol Films, a multimedia program of 15 of Andy Warhols never-before-screened films set to live music by Tom Verlaine, Dean Wareham, Martin Rev, Eleanor Friedberger and Bradford Cox. After stops across the country, the show is being presented at BAM this Thursday, Friday and Saturday. Huxley notes that many of Warhols films were actually really personal: hed go to downtown theater performances and film them, or hed film dinner parties he went to, she says. Later on, he always carried a Polaroid camera, a tape recorder. He was interested in recording everything he could.

title: Formula One in Crisis Mode
description: Once again, Formula One, the worlds leading global auto-racing series, rescued itself from a controversial week with its performance on the track at the U.S. Grand Prix in Texas last weekend.

title: As Other Democrats Fall, Colorado Governor Goes From Angst to Relief
description: DENVER  It was getting late on election night, and Gov. John W. Hickenlooper was trailing. Colorados senior United States senator, Mark Udall, had already conceded defeat, and other Democratic politicians were falling here and across the country. Political allies reported encouraging signs  long lines at college-town polling sites, strong support in Colorados suburban counties  but it was never supposed to be this close for Mr. Hickenlooper, a governor who had cast himself as a moderate, pro-energy Democrat at the helm of a growing Western economy.

title: Ted Kennedy Jr. Wins State Senate Race in Connecticut
description: Connecticut finally got a Kennedy of its own on Tuesday night when Ted Kennedy Jr., the 53-year-old son of the former United States senator from Massachusetts, overcame opposition over the novel way his race was financed and won his bid to become a state senator representing Branford and five other towns east of New Haven.

title: Ebola-Free Spanish Nurse Speaks Out
description: Mara Teresa Romero Ramos, a Spanish auxiliary nurse who was the first person to be infected by Ebola outside of Africa, spoke after she was released from Carlos III hospital in Madrid.

title: Timepieces That Connect With a History of Exploration
description: LOS ANGELES  A rowboat in the middle of the Pacific Ocean is not the most festive place to celebrate a 30th birthday, but Alex Bellini made the most of it. I enjoyed a full panettone by myself, he said, recalling the sweet bread from his native Italy that helped distinguish Sept. 15, 2008, from the 293 other days he spent alone at sea.

title: Boutique Brands in Japan Keep Independent Watchmaking Alive
description: KYOTO, Japan  In a wooden house on a narrow lane of Kyotos Gion district, a place of cherry blossoms and strolling geisha, artisans craft delicate, colorful designs for the watchmaker Dedegumo.

title: Outside Groups With Deep Pockets Lift G.O.P.
description: Last fall, Steven Law, the president of the nations largest Republican super PAC, met with two of his partys biggest donors in a Houston office. Both had given generously to Mr. Laws organization, American Crossroads, and other Republican outside groups in 2012, when they spent more than $700 million but failed to defeat President Obama or flip the Senate to Republican control. The donors were polite but incredulous.

title: Business Leaders Cautiously Expect G.O.P. Win to Open Some Doors
description: After years of gridlock in Washington, American business is gearing up for a major push on long-sought goals like an overhaul of the corporate tax system, building the Keystone XL oil pipeline, lighter environmental and financial regulation and winning congressional backing for trade deals with Asia and Europe. Business interests face a much more receptive audience now that Republicans are poised to control both the House and Senate next year.

title: Festive Host, Fervent Fans and Historic Race in Brazil
description: The Brazilian Grand Prix, held near So Paulo, is one of the most celebrated, festive and historic races on the Formula One calendar. The Brazilian fans are enthusiastic, making for a major event every time the race comes to the Interlagos circuit, with Brazilian flags waving and spectators descending on the circuit in hordes.

title: Cant Afford a Giacometti Sculpture? Theres Always the C.I.A.s bin Laden Action Figure
description: In the years after the 9/11 attacks the Central Intelligence Agency searched for novel ways to combat the threat of international terrorism. Some were more novel than others, and none more so than the agencys partnership with Don Levine, the retired head of research and development at the toy company Hasbro and the creator of G.I. Joe.

title: Jay Z Acquires Luxury Champagne Brand Armand de Brignac
description: In his song, Young Forever, Jay Z envisions a life where you never get old and the Champagnes always cold. He may not be able to do much about aging, but he may be able to help with the chilled bubbly.

title: California Election Highlights
description: Jerry Brown easily won re-election, defeating Neel Kashkari  the little-known and underfunded Republican who is a former Goldman Sachs banker and Treasury official. Mr. Brown, 76, was seeking his second consecutive term as governor; the states term limits bar him from serving a third. He also served as Californias governor in the 1970s.

title: Paid Sick Leave: On Four Ballots, and Undefeated
description: Families in one state and three municipalities were big winners in last nights elections in one respect: paid sick leave. On the ballot in Massachusetts as well as in Trenton and Montclair, N.J., and Oakland, Calif., (where a new law will expand the existing state requirements), paid sick leave won all four times.

title: Truck Sales Help Profit Rise 32% at Chrysler
description: DETROIT  Lifted by surging demand for its trucks and sport utility vehicles, net income at Chrysler jumped 32 percent in the third quarter, the company reported on Wednesday.

title: Workday to Put Employees Through a Big Data Analysis
description: Dont be afraid (yet) but big data is coming to your job. While it is unclear whether it will make life better or worse, it is almost certain to change the way companies function.

title: Exponential Outbreaks: The Mathematics of Epidemics
description: Note: We have published two additional lessons about the Ebola virus in West Africa and the United States.

title: Goldman Sachs Sells $285 Million in Hedge Fund Holdings
description: Goldman Sachs is continuing to sell off its hedge fund holdings, including $285 million during the third quarter of this year, as the start date for the Volcker Rule draws closer.

title: Voices of Privilege, Deconstructed
description: Do you really want to know what Young Jean Lees new play, Straight White Men, is about? You have a clue right there in the title, and if you are someone who is remotely theater savvy, you probably already know that Ms. Lee, who usually directs her own plays, is a formally daring and intellectually curious experimentalist with an interest in identity and the limits and uses of showmanship.

title: Alex Rodriguez Told Federal Agents of Doping in Bosch Case, Report Says
description: Last November, Alex Rodriguez, in a bitter dispute with Major League Baseball, took to the radio to dispute allegations that he had used performance-enhancing drugs supplied by a South Florida clinic.

title: The President In His Labyrinth
description: As we await an official presidential response to last nights Democratic debacle, here are two quotes that seem likely to frame the political classs discussion ofhow the president might respond. First, from Politico, days before the drubbing, when the White House could still hope for just a modest setback at the polls:

title: Fossils Unusual Size and Location Offer Clues in Evolution of Mammals
description: Four years ago, while searching for fish fossils on Madagascar, paleontologists came upon what proved to be a well-preserved cranium of a mammal that lived about 66 million to 70 million years ago, in the closing epoch of the mighty dinosaurs.

title: 36 Hours in Tulum, Mexico
description: Explore street view, find our points of interest and sign in to your Google account to save your map.

title: 36 Hours in Tulum, Mexico
description: Once a laid-back resort village with a hippie vibe, Tulums pace has quickened, with new shops, restaurants and nightlife options complementing the broad white beaches and yoga retreats.

title: 36 Horas en Tulum
description: Un pueblo tranquilo con un ambiente hippie, el ritmo de Tulum se ha acelerado, con nuevas tiendas , restaurantes y retiros de yoga al lado de la playa.

title: Today in Small Business: Election Fallout
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: 36 Hours in Tulum, Mexico
description: The good news is that you still cant flush the toilet paper in Tulum. The plumbing, like the balmy weather and a tenacious iguana population, is deeply rooted in the identity of this town an hour and a half south of Cancn. But even a quasi-functional plumbing infrastructure cant dissuade tourists. Which leads me to the less good news. If you havent been to Tulum in the last few years, a heads-up: Its a whole lot bigger than you remember. Todays Tulum has three things many never thought possible: traffic, crowds and restaurants with waiting lists. But dont despair. In fact, the town (its not a village anymore) is more exciting than ever. The beach is still stunning. The ruins are still there. The food is spicy and authentic. And for those willing, there are secret gems a long, dusty way from the beaten path.

title: Classical Playlist: Carl Nielsen, Lou Harrison, Bach and More
description: LOU HARRISON: La Koro Sutro and Suite for Violin with American GamelanBoston Modern Orchestra Project, Gil Rose, conductor; Gabriela Diaz, violinist; Providence Singers(BMOP/sound 1037)The American maverick composer Lou Harrison (1917-2003), like his colleague John Cage, was a pioneering explorer of Asian music. He was also an innovative builder of instruments. He and his lifelong partner, Bill Colvig, built sets of tuned percussion instruments that they called the American gamelan. This rewarding new recording offers a captivating performance of a Harrison masterpiece for this instrument, the Suite for Violin with American Gamelan, with the fine violinist Gabriela Diaz as soloist. The other enticement here is Harrisons beguiling, delicate, melodically haunting La Koro Sutro, a setting of an Esperanto adaptation of the traditional Buddhist text the Heart Sutra, with the Providence Singers. This piece ends in a glorious burst of musical joy. (Anthony Tommasini)

title: Amy Chozick Looks Ahead to 2016
description: The reporter Amy Chozick of The Times discussed the impact of Tuesdays midterm results on the 2016 presidential election on MSNBCs The Daily Rundown.

title: A New Face on the End-of-Life Debate
description: The two videos in which Brittany Maynard explained her decision to end her life under Oregons Death With Dignity Act put a human face  and a very young one  on a sometimes abstract debate.

title: What Does It Take to Sell Quinoa in the Land of Grits?
description: Richard Thomas got the idea to open a health food restaurant after traveling around California, where he sampled the menus of the kinds of places that were not easily found in the South in the 1980s. Later, he was further motivated when he met a nutritional consultant, Donna Gates, author of The Body Ecology Diet, who told him that he had been poisoning people with his fried food.

title: Connecticut Election Highlights
description: Gov. Dannel P. Malloy, a Democrat, battled through the most hotly contested race in the state to win re-election, beating back an intense challenge from Thomas C. Foley, a Republican. The race was a replay of the 2010 contest, in which Mr. Malloy beat Mr. Foley by only a few thousand votes.

title: Behind the Elections Stunning Visual Elements
description: The Graphics and Interactive News desks rolled out some new visual elements as part of The Timess midterm election coverage that have been months in the planning. Steve Duenes, the graphics director, describes some of them.

title: How to See a Full Web Address on the Safari Browser
