description: Q. Ever since I upgraded my Mac to OS X Yosemite, the Safari browser does not display the full web address of the sites I visit. I like to know the exact page Im on, so is there a way to extend the abbreviated addresses that are shown at the top of the window?

title: Milan Time: A Historical Tale of Night and Day
description: What are great cities without people? The photographer Alessandro Grassani finds the citys geometry after the streets start emptying.

title: The Eczema and Broken Bone Connection
description: People with eczema, a skin condition marked by itching, irritation and rashes, have another problem to add to the list: A new study suggests that they are more likely to suffer broken bones and other joint-and-bone injuries.

title: Herms Scarves Form Basis for Limited Edition Wristwear
description: LONDON  Princess Grace of Monaco, Audrey Hepburn and Queen Elizabeth II are known for their very different senses of style, but one fashion accessory unites them: the Herms scarf.

title: Patek Philippe Celebrates 175th Anniversary in Style
description: GENEVA  If guests at Patek Philippes 175th anniversary gala in mid-October were expecting a sedate celebration, in keeping with the watchmakers reputation for maintaining a low profile, they may have been surprised to find themselves witnesses to a spectacle.

title: How Will Apples Smart Watch Affect the Industry?
description: What does Apples smart watch, to be released early next year, mean for the traditional watch industry? The Harvard Business School professor Ryan Raffaelli, who recently argued on his blog that the Apple device could be more of a boost than a threat, discussed it with Jake Cigainero.

title: Watchmakers Turn to 3-D Printing
description: A small French watch brand has developed a way to use 3-D printing technology to make artistic watch faces for Swiss-made timepieces.

title: Bringing Old Watch Brands Out of Obscurity
description: PARIS  In the world of luxury brands, history can be a useful tool to fashion the revival of an extinct name.

title: The Republican Party In Triumph
description: David Brooks: Well, that was pretty much a complete drubbing.

title: At Future Cornell Campus, the First Step in Restoring Murals Is Finding Them
description: Cornell University and its conservators faced a lot of challenges rescuing three rare 7-by-50-foot murals from the Goldwater Memorial Hospital on Roosevelt Island.

title: New House Will Be More Conservative, and More Liberal
description: Conservatives in the next House of Representatives will be more conservative and its liberals more liberal.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Sales of Taylor Swifts 1989 Intensify Streaming Debate
description: Taylor Swift has proved herself a music phenomenon on more than one front, scoring the fastest-selling album in 12 years and adding new fire to the industry debate on streaming music.

title: Obama Requests $6 Billion for Ebola
description: President Obama is asking Congress for just over $6 billion in emergency funding to combat Ebola in West Africa and protect Americans from the virus in the United States, an administration official said Wednesday.

title: New York City Elects a Republican Under Federal Indictment
description: It turns out that even a 20-count federal indictment did not stop New York voters from re-electing Representative Michael Grimm of Staten Island.Mr. Grimm, a Republican, easily beat former City Councilman Domenic Recchia, a workaday Democrat who would have done the job in Congress with a lot less bluster.At least he probably wouldnt threaten to throw a reporter off a balcony, as Mr. Grimmdid earlier this year.

title: Next Steps for Victorious Republicans
description: While the Republican victories in Tuesdays midterm elections said a lot about the national mood and priorities, they also raised new questions about how the parties will govern and the political landscape as they enter the next election cycle. A few of those are below.

title: Carlyles Purchase of Dealogic Shows It Pays to Sell Shovels in Merger Gold Rush
description: In a gold rush, it pays to sell the shovels.

title: Wheelies: The No Thanks, Chevrolet Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: William Bratton Names a New Deputy for the New York Police Department Amid Scrutiny
description: After days of controversy over the No. 2 post at the New York Police Department, Commissioner William J. Bratton on Wednesday named his new pick for the job of first deputy commissioner.

title: A Soulful Piano Ballad From New Yorks New Chanteuse to Watch
description: The official website of the Brooklyn-based singer-songwriter Hayley Coupon is a purposefully minimalist statement. On it are the musicians name in script, a SoundCloud embed of her latest single, email listings for press inquiries and bookings, three candid photographs and four social media links, one of which leads to a private Instagram account. In an era of digital oversharing, Coupon prefers to let her work speak for itself. I dont tend to offer up a lot of personal information, even to close friends, she says of her sparse online presence, which mirrors her passion for purity and directness in songwriting. She quotes Joni Mitchell: Dont muddy the waters to make them seem deep.

title: A Maddening Bargain With a Mexican Police Officer
description: I should have known that renting a car in Mexico was a bad idea. Before I had my keys in hand, the price had doubled.

title: Globe Theater to Offer Streaming Shakespeare
description: Some 50 productions filmed in performance at Shakespeares Globe Theater will be available to watch online, the theater announced on Tuesday. Homegrown productions, like an all-male Twelfth Night with Mark Rylance and Stephen Fry, as well as 35 foreign-language productions that were part of the Globe to Globe festival during the 2012 Cultural Olympics will be offered. Each film costs about $6.50 to rent or $13 to buy.

title: Driven | 2015 Mercedes-Benz S550 4Matic
description: A stately luxury sedan with silky driving dynamics thats more than the sum of its premium parts.

title: Midterm Political Ads That Worked, and Why
description: Tuesday night, Joni Ernst of Iowa won her Senate race, and in her acceptance speech she said she was going to go to Washington and make 'em squeal! The line referred to her famous hog-castration campaign ad, Squeal, which introduced her as a Senate candidate to the state and the nation almost eight months ago.

title: Video: The 2015 S550 4Matic Is Mercedess Sedan for the Boardroom
description: If youre not collecting big paychecks, nothing says You need to find a better-paying job the way a Mercedes-Benz S550 does. The $95,325 starting price of an S-Class is three times the cost of an average automobile. The version I tested was even more expensive, with options that drove up the price to nearly $129,000. If that seems extravagant, its 12-cylinder big brother, the S600, starts at $167,000.

title: Roger Goodell Testifies at Ray Rices Appeal Hearing
description: N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell was among several people who testified Wednesday at Ray Rices appeal of his indefinite suspension. The hearing, held in front of an arbitrator, was expected to last at least another day.

title: Voters Know Themselves Better Than the Pollsters Do
description: Yesterdays elections provide further ammunition for the idea that we should pay less attention to polls of voters intentions, and more to polls asking them who they think will win.

title: Fall of the Banner Ad: The Monster That Swallowed the Web
description: Twenty years ago last month, a team of well-meaning designers, coders and magazine publishers inadvertently unleashed on an unsuspecting world one of the most misguided and destructive technologies of the Internet age: the web banner ad.

title: While Some Parents Volunteer Too Much, Others Feel Excluded
description: This past September, just as Ive done every September for the last few years, I signed up for the PTA. But this year, I told myself things would be different. I would go to every single meeting.

title: Anatomy of a Number | Found
description: Eli Bolin, who wrote the music and lyrics for the musical Found, talks about how boxing and calypso music inspired the song Cats Are Cats. The show closed on Nov. 9 at the Atlantic Theater.

title: Drop in Democratic Turnout Was the Difference in the Maryland Governors Race
description: How did Larry Hogan, a Republican commercial real estate broker who had never run for office, pull off such an upset in Marylands governor race on Tuesday? By benefiting from a huge drop-off in Democratic turnout in the states largest population centers and winning big where it counts for Republicans.

title: For Steve Israel, Democrat Charged With Protecting House Seats, a Rout Hits Close to Home
description: Over the last six months, Steve Israel, the Long Island congressman in charge of defending Democratic House seats from the coming Republican onslaught, used his phone to call candidates, email donors and type 40,000 words of his second novel, a sendup of National Rifle Association lobbyists titled Big Guns.

title: Choosing Our Coalitions
description: Both of my two post-election posts so far have focused on the role of chance and political agency, as opposed to just grinding demographic forces, in shaping our politics, and now Im going to go three for three by saying something about the idea that were stuck in what Voxs Matt Yglesias (or at least his headline) rather vividly describes as a meaningless, demographically driven seesaw, pitting one coalition optimized for midterms against another optimized for presidential elections, with no end in sight.

title: Justices Consider Whether Tossing Out Fish Destroyed Records
description: WASHINGTON  Most of the justices seemed troubled by Supreme Court arguments on Wednesday about the prosecution of a Florida fisherman for throwing three undersize red grouper back into the Gulf of Mexico.

title: Hold the Phone: Theres Breaking News!
description: NEWS flash: The news industry is changing faster than ever nowadays. Smartphone and tablet apps have given news-hungry consumers a whole new way to discover what is going on nearby and around the world. With apps always connected to the Internet, you can also argue that news breaks faster than it ever has.

title: App Smart | News You Can Use
description: The news industry is changing faster than ever. Kit Eaton reviews three apps that help you stay on top of current events.

title: Style in Carnegie Hill, Manhattan
description: Agostino Magni was recently perusing the Carnegie Hill neighborhood in Manhattan for an apartment, planning a move from Italy, his home country. He was wearing a custom blazer, a shirt monogrammed with his initials, and Zara pants paired with Churchs shoes and a camouflage Prada bag. Mr. Magni describes his style as formal and elegant with touches of fun in his accent accessories. Im not scared to wear stripes or polka dots or crazy colors, he said. This interview has been edited and condensed.

title: Colon Cancer Rates Rising in Young Adults
description: Incidences of colorectal cancer have been decreasing by about 1 percent a year since the mid 1980s, but incidences among people under 50  the recommended screening age  has been increasing sharply, and these younger patients are more likely to present with advanced disease.

title: The Daily Gift: A One-of-a-Kind Handmade Knife
description: Each day until Christmas, the editors of T share a new holiday gift idea.

title: Hundreds of Companies Seen Cutting Tax Bills by Sending Money Through Luxembourg
description: BRUSSELS  The list of multinational businesses accused of using European jurisdictions to cut their tax bills grew much longer on Wednesday when a group of investigative reporters published findings accusing more than 300 companies, including PepsiCo, Ikea and FedEx, of benefiting from preferential deals with the government of Luxembourg.

title: Carmelo Anthony Cannot Pick Up Slack With J. R. Smith Suspended
description: AUBURN HILLS, Mich.  The early season is proving to be a time of adjustment for the Knicks  a time to try to master the triangle offense and to work with a new coach.

title: A Touch of Brooklyn in ... Ridgewood, Queens?
description: Old world Bavarian charm was abundant in Gottscheer Hall, a community hub in Ridgewood, Queens, that celebrated its 90th anniversary in early October. Children wore lederhosen and dirndls. A trio played trumpets and accordions. German septuagenarians in suspenders and polka dots swayed beneath tiered chandeliers.

title: Digging Deep Into an Alter Ego
description: To prepare for the role of Noni, a hip-hop vixen teetering on the divide between superstardom and destruction in the film Beyond the Lights, Gugu Mbatha-Raw researched Rihanna and Beyonc, went backstage at the Grammys, recorded with the producer The-Dream and learned to grind at Greystone Manor, the Los Angeles nightclub. So when it came time to dance, sing and swagger for the big screen, that was all her alter ego. I think in my mind I was Noni, she said. Directed by Gina Prince-Bythewood (The Secret Life of Bees), the film traces Nonis struggle  aided by a quietly debonair police officer (Nate Parker)  to escape the manipulations of her momager (Minnie Driver), snip out her weave and trade explicit lyrics for the aching melodies of Nina Simone.

title: From a Billowing Sound to an Ornamental Wisp
description: Nine days after seizing Carnegie Halls stage as a formidable sorceress in the title role of Handels Alcina, and six after singing the national anthem before Game 7 of the World Series, the endearing mezzo-soprano Joyce DiDonato returned to Carnegie on Tuesday evening in a gentler vein.

title: A Cross-Dressing Tour Guide in White Tie and Tails
description: To watch Patti LuPone sing Surabaya Johnny, the great Brecht-Weill song from the musical Happy End, is to watch a performer dive into the muck of one of the most desperate musical harangues by an abused woman ever written. Because an attitude of defiance seems encoded in Ms. LuPones DNA, the characters confession of erotic enslavement to a contemptuous stud is all the more disturbing.

title: One Factor Blunting Impact of Green Spending on Election: Inertia
description: After the Republican success in the mid-term elections, its no surprise that a search of Twitter for Steyer election Koch  meaning for discussions of the relative impact of the millions spent on campaigns by the liberal billionaire Tom Steyer and the conservative Koch brothers  turns up a lot of heated assertions.

title: Anatomy of a Number: Found
description: In the Anatomy of a Number video series, musical theater makers talk about the elements that inspired a song from their show.

title: Jalopnik Film Festival to Hold Car Show in Williamsburg
description: Its time again for the Jalopnik Film Festival, and although tickets for the screening have sold out, the online curator of automotive quirk will be holding other events in conjunction with the films Thursday night.

title: CFDA/Vogue Fashion Fund Picks Paul Andrew as Winner
description: A little before 8 p.m. on Monday, Seth Meyers was holding court at the annual CFDA/Vogue Fashion Fund dinner at Spring Studios. Mr. Meyers is a regular at fashion events; he hosted the CFDA awards (a different event from this one) and the FIT Couture Council luncheon. But the fashion crowd can be tricky.

title: Karen Finley: Keeping Her Clothes on but Still Causing a Stir
description: I want to start bartending, the performance artist Karen Finley said, and her friend Chip Duckett, an events promoter and publicist, jumped right in. Come over to my house, he said. Im tired of pouring my own drinks.

title: G.O.P.s Inroads With Latinos Hint at a Path for 2016
description: Hispanics voted nearly two to one for Democratic candidates on Tuesday just as they did in the 2010 midterm elections, a national exit poll shows. In a number of key races, however, they voted more heavily Republican, pointing to a strategy for Republicans in the presidential contest in 2016.

title: When a Stranger Delivers Your Texts
description: If you find texting just too simple and predictable (if youre not, that is, spending a lot of time on text exegesis), Miranda July has an app for you.

title: Compression Socks and Hose Are No Longer for Grandma
description: Even though she wears granny tights, Jamie Rubin, 43, fits no ones definition of dowdy.

title: N.C.A.A. Questioned Its Authority in Penalizing Penn State
description: Emails released as part of a lawsuit reveal that N.C.A.A. officials were unsure of their own authority to penalize Penn State in the wake of the Jerry Sandusky child sexual-abuse scandal. In one email, an official said that she told the N.C.A.A.s president, Mark Emmert, that sanctions would be a bluff and that he basically agreed.

title: Funding Is Restored for Storied California Observatory
description: A year after the University of California announced that it would phase out all funding for its storied Lick Observatory, sparking fears that the observatory could close if it could not find outside support, the university said on Tuesday that it had changed its mind.

title: Season of Big Book Advances Includes a Reporter
description: Big book advances are back. Diana Gabaldon got more than $6 million for the ninth novel in her Outlander series. On Monday, Publishers Marketplace reported that Ecco paid $3 million or more for Charles Fraziers fourth novel. And during an acquisitions frenzy leading up to the Frankfurt Book Fair last month, Random House signed two seven-figure deals with debut novelists, including 25-year-old Emma Cline, who got a three-book deal worth $2 million.

title: The Best Eyeliners for Smoky Eyes
description: Makeup trends come and go, but darkly shadowed bedroom eyes are as evergreen as red lips. (Just be wary of wearing them together.) If your eyelids are at all like mine, however  as oily as grunge hair  shadows and liners can slip and slide into raccoon territory. Below, some indefatigable finds that will last day to night.

title: Choreographed Anecdotes in a New York Minute
description: What does one minute feel like?

title: W Hotels to Return to Australia
description: W Hotels is planning a return to Australia. The Starwood brand plans to open a W Brisbane in Queensland in 2018, with a full line-up of luxury amenities.

title: A Closer Look at Sexual Dysfunction in China
description: Shortly before Mens Health Day on Oct. 28, reports of a new study of sex in China, presented in jokey and sympathetic language, raced through the Internet.

title: Where Might Obama and the G.O.P. Agree? Here Are Possibilities
description: Now that Republicans are set to control both houses of Congress, the great question is: What will they do with it?

title: Firm Associated With Dominique Strauss-Kahn Declares Insolvency
description: LONDON  The Luxembourg investment firm formerly associated with Dominique Strauss-Kahn was declared insolvent on Wednesday after the apparent suicide of his business partner last month and the discovery of previously unknown financial commitments, according to a statement issued by the companys board of directors.

title: Augmenting Your Password-Protected World
description: A USERNAME and password combination has long been the standard security mechanism for online accounts. But that method just isnt cutting it anymore.

title: How to Create a Secure Password
description: Four easy tips to protect your digital accounts from the next breach.

title: Fantasy Football: Week 10 Matchup Breakdown
description: Have you given up on Falcons receiver Julio Jones?

title: Political Feud Weakens Coalition in Georgia
description: MOSCOW  The Free Democrats, a pro-Western political party, abandoned Georgias governing coalition on Wednesday, deepening a political crisis in the former Soviet republic that critics fear may slow the countrys path toward integration with the West.

title: Ford Shows Off the All-Aluminum F-150
description: Ford made a big splash at the Detroit auto show in January when it introduced its redesigned, mostly aluminum F-150 pickup truck. Now, the automaker is sending the truck, which it says is 700 pounds lighter than the outgoing model, around the country to give journalists and dealers a closer look.

title: Pictures of the Day: Israel and Elsewhere
description: Israel and More  Pictures of the Day

title: E.J. Manuels Stock Is Sagging, but Buffalo Bills Quarterback Is Fearless
description: It happens all the time in the corporate world: Chief executives, when their stock price is down, will try to reassure anxious shareholders by pitching them on the companys future potential.

title: A Tale Outsmarting Itself,  la Hitchcock
description: Gesture and choreographic structures may not be the first things one notices in a Hitchcock movie. But the right choreographer can unearth a vast inventory of both. In Actual Size, which had its premiere on Tuesday at Roulette, Sally Silvers expertly plunders the Master of Suspense to construct her own kind of thriller: mischievous, furtive and constantly changing, exposing and exploiting the absurdities of the genre.

title: Soviet-Era Engine Is Blamed for Antares Rocket Explosion
description: Substantiating suspicions right after the spectacular fireball that destroyed a rocket carrying cargo to the International Space Station,the manufacturer of the rocket saidWednesdaythat the fault most likely layin Soviet-era rocket engines that powered the first stage.

title: Finding Election Day Solace in Ronan Farrows T-Shirt
description: Nothing like a little unexpected eye candy to brighten up what was  for some voters, at least  an otherwise gloomy election night. As news sites like The Atlantic, CNN, FiveThirtyEight and Politico recorded the results of one Republican win after another (Joni Ernst in Iowa, Tom Cotton in Arkansas, Rick Scott in Florida), some people clearly unhappy with those results found solace in Ronan Farrows lithe figure. Early in the evening, Mr. Farrow, the MSNBC host, posted on Instagram a picture of himself at a Connecticut polling station dressed fetchingly in a white form-fitting V-neck T-shirt  a photo that quickly went viral on Twitter.

title: Nov. 5, 2014  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Israel, Algeria, Russia and the United States.

title: Trying to Shatter Ceiling in Online Art Auctions
description: As art collectors gather in New York this week for the glittering fall auctions, works of art will routinely change hands for tens of millions of dollars, a few for much more, like a Giacometti bronze Chariot sculpture that sold for nearly $101 million at Sothebys on Tuesday evening.

title: A Mosquito-Borne Virus Sweeps the Caribbean
description: It started with a nagging pain in his wrists.

title: Citing Volatility, Lawmakers in Lebanon Vote to Extend Their Term
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Members of Lebanons Parliament voted by a large margin on Wednesday to extend their own terms in office by more than two and a half years, asserting that the countrys tenuous security situation made it too difficult to hold elections.

title: Brooklyn Principal Apologizes for Remark Deemed Offensive
description: The principal of an elite public school in Brooklyn who infuriated parents this week by making what some considered an insensitive remark about learning Spanish has apologized, officials said on Wednesday.

title: Study Points to Overdiagnosis of Thyroid Cancer
description: To the shock of many cancer experts, the most common cancer in South Korea is not lung or breast or colon or prostate. It is now thyroid cancer, whose incidence has increased fifteenfold in the past two decades. A tsunami of thyroid cancer, as one researcher puts it.

title: The Upshot and the Midterms: Big Test, Good Grade and Lessons Learned
description: Two years ago  during the coverage of the 2012 presidential race the relationship between Nate Silvers Five Thirty Eight (then based at The Times) and the papers political team seemed tense. And an observant reader could sometimes pick that up in the journalism.

title: Taylor Swift Responsible for 22% of Album Sales Last Week
description: Taylor Swift stunned the music industry on Wednesday with the news that her new album, 1989 (Big Machine), sold 1.287 million copies in its first week out. Defying the prevailing trends in music, it became the fastest-selling album in 12 years and is also the only title released so far this year to sell one million copies (once a very common milestone).

title: This Week in Shopping
description: Ready To Roll Up Its Sleeves

title: Malicious Software Campaign Targets Apple Users in China
description: Researchers at a Silicon Valley security company said on Wednesday that they had found a new manner in which hackers can infect Apple products.

title: How Big Were Tuesdays Republican Swings?
description: The Republicans took control of the Senate on Tuesday, picking up at least seven seats, and expanded their majority in the House. Their victory in the Senate was significant but not the largest historically  though it could rank among the top five election year swings since 1946.

title: Princeton Mishandled Sexual Misconduct and Discrimination Cases, U.S. Inquiry Finds
description: A federal investigation into Princeton Universitys sexual misconduct and discrimination policies has found that the university violated the law and failed to respond quickly and fairly to students complaints.

title: Reading The Times With Joseph ONeill
description: Joseph ONeill is an Irish born writer. His latest novel is The Dog.

title: An Underdog Triumphs at the World Series
description: The Rosenblum Teams final at the 14th Red Bull World Series in China last month was between one of the pretournament favorites, Monaco (Pierre Zimmermann, Franck Multon, Fulvio Fantoni, Claudio Nunes, Geir Helgemo and Tor Helness), and a dark-horse team from Poland (Marcin Mazurkiewicz, Krzysztof Jassem, Piotr Gawrys, Michal Klukowski, Stanislaw Golebiowski and Wlodzimierz Starkowski).

title: The Plot to Burn New York City
description: In the waning days of the Civil War, as a Northern victory became both obvious and inevitable, the Confederate government of President Jefferson Davis financed what it hoped would be a drawn-out war of attrition, with the intention of driving President Abraham Lincoln to the bargaining table. A large part of that strategy involved members of the Souths Secret Services, who hatched a series of plots against Union territory that featured Canada as their operations site and relied on an impressive network of hundreds of soldiers, agents and operatives. Their most ambitious plot? To burn New York City.

title: Conquering Big Lines in France
description: Learn the dangers and difficulties of skiing big mountain lines from veteran Ian McIntosh, as he travels to the peaks of La Grave, France.

title: Theyre Trapped in an Elevator and in Life
description: A play calculated to make anyone who sees it take the stairs, Lift, at 59E59 Theaters, is the debut full-length drama from the novelist Walter Mosley. After terrorists attack a skyscraper, two young African-American executives find themselves trapped in an elevator. The intercom wont function, the doors wont open, the hatch is locked, cellphones wont work and, hey, is that the smell of smoke?

title: For Joan Riverss Doctor, Fame Delivers Its Bill
description: The first things you notice as you walk through the small hallway leading to the Upper East Side office of Dr. Gwen Korovin, a prominent ear, nose and throat specialist, are the mounted platinum records.

title: One Star, 2 Films and Conflict
description: LOS ANGELES  Take a good look when Jessica Chastain walks the red carpet at a Hollywood premiere for J. C. Chandors A Most Violent Year on Thursday night.

title: The Midterms Were Not a Republican Revolution
description: ON election night 1994, as Republicans recaptured the House for the first time in 40 years, I stood in the audience and watched my client Newt Gingrich, who would soon become speaker of the House, declare the beginning of the Republican revolution.

title: Video: Veteran Skier Conquers Big Line in France
description: Behind the Line is a video series produced by Teton Gravity Research that takes you into the minds of skiers. In each episode, the athletes will look back on a line, a jump or a session, and discuss the moment.

title: Einhorn Ends Green Mountain Bet, but Suggests Amazon Could Decline
description: After wagering against the maker of Keurig single-serve coffee machines for three years, the hedge fund manager David Einhorn has settled his bet at a loss. But the investor had tough words for an even bigger potential target: Amazon.com.

title: McConnell on the New Senate
description: Mitch McConnell, who will most likely become majority leader in the Senate next year, said the two sides in the Senate would work together but also warned of partisan divisions.

title: Markets Seem to Cheer Mario Draghis Off-Script Comments
description: Mario Draghi, the president of the European Central Bank, is scheduled to host a regular news conference on monetary policy on Thursday. If the event progresses as it normally does, he will start by reading out a numbers-heavy statement composed by the council that sets policy.

title: An Epidemic of Thyroid Cancer?
description: HISTORICALLY, the science of epidemiology was directed toward identifying and controlling epidemics of infectious disease. In a study just published in the New England Journal of Medicine, my colleagues and I highlight another important job for epidemiologists: identifying and controlling epidemics of medical care.

title: Putting the Cart Before the Art
description: No food carts were in sight on Sept. 9, when the Harlem Teen Choir serenaded dignitaries attending the opening of the new $65 million plaza in front of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, with its pristine granite fountains and alles of little leaf linden trees.

title: Obama on Working With the New Congress
description: President Obama said he looked forward to the Republicans putting forward their governing agenda after they regained control of Congress in the midterm elections.

title: Virgil Abloh, Kanye Wests Creative Director, Puts Street Wear in the Spotlight With His Off-White Line
description: Sitting down to lunch at the Mercer Kitchen in New York not long ago, Virgil Abloh checked off the most recent stops on the circuitous route that had led him to where he sat: from Tokyo to Copenhagen, back to Tokyo, to San Francisco, to Los Angeles, to Chicago, and then here.

title: Quick, Robin, to the Blu-ray Box!
description: The news arrived via a celebrity tweet.

title: Anatomy of a Presidency While Its Still Unfolding
description: For his inaugural program this September as moderator of NBCs Meet the Press, Chuck Todd landed a big guest: Barack Obama. If the president reads Mr. Todds new book The Stranger, its hard to imagine him wanting to return to the program anytime soon. The book delivers a stinging indictment of his presidency so far, one underscored by this weeks elections, which resulted in huge gains for Republicans and are widely seen as a repudiation of Mr. Obama and his policies.

title: Texas Democrats Ponder How They Will Ever Win
description: FORT WORTH  Wendy Davis was beaten not once but twice on Election Day.

title: Wearable Gear and Apps to Make Running Healthier, and a Lot More Fun
description: If the New York City Marathon has inspired you to hit the pavement running, here are some noteworthy gadgets and apps to help you get on your feet.

title: Report Cites Evidence of War Crimes in Myanmar
description: BANGKOK  A report by Harvard researchers due to be released on Friday says there is sufficient evidence to prosecute high-ranking officers in Myanmars military for crimes against humanity and war crimes committed against an ethnic minority.

title: Caught in Insider Trading Crackdown, Ex-Galleon Trader Turns It Around
description: Adam Smith, a portfolio manager at the now-defunct hedge fund the Galleon Group, always seemed to have a Plan B.

title: Skewering the Pretensions of Their Rarefied Milieu
description: To name a performance Star Crap Method is to lower all expectations except the expectation of humor. And at the Chocolate Factory on Tuesday, when Larissa Velez-Jacksons work had its debut, the disarming effect of the title was reinforced with some preshow karaoke. Audience members were also invited to decorate the theater with objects that evoked the central word in the title.

title: Split Decision by Voters on Local Fracking Bans
description: HOUSTON  The small city of Denton, Tex., voted to ban hydraulic fracturing in Tuesdays election after a hard-fought battle between environmentalists and local oil companies in the heart of natural gas country.

title: Obama Promises Action on Immigration
description: In his first speech after Republicans won control of Congress, President Obama pledged executive action on immigration before the end of the year.

title: Looking Back, Looking Forward
description: The Republicans proved Tuesday that the establishment still knows how to win.

title: Election Day Entailed Casting Votes for Soda Taxes and Food Issues Too
description: Voters delivered mixed messages on a number of measures and initiatives involving food and beverages on Tuesday.

title: Dont Call Clay Benskin a Street Photographer
description: Three years after Clay Benskin told a photographer friend he could take better pictures with a smartphone, he has produced thousands of images. But he still doesnt see himself as a street photographer.

title: Alaska Election Highlights
description: Voters approved a proposal to legalize marijuana for adults and regulate it like alcohol.

title: What White Privilege Really Means
description: This is the firstin a series of interviews with philosophers on racethat I am conducting for The Stone. This weeks conversation is with Naomi Zack, a professor of philosophy at theUniversity of Oregon and the author ofThe Ethics and Mores of Race: Equality After the History of Philosophy.  George Yancy

title: Chinese Presidents  Delegation Tied to Illegal Ivory Purchases  During Africa Visit
description: BEIJING  When President Xi Jinping of China and his entourage of government officials and business leaders arrived in Tanzania in March 2013, it was to officially promote economic ties between the two countries.

title: A Conservatory in the Kitchen
description: ST. PAUL  Two years ago, Elizabeth Millard discovered a way to put fresh produce into car food. No, shes not the one who smuggled shredded lettuce into the Doritos Cheesy Gordita Crunch-Fiery, a 490-calorie, zero-noun snack from Taco Bell. Rather, Ms. Millard, a sustainable farmer outside the Twin Cities, did something even more unlikely: she grew a crop of microgreens on the passenger-side floor mat of her 2005 VW Beetle convertible.

title: Cuddle Up in This
description: Sitting in a tiny room wrapped in birchwood the color of honey on a rainy afternoon last week, Kelle Arvay had a look of deep contentment. Its hard to describe the feeling of being inside here, Ms. Arvay said. Its comfortable. Its a real safe-feeling space.

title: Beds: Sleeping Beauties
description: Of all the furniture youll ever buy, the bed, the sofa and dining table are the three biggest things, Jeffrey Bernett said.

title: Same Tree, New Nest
description: The plan was simple.

title: A Pritzker Sets Out With Ideas of Empire
description: Adam Pritzker strolled through a spacious SoHo loft, pausing to admire a fake narwhal tusk. Handblown glass chandeliers from the Czech Republic dangled overhead, and vintage Moroccan rugs covered expansive hardwood floors.

title: In Japan, Moves to Stimulate Economy Reach a Critical Stage
description: TOKYO  Hiroyuki Hara has increased prices at his flower shop in recent months, part of a broad reversal of the deflation that has long plagued Japans economy. Getting prices rising is a national goal, but Mr. Hara isnt sure the new landscape is any more vibrant.

title: Gazing Into the Void
description: Earlier this week, Donald Kaufman, an architectural color specialist, declared that the color for November is black. He may be on to something. Recently, Surrey NanoSystems, a high-tech company near Brighton, England, announced its new invention, Vantablack, which it claims is the blackest black ever seen, or, actually, not seen.

title: Known as Alex From Target, Teenage Clerk Rises to Star on Twitter and Talk Shows
description: While political analysts spent Wednesday interpreting the significance of the midterm elections, social media pundits obsessed over the meaning of Alex from Target.

title: A Pressing Question
description: Laurastar, a Swiss company dedicated to ironing technology, now sells its portable steam iron, Lift, in the United States. At $749 to $799, depending on color, Lift is not cheap. But it is marketed as a fast and easy way to keep your clothes looking presentable, thereby reducing the need for expensive dry cleaning.

title: Thursdays Matchup: Browns (5-3) at Bengals (5-2-1)
description: 8:25 p.m. Eastern, NFL Network

title: Step on Him at Your Own Risk
description: Tigers may be endangered, but wool Tibetan tiger rugs are even more so.

title: The Get Smart Desk
description: Henrybuilt, a Seattle company known for its kitchen systems, has introduced a writers desk ($3,100) and a chair ($1,450). It was a design exercise, not a business exercise, said Scott Hudson, the founder. We wanted to produce something with as few parts as possible that perfectly represented the design philosophy of our brand.

title: The Messages of the Midterm Election
description: To the Editor:

title: From a Persian Mosque, Design Inspiration
description: The Ruby Tree, a furnishings company, was founded by Mitchell Abdul Karim Crites, the director of Saray Design, an Indian studio that specializes in the decoration of mosques, and Bethan Gray, a product designer in London. The first collection, introduced at Harrods in London, includes Petal bowls, platters and tables, which Ms. Gray and Mr. Crites designed with Saray artisans in marble inlaid with lapis lazuli or ruby or rose quartz; the pattern is inspired by the dome of the 17th-century Sheikh Lotfollah Mosque in Iran. (The lapis Petal bowl shown is $5,495.) The Striped range, in black marble and green amazonite, recalls medieval Persian ceramics.

title: Fledgling Grief
description: I havent sent my fathers watch to be fixed since his death six months ago. I am scared to let it out of my grasp. For 45 years it circled his wrist: a silver-faced Accutron with a tuning-fork movement that I could hear humming when I brought Dads warm arm up to my ear. Its face tells me it stopped at 4:04 on the 27th. My father stopped at 6:04 on the 30th.

title: Discounts at Uhuru Design, Chelsea Textiles, Holland & Sherry and More
description: During Uhuru Designs sample sale on Nov. 6, furniture is up to 75 percent off (a Stitch table in turquoise, originally $7,800, is $4,600); 185 Van Dyke Street (Ferris Street), Brooklyn, 718-855-6519, uhurudesign.com.

title: Should We Repair Our Water-Damaged Kitchen Ceiling?
description: Q. We plan to sell a house that will need a kitchen renovation, and the kitchen ceiling has water damage. Should we fix the ceiling before selling?

title: Landlords Say de Blasio Ignores Their Plight
description: First he raised water and sewer rates. Then he helped engineer the skimpiest rent increases in the history of rent regulation.

title: In Love With a Priest: Support Groups Spread
description: ROME  They had not planned on falling in love, but they did.

title: Dating Website Emphasizes Like, Rather Than Love
description: MATCH.COM and eHarmony have tussled over which dating website has spawned more marriages, and in August, a self-regulatory advertising panel ruled eHarmony should discontinue marketing claims including #1 Most Marriages.

title: World Cup Shift Could Hurt, or Help, Networks
description: The reality of the summer heat in Qatar has fully dawned on FIFA. A top official of soccers world governing body said Monday that it was considering turning the 2022 World Cup into a late autumn or winter event that would start in January or November of that year. That change might benefit players and fans who would avoid triple-digit temperatures outside air-conditioned stadiums.

title: New England Delegation Acquires a Tinge of Red
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  New England states have not voted for a Republican for president in years, even spurning one of their own, Mitt Romney, the former Massachusetts governor, in 2012.

title: Abortion-Rights Advocates Preparing for a New Surge of Federal and State Attacks
description: Advocates for abortion rights were bracing Wednesday for renewed assaults on abortion access in Washington as well as in state capitols after widespread Republican electoral gains.

title: Switzerland: Next Director Is Named for CERN Nuclear Laboratory
description: FabiolaGianotti, who led one of the two teams of physicists that discovered the Higgs boson, the so-called God particle that imbues other particles with mass, has been named the next director-general of CERN, the European Organization for Nuclear Research. Dr. Gianotti, 52, will take over for a five-year run at the end of 2015, when the current director, Rolf-Dieter Heuer, steps down.She will be the first woman to direct the laboratory  which is outside Geneva and is home to the worlds most expensive science experiment, the Large Hadron Collider  where the Higgs boson was finally produced and detected in 2012, capping a half-century quest. The machine, which has been down for repairs for the past two years, is to fire up its proton beams again next March with higher energies in the hunt for better understanding of the new boson and of other mysteries, like the nature of dark matter.

title: Publishing and Real Estate Services Push Revenue Up at News Corporation
description: News Corporation, the publishing company controlled by Rupert Murdoch, which is rapidly trying to transform itself, is finding that its nonnewspaper businesses are paying the bills.

title: The Hague: Serbian Nationalist Leader With Cancer May Be Freed Temporarily
description: The United Nations war crimes tribunal in The Hague has proposed a temporary release for Vojislav Seselj, a Serbian nationalist leader with cancer, whose health has seriously deteriorated during his long-running trial. In a decision published on Wednesday, the judge in charge of his case suggested that to avoid the worst-case scenario Mr. Seselj should return to Serbia for treatment. Mr. Seselj, a firebrand politician, has been charged with inciting others to commit war crimes in Bosnia and Croatia in the 1990s by creating a militia and sending its members off with incendiary speeches. He has also been convicted of contempt of court. Mr. Seselj surrendered to the tribunal in 2003, and his enduring presence during his much-delayed trial has become an embarrassment for the Yugoslavia tribunal. He has often harangued judges and has taken pride in provoking prosecutors.

title: Alaska Awaits Election Results for Senate and Governor
description: ANCHORAGE  The top two political races in Alaska, in terms of campaign spending, public attention and, now, cliffhanger postelection drama  remained unresolved on Wednesday.

title: Dodgers Set to Hire Farhan Zaidi, a Small-Market Executive, as G.M.
description: Farhan Zaidis rsum sounds almost as eclectic as his background.

title: Fox Election Coverage Draws Biggest Share of a Less-Than-Rapt Audience
description: With interest down sharply across the board in television coverage of the midterm elections, Fox News had about as big a night as the Republican Party, drawing the biggest audience not only in cable but also beating the broadcast networks limited coverage.

title: Always Look on the Bright Side
description: Our topic for today is: looking on the post-election bright side.

title: Mr. Obamas Offer to Republicans
description: President Obama refused on Wednesday to submit to the Republican narrative that his presidency effectively ended with the midterm elections.

title: Swamped in a Red Surge, Southern Democrats Contemplate Their Rebuilding Plans
description: NEW ORLEANS  Burns Strider, a native Mississippian who has advised the Democratic Party on faith issues, spent Tuesday night watching the election returns with a couple of other Democratic consultants and a bottle of small-batch bourbon. It was that kind of night.

title: In Red and Blue States, Good Ideas Prevail
description: The Democratic brand did not fare well, to put it mildly, in congressional and governors races on Tuesday. Most were contests of political blame, driven by ideological hatred for President Obama. But when the ballot offered a choice on an actual policy, rather than between candidates with a D or R next to their names, voters made notably liberal decisions in both red and blue states.

title: Republican Takeover of New York Senate May Aid Cuomos Centrist Brand
description: Liberal activists were left seething over his feeble efforts to help fellow Democrats. Republicans, even in defeat, could point to the many counties across upstate New York that he failed to win.

title: Chief Quits as Mississippi Prisons Face Inquiry
description: Mississippis longtime corrections commissioner resigned Wednesday amid a federal investigation into the states prison system, which has been plagued by squalid conditions and violence by guards and inmates.

title: Fostering Pheasants to Keep a Tradition Alive
description: BENJAMIN, Utah  The lid on the cardboard box flips open, and the birds shoot out like rockets and scatter into the gray sky, wings flapping hard to catch the strong winds that carry them off to a life in the wild.

title: The Possibility of Post-Election Bipartisan Deals
A Year of Unforeseen Hits
description: SEATTLE  John Moffitt spent 20 years to reach the pinnacle of his profession, a day to ditch that job and a year grappling with the consequences of his decision.

title: State Wage Initiatives Fare Better Than Democrats
description: In an election in which the merest hint of association with President Obama seemed radioactive to Republican voters, one of his signature issues was embraced Tuesday in some of the countrys most solidly red states: raising the minimum wage.

title: Obama to Seek Congressional Backing for Military Campaign Against ISIS
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama said on Wednesday that he would seek specific authorization from Congress for the military campaign against the Islamic State, opening the door to a lengthy, potentially contentious debate over the nature and extent of American engagement in Iraq and Syria.

title: Perella Weinberg Said to Merge 2 Subprime Auto Lenders
description: The asset management arm of Perella Weinberg Partners is merging two subprime auto lenders that it owns as part of an effort to streamline their operations and expand market share.

title: Republican Voters Want to Get Things Done, but Differ on Priorities
description: Republican voters got an early Christmas present on Election Day: a Senate majority and expanded control of the House when the next Congress takes its seats shortly after the actual holiday.

title: With Statehouse Victories, Republicans Are Poised to Enact Changes
description: DENVER  Republicans posted sweeping gains in state houses across the nation on Tuesday, taking control of the most state legislatures in nearly 100 years and approaching a record number of governors seats  a critical development at a time when most major policy has been coming out of states, rather than Washington.

title: New Marijuana Initiatives Loom as 3 Win Approval
description: ANCHORAGE  Conservative candidates garnered majorities in many elections around the country on Tuesday, but so did efforts to legalize marijuana. And the lessons of that complex pattern  with voters in Oregon, Washington, D.C., and here in Alaska approving recreational marijuana, and in Florida supporting medical marijuana  are already being absorbed for the next wave of state voter referendums, and fights, already planned for 2016.

title: Americas Broken Politics
description: Lets face it: The American political system is broken.

title: Women in Both Parties Are Disappointed by Their Modest Election Gains
description: WASHINGTON  When Senator Jeanne Shaheen, a New Hampshire Democrat, beat Scott Brown to win re-election on Tuesday, her supporters saw history being made  although not by Ms. Shaheen.

title: With Alex Rodriguez Coming Back, Things Look Bleak in the Bronx
description: In a million years, in a million baseball seasons, I never would have dreamed Id ever say this: I feel sorry for the Yankees.

title: Kansas Advice to Republicans: Stay to the Right
description: TOPEKA, Kan.  After a comfortable, across-the-board victory, Republican leaders here proudly affirmed their conservatism on Wednesday and sent a message to their party that Republicans can win on principles.

title: What the Forecasts Got Right, and Wrong
description: The results of the midterm elections are in, leaving Republicans with at least 52 Senate seats, along with the likely addition of Alaska, where Dan Sullivan holds a four-point lead. In Louisiana, Mary Landrieu and Bill Cassidy will face off in a runoff election on Dec. 6. And without the possibility of control of the Senate being on the line, Ms. Landrieu can no longer hold out hope that a flood of Democratic support will come to her aid.

title: No Mercy for Killers of Couple in Pakistan
description: LAHORE, Pakistan  Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif on Wednesday ordered the authorities to show no mercy in bringing to justice those involved in the murder of a Christian couple, who were tortured and then incinerated in a brick kiln after being accused of blasphemy, officials said.

title: Protests Resume at Guggenheim Over Abu Dhabi Museum
description: Just after 5 p.m. on Wednesday a 40-foot banner fluttered into view inside the central rotunda of the Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum in Manhattan, where visitors were looking at works by a collection of painters and sculptors called the Zero Group, who had aimed to redefine art after World War II.

title: By Lending a Hand, Christie Gains Some Clout for 2016
description: As the midterm elections neared, Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey counseled the Republican candidate for governor of Massachusetts, Charlie Baker, on how to land verbal punches against a female opponent without alienating women during televised debates. (Mr. Baker won.)

title: 2 New York City Officers Charged With Assaulting Teenager
description: The surveillance video starts with a 16-year-old running down a sidewalk in Brooklyn, with the police in pursuit.

title: 8 Million Rats for 8 Million New Yorkers? Data Suggest a City Legend Is Flawed
description: For some years, statistics have suggested that New York City was getting safer, cleaner and more expensive. Now there are numbers that suggest the city may not be home to as many rats as New Yorkers might have thought  or liked to boast about to visitors.

title: Ukraine to Freeze Payments in Separatist Areas
description: DONETSK, Ukraine  Ukraines prime minister said Wednesday that the government would freeze payments it had been sending to parts of eastern Ukraine even after the areas had fallen under the control of pro-Russian separatists.

title: More Expensive Cars Are Leading to Longer-Term Loans
description: It used to be that a car loan lasted three or four years. After 36 or 48 months of payments, you could drive debt-free for a few more years, before deciding if you wanted to get a new vehicle.

title: Washington Denies a Role in Yemeni Unrest
description: CAIRO  The Obama administration on Wednesday denied that it was interfering in Yemens escalating civil conflict, after supporters of the former Yemeni president, Ali Abdullah Saleh, accused the United States ambassador to Yemen of demanding that Mr. Saleh leave the country.

title: In States Seen to Be Tilting Left, Voters Defy Democrats Forecast
description: Republicans working on the Senate race in Colorado sensed something was shifting even before the votes were counted.

title: Tesla Reports Loss, but Beats Wall Street Expectations
description: Tesla Motors, the electric vehicle maker, reported net losses of $75 million for the third quarter, nearly twice as much as the previous year, on revenue of $852 million.

title: At Golan Heights, Israel Eyes Syria Chaos
description: MOUNT AVITAL MILITARY BASE, Golan Heights  As Israel has heightened its presence in the Golan Heights with a new army division, the divisions commander said Wednesday that he had counted 15 intentional attacks from across the once-quiet Syrian frontier since March, most of them attributed to two proxy groups, which are supported by Hezbollah and Iran.

title: Like Father, Like Son: Similarities in Cuomos Races for Governor Rankle Democrats
description: A yawning victory margin for a Democratic governor. An incumbent who seemed intent to run out the clock, playing down the importance of debates. And a liberal base that felt shortchanged once the votes were counted, upbraiding the man atop the New York State ballot for not doing more.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Nov. 5, 2014
Egypt Elevates an Official Hostile to U.S.
description: CAIRO  President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi is appointing a national security adviser who two years ago spearheaded criminal charges that nonprofit groups were acting as agents of an American conspiracy to weaken and destabilize Egypt.

title: Mark Sanchez Is Making Return in a System That Suits Him
description: PHILADELPHIA  Jordan Matthews was drafted in May by the Philadelphia Eagles, who were eager to add him to their stable of dynamic offensive talent. Those first few days, Matthews met LeSean McCoy and Darren Sproles, Jeremy Maclin and Zach Ertz, but none of them had quite the effect on him that the teams backup quarterback did.

title: Hunting Down Nazis and Surviving the Holocaust, at a Cost
description: Theres a large map on the set of Wiesenthal, and hundreds of books line the onstage shelves. The script, too, is filled with information: dates, names, statistics. But its the personal moments that at times elevate this otherwise standard one-man show about the life of Simon Wiesenthal.

title: Winter Plantings
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  I finished Matt Ginsbergs puzzle and had an unusual reaction to it: I thought I was losing my mind. Or that maybe there was some meta puzzle in here that I just wasnt seeing. Because isnt PESACH in the spring? Well, were not going to hold that against anybody; Happy Passover, everyone! Pass the matzo down this way, please.

title: Effort Begins for More Say on Directors
description: Annual shareholder meetings are supposed to allow a companys owners to change troubling governance practices such as outsize executive pay or directors who neglect their fiduciary duties.

title: No Pulse? Not Enough Passion? Giants Shrug at a Captains Criticism
description: Antrel Rolles comments Tuesday that the Giants had no pulse during their blowout loss to the Indianapolis Colts and that the team needed to play with more passion did not produce much reaction from his teammates, and Coach Tom Coughlin mildly disputed Rolles remarks.

title: De Blasio Deflects Blame for Losses in New York Senate Races
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio wanted to be front and center in this years battle for the New York State Senate.

title: Treating Those Treating Ebola in Liberia
description: HARBEL, Liberia  As the number of people sickened with Ebola soared this summer, American and Liberian officials faced a new challenge: How could they encourage international medical workers, understandably frightened about the risks, to come help fight the disease? The officials knew they would have to provide some assurances to the workers that they would be cared for if they fell ill.

title: North Korea Chief Walks Minus Cane
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Koreas state-run news media on Wednesday showed the countrys leader, Kim Jong-un, walking without a cane, indicating that he had recovered enough to move about without assistance after what South Korean intelligence officials called an operation on his left foot.

title: Jo Ann Harris, 81, Dies; Prosecuted Headline Cases
description: Jo Ann Harris, a federal prosecutor who investigated a pivotal confrontation between government lawyers and Monica Lewinsky that contributed to the impeachment of President Bill Clinton, and concluded that the interrogation had been riddled with mistakes and poor judgment, died on Oct. 30 in the Bronx. She was 81.

title: The 2nd Act in His Unlikely Pursuit: A College Degree
description: Born and raised in the Queensbridge Houses in Long Island City, Queens, the largest public housing development in the country, Derrick Lawson dreamed of a life outside the projects. Perhaps one day his interest in computers would earn him a respectable job, and he would make his way to TriBeCa. But college was never part of the plan.

title: On Unity Day, Putin Divides Nationalists
description: MOSCOW  It is often difficult to untangle the welter of competing agendas among Russian nationalists, a cacophony of ideas that was on display on Tuesday in the central event of their year: the Russian March, held on Unity Day, which marks the battle in 1612 when Russians united to expel the Polish Army from Moscow.

title: Russia Plans to Boycott 2016 Nuclear Meeting Hosted by Obama
description: WASHINGTON  Russia plans to boycott an international nuclear security summit meeting to be hosted by President Obama, American and Russian officials said Wednesday, the latest sign of the deteriorating relationship between the two nuclear powers.

title: Therapist and Patient Share a Theater of Hurt
description: It was not easily recognizable as therapy, these two women screaming at each other, their faces inches apart, during a rehearsal in a basement space in Greenwich Village.

title: Vojislav Seselj, on Trial for War Crimes, Is Offered Temporary Release
description: The United Nations war crimes tribunal in The Hague has proposed a temporary release for Vojislav Seselj, a Serb nationalist leader, whose health has seriously deteriorated while awaiting the end of his long-running trial. In a decision published Wednesday, the judge in charge of his case suggested that to avoid the worst-case scenario, Mr. Seselj should return to Serbia to receive treatment in the most suitable environment.

title: Mitch McConnells Path to Victory
description: The career of the Kentucky senator expected to become Senate majority leader and his promises to change the Senate.

title: In Exclusive Club of U.S. Ebola Survivors, Kinship Is Sealed in Blood
description: On Aug. 19, Nancy Writebol, a 59-year-old missionary who had contracted Ebola in Liberia, was released from Emory University Hospital in Atlanta, free of the disease after a period in isolation. Her doctors asked whether she would be willing to donate her potentially lifesaving blood plasma to other Ebola patients. Grateful to be alive and eager to help someone else, she said yes.

title: Coach Inspires Timberwolves by Pointing to Nets Veteran
description: Andrew Wiggins, the No. 1 pick of this years N.B.A. draft, had one of those inglorious moments last Saturday that can eat at a young players mind for days. With his team, the Minnesota Timberwolves, protecting a 1-point lead over the Chicago Bulls and less than three seconds to play, Wiggins, 19, bit on a pump fake, committed a foul to concede two free throws, and essentially gifted the Bulls the victory.

title: ISIS Wave of Might Is Turning Into Ripple
description: BAGHDAD  The extremists of the Islamic State appeared unstoppable after their sudden blitz through Iraq this summer, with its battle-hardened fighters continually raising their black flag over newly conquered areas.

title: Chinas Uighur Unrest Is Opportunity for Afghans
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Since the British first tried and failed to subdue Afghanistan in the 19th century, stumbling into a costly Afghan war seems to have become a mandatory step for global power players. The Soviet Union did it in the 1980s, and the American battle here has passed the 13-year mark.

title: Rising Stars in the Republican Party
description: Call it a wave, call it a referendum, call it a red sweep  but the midterm election results that rolled in on Tuesday night were unremitting good news for Republicans. They picked up at least seven Senate seats, wresting the majority from the Democrats, and made gains in the House that would give them their largest majority since the World War II era.

title: Old Books, New Thoughts
description: In an original essay, Philip Roth considers the experience of rereading his classic novel Portnoys Complaint, first published 45 years ago, in 1969. Six other authors, including Lydia Davis, Marilynne Robinson and George Saunders, also reflect on their own earlier works. These essays were written for T in anticipation of an auction in December in which 75 first-edition books annotated by their authors will be sold through Christies to benefit PEN American Center.

title: J.Crews Beauty Guru Launches a Line of His Own
description: The ever-popular J.Crew look,  la Jenna Lyons  fresh-faced and smart, polished but approachable  is about to be as accessible in the beauty realm as it is in apparel. The brands longtime makeup and hair stylist Troi Ollivierre is launching his own beauty line, starting with a collection of six lip colors; four are available to preorder at his website, while the other two are being offered exclusively at J.Crew and jcrew.com. Even when we add a pop of color to the lips, we try to keep it looking clean, Ollivierre says of the matte lipstick he used on the models for the brands Fashion Week presentations and in-house shoots. I felt like a lot of the matte colors on the market tended to be dry and heavy, so I wanted to create a highly saturated, pigmented, matte, luxe lipstick that is moisturizing and feels weightless. Its an easy approach to a bold makeup choice and one that matches the effortless look that J.Crew has perfected. Its really about the beauty of the girl coming through, he says.

title: Slouchy Suede Bags
description: A luxuriously supple carryall, just in time for fashions new 70s groove.

title: Great Vacation? Dont Brag to Your Friends
description: Your friends dont want to hear about your excellent adventures.

title: Word of the Day | suavity
description: suavity \sw-v-te\ noun

title: A Manet Portrait Fuels High Prices on a Competitive Night for Christies
description: Christies Rockefeller Center salesroom was the setting for a surprisingly competitive evening on Wednesday when six bidders doggedly chased Le Printemps, Manets 1881 portrait of the actress Jeanne Demarsy in a flowery dress and bonnet. The winner was Otto Naumann, the Manhattan dealer who was in the salesroom on behalf of the J. Paul Getty Museum in Los Angeles, paying $65.1 million, well above the paintings high estimate of $35 million.

title: Seconds From Victory in Regulation, Rangers Overtake Red Wings in Overtime
description: The Rangers are inching toward normalcy, one returning player at a time.

title: Whats on TV Thursday
description: 11:20 A.M. (Starz Cinema) THE PAST (2013) An Iranian, Ahmad (Ali Mosaffa), returns to Paris to give his estranged wife, Marie (Brnice Bejo), the divorce she seeks  and in the process opens a Pandoras box  in this drama by Asghar Farhadi. Tahar Rahim plays Samir, the man Marie has taken up with, whose wife is in a coma. Elyes Aguis is Samirs son, whose presence in the house means a playmate for Maries younger daughter (Jeanne Jestin). And Pauline Burlet is Maries older daughter, who finds the situation nearly intolerable. The narrative complications can be distracting, at times exasperating, but theyre finally irrelevant because Mr. Farhadis filmmaking is so fluid, and the performers, Ms. Bejo, in particular, are so attractive, Manohla Dargis wrote in The New York Times. As in A Separation, Mr. Farhadi shows a masterly gift for moving his characters and camera through rooms that  with a raised voice, a violent exit  become stages in a ferocious domestic drama. But here, keep your eye on the littlest players, the small ones trembling in the wings. In French and Persian, with English subtitles.

title: Turnout, a Scapegoat, Wasnt Always the Difference This Time
description: Low Democratic voter turnout has been blamed for the decisive Republican victory in Tuesdays midterm elections. It has quickly become the scapegoat, even though the Democrats invested millions of dollars in an expansive effort to persuade young and nonwhite voters who do not usually participate in midterm election to head to the polls.

title: Russian Billionaire Tied to Putin Is Focus of Inquiry

title: Peng Liyuan Song Accompanies Chinas Latest Space Mission

title: Spending and Growth, 2009-13
description: Just for my own reference: since the IMF has concluded that it loved austerity not wisely but too well, I thought I would add another austerity/growth chart to the file. Instead of using changes in structural budget balance, I thought it might be useful to just look at spending. This one uses data from the IMFs World Economic Outlook database to compare changes in total government spending (in national currencies  I didnt correct for inflation, but that wont matter) with changes in real GDP; I look at advanced countries, dropping the very small ones like San Mario. The picture looks like this:

title: African Mediators Fail to Name a Civilian to Lead Burkina Faso
description: OUAGADOUGOU, Burkina Faso  Despite often rancorous discussion brokered by three African presidents, political and military leaders in Burkina Faso have failed to name a civilian to lead a transition to democracy after the resignation of President Blaise Compaor.

title: Deutsche Telekoms Net Profit Drops 14% Under Weight of Investments
description: LONDON  Deutsche Telekom, Europes largest telecommunications carrier by revenue, reported on Thursday a 14 percent decline in net profit during the third quarter, as investments in its core markets in Germany and the United States weighed on the companys performance.

title: Computing a Winning Formula at the Pinnacle of Racing
description: Eugene Kaspersky, 49, is co-founder, chairman and chief executive of Kaspersky Lab, one of the worlds leading providers of antivirus technology for computers. Kaspersky, who was born in Novorossiysk, Russia, graduated in 1987 from the Russian Institute of Cryptography, Telecommunications and Computer Science with a degree in computer technology and mathematical engineering. In 1989, while working for the Soviet military as a cryptographer, he discovered a virus in his computer and began to study and treat it. He did the same for another colleague who had found a virus in his computer. By 1991, Kaspersky had moved to a private company, where he and his colleagues developed a program called AntiViral Toolkit Pro. That was the prototype for what became the Kaspersky Anti-Virus, now sold by Kaspersky Lab, the company that he founded in 1997. Based in Moscow, the company now has 30 regional offices and works in nearly 200 countries. The company became a sponsor in Formula One with the Ferrari team in 2010 and has expanded into one of the teams major sponsors and technical partners. Kasperskys software is used in the Ferrari computer system and he plans additional projects within the series. Kaspersky is a racing fan and he occasionally drives sports cars on racetracks for fun. As part of an occasional series focusing on famous and unusual Formula One fans, Kaspersky spoke recently with Brad Spurgeon of the International New York Times.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Where Riding and Wrangling Beat Virtual Adventures
description: In Where Riding and Wrangling Beat Virtual Adventures, Julie Turkewitz writes about youth rodeo in Utah.

title: How One Lawyers Crusade Could Change Football Forever
description: There are 1.27 million lawyers in the United States, one for about every 300 Americans  about 400,000 more of them than there are doctors. Their work is rarely glamorous, and especially for those just starting out in the profession, it can be grinding and repetitive. Jason Luckasevic, hired out of law school in 2000 by a firm in Pittsburgh, passed the bar exam on his first try and was quickly sworn in to practice. The ceremony, such as it was, took place on a Thursday in a clerks office, rather than in a courtroom in front of family and friends, because his bosses needed him to get started. The following Monday morning, he drove to Johnstown, about 90 minutes away, where he spent the day taking depositions from former employees of an enormous steel plant that had exposed them to asbestos. Late that afternoon, he climbed back into his Honda Civic and headed home. He repeated this routine for the next six months, five days a week, racking up some 400 depositions and about 20,000 miles on the road.

title: Dont Call Clay Benskin a Street Photographer
description: Clay Benskin weaves his way through the crowded sidewalks of Lower Manhattan, apparently invisible to the people streaming past him. He is not a small man. Yet even as his camera gets to within inches of someones face, the person doesnt flinch.

title: Do You Consider Yourself a Republican, Democrat or Independent?
description: We get our political identity from all sorts of influences. Maybe from our parents, friends or communities  or perhaps from caring deeply about key issues.

title: Despite Risks, Wealthy Chinese Still Determined to Travel to Space
description: The deadly crash of Virgin Galactics SpaceShipTwo in California may be raising concerns in the United States over the safety of space tourism, but so far it does not seem to have dampened the enthusiasm of would-be astronauts in China.

title: To Quell Unrest, Beijing Moves to Scatter Uighurs Across China

title: How the Fall of the Berlin Wall Really Happened
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  The opening of the Berlin Wall, 25 years ago this Sunday, marked a surprisingly joyous end to a conflict that could have erupted into thermonuclear combat. In the decades since, many Americans have come to believe that the wall fell thanks to President Ronald Reagans direct, personal intervention. In a 1987 speech in front of the Brandenburg Gate in a divided Berlin, he told Soviet leaders to tear down this wall  and so, weve been told, they did.

title: Bank of England Holds Interest Rate Steady
description: The Bank of England on Thursday left its key interest rate unchanged at historically low levels as policy makers try to balance Britains economic recovery against lower-than-expected wage growth and the risk that continued weakness in the eurozone might put pressure on the countrys economy.

title: Morning Agenda: Seeking More Say on Directors
description: Annual shareholder meetings are supposed to allow a companys owners to change troubling governance practices. But in reality, most of these meetings and the shareholder votes that are cast at them give outside investors little say on oversight of a companys board, as the current director election system in the United States allows board members to win or hold their seats even if they do not receive support from a majority of shareholder votes cast, Gretchen Morgenson writes in The New York Times. Now, a band of institutional shareholders is looking to change what they see as a dysfunctional dynamic. Led by Scott M. Stringer, the New York City comptroller and a Democrat, the group is mounting the first push ever at 75 United States companies to allow investors to hire and fire directors directly.

title: Brown to Start 4th California Term With Pledge for Fiscal Restraint

He did not air any commercials for his own candidacy, even as he amassed more than $20 million in campaign funds. And yet, in an election in which so many Democratic incumbents came to woe, he easily defeated his Republican opponent, a businessman named Neel Kashkari, and glided into an unprecedented fourth term as governor with 58.6 percent of the vote.

title: 1939: Sir Thomas Cullinan Dies
description: LONDON  Sir Thomas Cullinan, whose name the famous Cullinan diamond bears, has died at his home in Johannesburg, South Africa, at the age of seventy-nine. Founder and director of the first organized diamond mining company during his youth, he became known throughout the world in 1905 with the discovery of the Cullinan diamond. With its weight of 3,025.75 carats, it was by far the largest diamond ever found. The government of the Transvaal presented the great diamond to King Edward VII of Great Britain. Amsterdam cutters fashioned nine large gems and many smaller ones from it. The two most beautiful today belong to the British royal treasure, one being on the crown of King George VI and the other in his sceptre. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Nov. 7, 1939

Three of those weeks belonged to Taylor Swift, whose cheeky Shake It Off is a nail in the coffin of her relationship with Nashville, and the other eight belonged to Meghan Trainor, whose song All About That Bass isnt a country number at all but a modern doo-wop tune about self-acceptance.

title: 1964: Yale Manuscripts Scrutinized
description: NEW HAVEN, Conn.  A spokesman for Yale University expressed great surprise and astonishment last night that its eight rare Greek manuscripts were reported to have been stolen from a Spanish cathedral 20 years ago. The manuscripts were traced to Yale by a professor of Greek philology at Madrid University after four men were convicted a month ago of the 20-year-old theft. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Nov. 7, 1964

title: Joined at the Script
description: Emily Padgett and Erin Davie stood shoulder to shoulder and hip to hip while stagehands focused lights on and around them during a recent rehearsal for the Broadway revival of Side Show. Ms. Padgett ran a hand through her curly wig, parted on the opposite side of Ms. Davies. Ms. Davie toyed with the hem of her red dress, a mirror image of Ms. Padgetts. When they sang the final chorus to the ballad Who Will Love Me as I Am?, their voices melded so seamlessly you could hardly tell which bright note issued from which lipsticked mouth.

description: Each day until Christmas, the editors of T share a new holiday gift idea.

title: Culebra, a Quiet Corner of the Caribbean
description: I was paddling along in my kayak, floating over a coral reef on which purple and yellow sea fans waved lazily in the current, when something broke the surface ahead of me. A snorkeler? No, it was a hawksbill turtle, which seemed as surprised to see me as I was to see it, though not as delighted. The turtle gulped some air, flexed its fin feet, as graceful in the water as the brown pelicans passing nearby were in the air, and effortlessly angled through the green water toward the sea grass 10 feet below.

title: C.M.A. Awards Red Carpet
description: Despite the absence of the red carpet darling Taylor Swift from the Country Music Association Awards on Wednesday night in Nashville, others like Faith Hill, Nicole Kidman and Lily Aldridge dazzled on the red carpet.

title: Hungry City: Hard Times Sundaes in Mill Basin, Brooklyn

title: Not All Political Defeats Are Permanent
description: The Times has converted all of its 1964 issues into a digitized, searchable format. Each week, The Upshot will unearth an item from 50 years ago and put it in the light of today. Johnson Swamps Goldwater and Kennedy Beats Keating appeared on Nov. 3 and can be seen in its original format on TimesMachine.

title: In a Jungle of Boxes, Terrors of a Psychic Spring Cleaning
description: In their later years, my parents used to tease each other with the threat that whoever lived longer would be forced to deal with (ominous organ chords) the Attic. It was a fearsome prospect, for within the cramped upper level of their otherwise manageable house lurked the flotsam and jetsam of at least four generations of their familys lives.

title: Lollipop, the Latest Version of Android, Is Grown-Up and Accessible
description: Google has just released its new version of Android, and the company is showing it off on a new slate of Nexus devices: A 9-inch tablet and a coming phone, the Nexus 6.

description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: Facts & Figures: Healthcare Premiums Are Not on the Rise
description: Republicans warned that insurance premiums would rise dramatically in 2015, but it doesnt look like that will happen. Only two of 17 states in an Urban Institute study will see premium increases of more than 5 percent.

title: Jean-Claude Juncker, Top E.U. Official, Faces Rising Furor Over Luxembourg Tax Revelations
description: BRUSSELS  Less than a week after taking over as head of the European Unions executive arm, Jean-Claude Juncker, the former longtime leader of Luxembourg, was buffeted Thursday by a flood of leaked documents detailing his home countrys role as a haven for hundreds of companies seeking to drastically reduce their tax bills.

title: A Gallery Show, Site Unseen
description: The artist might be present, and then again, she might not. For her last, spectacularly popular outing in New York, The Artist Is Present (2010), the performance diva Marina Abramovic sat in the Museum of Modern Arts atrium and silently exchanged gazes with other people, one person at a time, for hours and days on end. Generator, a participatory exercise in sensory deprivation at the Sean Kelly Gallery, doesnt depend on Ms. Abramovics charismatic personal presence. She will be at the gallery for much of the exhibitions run, and she will participate in the action sometimes  but not according to any set schedule. In any case, whether shes on site or not wont matter for participants, because their eyes will be covered.

title: B. J. Novaks Book With No Pictures and More
description: Have your kids gone meta? Do they call their neighborhood jungle gym a play structure? Do they mix and match their dress-up garb  a tiara here, firefighters boots there  with a sense of mischief that might, unnervingly, be termed ironic? Have they spotted the clown at the neighbors birthday party removing his wig and slinking out the side door? Theyre probably not ready for the labyrinthine tricksterism of David Foster Wallace or Spike Jonze. But on the evidence of a recent spate of highly self-conscious picture books, it would seem that the suspended-disbelief state of early childhood is adapting to the wink-wink, nudge-nudge sensibility of our moment. Its not surprising. There has long been a strain of subversion in picture books  think of Maurice Sendak and Tomi Ungerer, among others  alongside the dominant anodyne snuggliness of the form. Now, sophisticated cheekiness appears to have gone mainstream.
