description: DECADES after television offered sponsored newscasts like the Camel News Caravan, CNN has signed Volkswagen of America as a presenting sponsor of CNN Films, the series of documentary movies that CNN added to its schedule last year to help stimulate viewership and ratings.

title: Dont Ask How to Feed the 9 Billion
description: At dinner with a friend the other night, I mentioned that I was giving a talk this week debunking the idea that we need to grow more food on a large scale so we can feed the nine billion  the anticipated global population by 2050.

title: Mali: New Ebola Case Is Confirmed as Response to First Was Wrapping Up
description: Mali, which was just coming to the end of 21-day quarantines for 108 people linked to its first Ebola case, now has a second, the government announced Tuesday. The new case, in the capital, Bamako, was not linked to the first case, a 2-year-old girl from Guinea who died in the northwestern town of Kayes on Oct. 24, a spokeswoman for the World Health Organization said. The W.H.O. and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention have known for at least 24 hours that a new cluster of possible Ebola cases existed in Mali, but did not announce it because they were waiting for laboratory confirmation of at least one case. Information Minister Mahamadou Camara said Tuesdayevening on Twitter that a case had been confirmed and that a clinic in Bamako had been quarantined.

title: Landing on a Comet, 317 Million Miles From Home
description: The Rosetta spacecrafts Philae lander is attempting to land on Comet 67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko.

title: Injured Player Withdraws to Save a Year at Columbia
description: After fracturing his foot during a routine drill in practice several weeks ago, Alex Rosenberg, a forward on Columbias mens basketball team, learned that he might not return to play for as long as four months. That was a tough blow for the Lions, who were counting on him to lead them in scoring for a second season in a row.

title: 2 Navy Veterans Set Sail for a Day at the Casino
description: Its not exactly On the Town when these two sailors get together for some gambling.

title: Freud and the Middle East
description: ABU DHABI, United Arab Emirates  When trying to make sense of the Middle East, one of the most important rules to keep in mind is this: What politicians here tell you in private is usually irrelevant. What matters most, and what explains their behavior more times than not, is what they say in public in their own language to their own people. As President Obama dispatches more U.S. advisers to help Iraqis defeat the Islamic State, or ISIS, it is vital that we listen carefully to what the key players are saying in public in their own language about each other and their own aspirations.

title: Politics Mingles With Art at a Palestinian Cultural Festival
description: RAMALLAH, West Bank  Jugglers and stilt walkers led the procession one recent evening from Manara Square to City Hall here in street theater meant to recall the first Palestinian intifada.

title: Karim Rashid
description: Mr. Rashid, 54, is a designer whose real estate projects include work for HAP Investments in East Harlem and Chelsea.

title: Manhattans Second-Tier Office Buildings Make Energy Efficiency a Goal
description: Class B office buildings are known for being old, no-frills and off the beaten path. What they are usually not associated with is energy efficiency.

title: Law and Order in Mexico
description: The disappearance, and presumed murder, of 43 college students six weeks ago has brought parts of Mexico to a tense point. On Monday, thousands of protesters blocked access to the airport in Acapulco, and last week tens of thousands more filled the streets of Mexico City.

title: The Worst Voter Turnout in 72 Years
description: The abysmally low turnout in last weeks midterm elections  the lowest in more than seven decades  was bad for Democrats, but it was even worse for democracy. In 43 states, less than half the eligible population bothered to vote, and no state broke 60 percent.

title: A Leaderless Palestinian Revolt Proves More Difficult to Curb
description: ASKAR REFUGEE CAMP, West Bank  Sawsan Abu Hashieh said she packed a bag of clothing on Sunday for her 18-year-old son, Nur al-Din, who told her he planned to sneak into Israel to work for two weeks. Instead, he was arrested in Mondays fatal stabbing of a soldier near a crowded Tel Aviv train station.

title: SheRides, a New York Taxi Service Aimed at Women, Finds a Loyal Following
description: Minutes after calling a livery car on a phone app, Lorena Cantillo easily picked out her ride in the crowd of black sedans on West 42nd Street. It was the only car with a pink sign in the window, and pink stickers all over the rear bumper.

title: Obamas Call for Net Neutrality Sets Up Fight Over Rules
description: WASHINGTON  When President Obama argued on Monday for rules to protect an open Internet, he said the regulations should be strong.

title: Rehab for Corporations
Attacks Aftermath Imperils Mans Efforts to Care for His Family
description: K. Arafan Koita, 48, remembers distinctly the day he arrived at Kennedy International Airport, having fled ethnic discrimination in his homeland of Guinea in West Africa. It was April 28, 1992, a Tuesday, and he headed straight to the Bronx to stay in a building inhabited by many other Guinean immigrants.

title: Colorado Ousts Pro-Gun Republicans, Showing Effect of Turnout
description: DENVER  After two Colorado lawmakers who supported strict new gun-control laws were voted out of office in a special recall election last year, the National Rifle Association and its allies celebrated their huge win in the battle over gun laws in state capitols. But that particular victory did not last.

title: The Problem With New Yorks Marijuana Policy
description: While running for office, Bill de Blasio promised that as mayor he would amend the practice of singling out young black and Latino men for unfair and, in some cases, illegal arrests for possessing minuscule amounts of marijuana. Though the charges are often dismissed, the arrests can cost people their jobs and access to housing or the prospect of joining the armed forces.

title: Alex Rodriguez May Be Out at Third as Yankees Pursue Other Options
description: PHOENIX  The Yankees are engaged in talks with Chase Headley to return as their third baseman, and General Manager Brian Cashman is also exploring the trade market for the same position. If one of those options pans out, Alex Rodriguez will lose his job as the Yankees starter at third, which he held from 2004 through 2013.

title: Bush (43) Shares Spotlight With Bush (41) as Tribute Book Is Published
description: COLLEGE STATION, Tex.  While hosting guests at his Texas ranch shortly after leaving office, former President George W. Bush got into a discussion with the daughter of the historian David McCullough.

title: St. Francis Papers, in Brooklyn, a Borough Hed Appreciate
description: Ever since monks and conservationists were known to be nearly finished restoring medieval manuscripts from the Sacred Convent of St. Francis in Assisi, some of the mightiest museums in the world have clamored to display them. After all, they are the oldest documents that tell the story of St. Francis. Born Francesco di Bernardone, a soldier and son of a merchant, he renounced wealth and war, then founded orders of friars and sisters organized on principles of simplicity. His embrace of the poor inspired the current pope to take the name Francis.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Nov. 11, 2014
Walmart Memo Orders Stores to Improve Grocery Performance
description: VALLEY STREAM, N.Y.  The dairy section in the Walmart supercenter here, just across the border from Queens, was sparsely stocked. Some gallon jugs of milk were dented, others soiled with what looked like dirt. The meat aisle had run out of ground beef patties and strip steak, and residue streaked some shelves.

title: Small Labels and YouTube Enter Deal on Licensing
description: Ending a monthslong dispute, YouTube has signed a licensing deal with independent record companies, a move that clears the way for YouTube to introduce a long-planned subscription feature to compete with online music outlets like Spotify and Rhapsody.

title: Pitching Website Aims to Protect Young Elbows
description: The last baseball season started with a flurry of injured elbows and ended with Madison Bumgarner firing 68 pitches on two days rest to clinch the World Series for the San Francisco Giants. For people who specialize in repairing damaged arms  and preventing future problems  it was a mixed message.

title: George W. Bush on His Father and 9/11
description: Former President George W. Bush talked to his former chief of staff, Andrew H. Card Jr., about his book on his father, former President George H.W. Bush, and mentioned talking to his parents on 9/11.

title: Big Bank Hank, an Early Star of Rap, Dies at 58
description: Big Bank Hank, one-third of the Sugarhill Gang, the unlikely ambassadors who took hip-hop out of Bronx parks and onto the pop charts, died on Tuesday in Englewood, N.J. He was 58.

title: Hitting at Heart of Hollywood, the Palm Takes Down Its Stars
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif.  Power in Hollywood is still signaled by who sits where at a handful of watering holes, but restaurant real estate as status symbol is fleeting: Lose that studio chairmanship on Monday, say hello to Siberia on Tuesday.

title: For Veterans Day, Stars Give a Return Salute
description: WASHINGTON  For days, people here had been bracing for Tuesdays first-ever Concert for Valor, a tribute to veterans. Inauguration-style barriers took over the National Mall, a subway line and several streets shut down, and people whispered a number that made many of them shudder: 800,000.

title: A Cabin in the Woods, but Hardly a Getaway
description: A man and a woman, both facing crises, keep slightly uncomfortable company in David Auburns small-scale and sleepy new play, Lost Lake, which opened on Tuesday night at City Center in a Manhattan Theater Club production.

title: Repeat Offender
description: Administrivial Deb-Amlen-In-N.Y.C. Fun Times Alert! Pencils up, New York! If you plan to be in New York City on Sunday, Nov. 16, come hang out with me at the Ace Hotel, located at 20 West 29th Street, as I show people that they can solve the Sunday crossword puzzle with a minimum of tears and bloodshed. The fun starts at 11:00 a.m. E.T. and its open to the public. Hope to see you there, and if you are a Wordplayer, please be sure to come up and say hi. Click here for more information.

title: Taunting Nets? Family Makes That Its Domain
description: SANTA FE, N.M.  Mark Cuban, the owner of the Dallas Mavericks, and his counterpart with the Knicks, James L. Dolan, were early suspects, as were any other N.B.A. executives who had ever squabbled with Mikhail D. Prokhorov, the Russian billionaire owner of the Nets. Or perhaps the culprit was an old rival of Prokhorovs from back home in Russia, where oligarchs have been known to make enemies.

title: Excerpts From Walmart Memo
description: These pages from a Walmart memo urge managers to improve performance on Chilled and Fresh items in their dairy, meat and produce departments as part of an effort to stem long-sluggish sales.

title: The Demise of the White Democratic Voter
description: It has not escaped the notice of political analysts that 72 percent of whites without college degrees  a rough proxy for what we used to call the white working class  believe that the U.S. economic system generally favors the wealthy. Or that on Nov. 4, these same men and women voted for Republican House candidates 64-34.

title: Spurs, Picture of Continuity, Are Set for Another Run
description: LOS ANGELES  The San Antonio Spurs, the ever-evolving Darwinian darlings of the N.B.A., were not about to stand pat after winning their first championship in seven years. So they made changes  big ones.

title: Pondering the Change Pope Francis Envisions
description: The United States Conference of Catholic Bishops is gathered in Baltimore only weeks after a contentious Vatican meeting on marriage and family ended in Rome.

title: China, America and Our Warming Planet
description: BEIJING  The United States and China are the worlds two largest economies, two largest consumers of energy, and two largest emitters of greenhouse gases. Together we account for about 40 percent of the worlds emissions.

title: In Joint Steps on Emissions, China and U.S. Set Aside You First Approach on Global Warming
description: After years of you first rhetoric on addressing the unrelenting buildup of climate-warming greenhouse gases in the atmosphere, China and the United States, the worlds biggest emitters, agreed in Beijing on Wednesday to intensify domestic steps and international partnerships to rein in their contributions to global warming. Click here for the news coverage in The Times.

title: Looking Like Champions, Rangers Rout a Top Team
description: The Rangers knew what they were getting themselves into Tuesday when the high-flying Pittsburgh Penguins came to town.

title: Pakistan: U.S. Drone Strike Is Reported
description: A Pakistani security official has reported a new American airstrike, saying a drone killed six foreign militants on Tuesday in the North Waziristan tribal region. It was not immediately possible to confirm the report independently. The strike was reported to be the 10th such attack since Pakistan began an operation in North Waziristan in June to crack down on militants. The official, who asked not to be identified because he was not authorized to speak to the news media, said the target was Dawa Toi, a valley near the Afghan border, and said, The valley is infested with local and foreign militants. Pakistan condemned the drone strike and demanded that they end.

title: Flip Your Skateboard Into Furniture
description: On a recent Saturday, a group of teenagers and young 20-something skaters gathered in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, to repurpose old, worn-out boards into functional, modern furniture. Mostly clad in hoodies, with power tools in hand, the crafters worked with a quiet focus on building stools and low benches as sawdust whirled through the air. Some popped ollies and flips in between taking turns with the belt sander, while others chatted up the pro skater Quim Cardona. While the event felt like a mellow hangout, it was actually organized by Converse as part of its ongoing series, the Cons Project Creative Recycling, aimed at skating enthusiasts between the ages of 13 to 24.

title: The Fast, for the Curious
description: In Famine or Feast in Ts upcoming Luxury Issue, the writer Cathy Horyn, before undertaking a Black Forest binge, completes a harrowing experiment in deprivation at Buchinger Wilhelmi, a therapeutic fasting clinic in southern Germany. On the menu: 250 calories a day, liver compresses and enemas, and the promise of feeling she could change the world at the conclusion of her 10-day stay. Here, for those inspired to follow suit (but not to try this at home), a list of like-minded detox facilities on two continents.

title: Anya Hindmarchs World of Inspiration
description: The beloved British accessories designer turns to playful influences to breathe a little life and laughter into luxury.

title: At Home and Away With the Decorator Robert Kime
description: For Englands most revered interior designer, a humble farmhouse is an ideal respite from his urbane London apartment.

title: Exercising but Gaining Weight
description: Exercise has innumerable health benefits, but losing weight may not be among them. A provocative new study shows that a substantial number of people who take up an exercise regimen wind up heavier afterward than they were at the start, with the weight gain due mostly to extra fat, not muscle.

title: Word of the Day | waffle
description: waffle \w-fl, wo-\ noun and verb

title: Whats On TV Wednesday
description: 9 P.M. (13, 49) EMPERORS GHOST ARMY Believing it would defend and serve him in the afterlife, Qin Shi Huang, the first emperor of a united China, was buried 2,200 years ago in an enormous underground mausoleum surrounded by a life-size terra-cotta army (above) 9,000 strong: warriors carrying bronze crossbows, spears and swords; cavalry, horses and chariots; administrators; and even acrobats, strongmen and musicians. Nova investigates how and why the figures were made, and the technology behind their lethal weapons.

title: Rothko and Johns Paintings Are Stars of a Sluggish Auction for Sothebys
description: The week of big-money contemporary art auctions got off to a sluggish start on Tuesday evening at Sothebys, where collectors could not be bullied by high estimates and tastes veered toward abstract rather than figurative paintings.

title: Scenes From the Concert for Valor
description: Performers at the concert included Bruce Springsteen, Dave Grohl and Carrie Underwood, who sang with the official chorus of the United States Air Force.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: He says wonderful things, but he doesnt put them together all the time, so youre left at times puzzling over what his intention is.

title: Corrections: November 12, 2014
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Big Banks Are Fined $4.25 Billion in Inquiry Into Currency-Rigging
description: The traders called themselves the players and the three musketeers as they joined forces and shared information to double team their clients and manipulate currency rates.

title: U.S. to Revise Bush Policy on Treatment of Prisoners
description: WASHINGTON  A treaty ban on cruel treatment will restrict how the United States may treat prisoners in certain places abroad, the Obama administration is expected to tell the United Nations on Wednesday, according to officials.

title: Politicians and Climate Experts React to U.S.-China Emissions Pact
description: President Obama and President Xi Jinping of China pledged on Wednesday to control their countries carbon emissions, in what American officials described as a breakthrough in the effort to combat climate change.

title: Afghan Opium Cultivation Rises to Record Levels
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Afghan opium cultivation again rose to historic levels in 2014, United Nations officials reported on Wednesday. And in a sign of how deeply entwined drug trafficking and the Afghan political system have become, the officials said the protracted elections this year were at least part of the cause.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Weapons Directed by Robots, Not Humans, Raise Ethical Questions
description: In Weapons Directed by Robots, Not Humans, Raise Ethical Questions, John Markoff writes about missiles that rely on software to decide what to target and whom to kill.

title: Test Yourself | Review of Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare
description: Below are the first six paragraphs of the Nov. 11 video game review, In This Future War, Soldiers Are Part Superhero.

title: Welcome to the Failure Age!
description: When you pull off Highway 101 and head into Sunnyvale, Calif., the first thing you notice is how boring innovation looks up close. This small Silicon Valley city, which abuts both Cupertino, the home of Apple, and Mountain View, the site of the Googleplex, is where Lockheed built the Poseidon nuclear missile. Its where the forebear of NASA did some of its most important research and where a prototype for Pong debuted at a neighborhood bar. Countless ambitious start-ups  with names like Qvivr, Schoolfy, eCloset.me and PeerPal  appear in Sunnyvale every year. Aesthetically, though, the city is one enormous glass-and-stucco office park after another. Its dominant architectural feature, the five-story headquarters of Yahoo, a few minutes from Innovation Way, looks about as futuristic as a suburban hospital.

title: Taking Pictures, Raising Children
description: Since World War II the image of the international photojournalist has been of a swashbuckling raconteur and ladies man. Whatever family life he had back home rarely got in the way of work or pleasure.

title: What Have Been Your Experiences With Catcalling or Other Kinds of Street Harassment?
description: Hollaback!, an anti-street harassment organization, recently released this video, taken with a hidden camera.

title: In Control, Republican Lawmakers See Budget as Way to Push Agenda
description: WASHINGTON  Next year, House Republicans will try again to transform Medicare and Medicaid, repeal the Affordable Care Act, shrink domestic spending and substantially cut the highest tax rates through the budget process. Then they will leave it to the new Senate Republican majority to decide how far to press the partys small-government vision, senior House aides said this week.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Bits of Dance and Chess Found in a Vanished Style of Play
description: Gabe Polsky did not set out to make a movie for hockey fans. The real subject of his documentary Red Army, he said, is the rise and fall of the Soviet Union.

title: With Amazons Echo, You Are Never Alone
description: Amazon is the most ceaselessly inventive company of the era. This, employees say, is one of the great virtues of working there;you can introduce a product without a million meetings or its being focus-grouped to death. Nor does Amazon seem hugely protective of the Amazon brand, which also speeds up innovation. It is not afraid of being disliked.

title: Fruitful Visit by Obama Ends With a Lecture From Xi
description: BEIJING  The White House pushed very hard for President Xi Jinping to take questions during his news conference with President Obama at the end of their two days of meetings Wednesday. It did not want a repeat of the stilted, scripted encounter Mr. Obama had with Mr. Xis predecessor, Hu Jintao, in 2009 on his first trip to China as president.

title: New York Today: Drop the Phone, Cyclist
description: Good Wednesday morning. Its foggy out there.

title: Chinas Stealth Fighter Takes to the Skies Above Air Show
description: The second public flight of the J-31 fighter jet began on Wednesday with a steep ascent, then a slow circle in the cloudy sky over the airfield in the southern city of Zhuhai, where thousands had come to watch Chinas new stealth aircraft in action.

title: Daily Report: Internet Giants Largely Stay Out of Net Neutrality Push
description: Silicon Valleys giant companies have been quiet lately on the question of whether the government should protect an open Internet, which they have previously argued is vital to innovation. Do not count on them staking out a stronger position even though President Obama has stepped into the fray, and Washington looks to be gearing up for an epic battle over the rules that govern the Internet, Farhad Manjoo reports.

title: Today in Politics
description: The Farewell Parties Are Just Beginning

title: No More Stalling. Am I Going to Lay Off Workers or Not?
description: I am not going to do it. Why not? Five reasons.

title: The Descent of Philae Toward the Comet in Tweets
description: On Wednesday, at 4:05 a.m. Eastern time, the 220-pound lander, named Philae, detached from the Rosetta spacecraft and was pulled downward by the gravity of the comet, known as 67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko. Signals from Rosetta will take nearly 30 minutes to travel more than 300 million miles to mission control in Darmstadt, Germany.

title: Israeli Police Officer Held in Deaths of 2 Teenagers
description: JERUSALEM  An Israeli border police officer has been arrested on suspicion of involvement in the fatal shooting of two Palestinian teenagers in the West Bank during a protest in May, officials said on Wednesday.

title: Mark Zuckerberg Adopts Obamas Approach to Dressing
description: But wait, you say upon reading this headline. Doesnt Mark Zuckerberg, the Facebook chief executive, wear a gray T-shirt every day, while President Obama wears a dark gray or blue suit?

title: Morning Agenda: Big Banks Fined in Currency Case
description: British, American and Swiss regulators fined five of the worlds biggest banks  UBS, HSBC, the Royal Bank of Scotland, JPMorgan Chase and Citigroup  a combined $3.3 billion on Wednesday for conspiring to manipulate the foreign currency market, the latest scandal to hit an industry facing increased scrutiny and mounting legal costs for its past sins, Chad Bray and Jenny Anderson report in DealBook. The fines come as regulators are increasingly targeting a business culture in the financial industry that they say encourages improper conduct by its employees. The banks could still face criminal charges in the matter.

title: Now, the Final Chapter. O.K., Half of It.
description: A friend is telling you a great story when, halfway in, she suddenly stops. To hear the rest, she tells you, youll have to wait. Not a day,  la Scheherazade, or a week, as with a CBS drama. A year.

title: On Set | Peter Philips on Makeup
description: The creative and image director of Christian Dior makeup talks about designing looks for fashion shows.

title: Americans Dont Expect Much From Obama, Poll Says
description: Americans are skeptical that President Obama will be able to get anything done in the next two years, according to a Pew poll released this morning.

title: An Online Store Whose T-Shirts Tacitly Support Ai Weiwei Is Shut Down
description: There were plenty of happy shoppers and merchants on Tuesday as Chinese consumers spent $9.3 billion via the online shopping brontosaurus Alibaba, breaking last years record for Singles Day, an e-commerce holiday dedicated to naked consumerism.

title: Ireland Sets Water Fees, Angering Thousands
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Across the richly green Irish countryside, trouble is stirring, strangely enough, over water.

title: Bain Capital and Apax Make $8.8 Billion Offer to Oi for Portuguese Assets
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  The private equity funds Apax Partners and Bain Capital have made an $8.8 billion offer for the Portuguese assets of the Brazilian telecommunications operator Oi, a move that could lead to a bidding war with Altice of France.

title: Daily Clip Report
description: Good morning. Here is Daily Clip Report, a collection of articles about The Times and the media sent by email each morning to senior executives and newsroom editors. The email is produced by the Corporate Communications Department at The Times.

title: Susquehanna Bancshares in Deal to Be Sold to BB&T
description: The BB&T Corporation, a big lender based in North Carolina, is doing something most of its peers have shied away from since the financial crisis: buying another bank.

title: In Search of Brooklyn
description: Dear Diary:

title: Obama and Xi Announce Climate Deal
description: President Obama spoke after the United States and China, the worlds top carbon polluters, agreed to reduce emissions following nine months of negotiations and two productive days of meetings.

title: Macys Sales Fall in Third Quarter as Retailers Struggle to Attract Wary Shoppers
description: Macys reported lackluster sales for its third quarter, a sign that the department store giant had not overcome some of the broader challenges facing the retail industry.

title: Dow Chemical to Raise Dividend and Increase Stock Buybacks
description: Dow Chemical may still be resisting a call by the activist hedge fund manager Daniel S. Loeb to break itself up, but it is taking more steps to return money to its shareholders.

title: 1939: Jamming of BBC Radio Addressed
description: LONDON If jamming of British Broadcasting Corporation broadcasts in foreign languages continues, the English radio will retaliate with similar measures, the corporation said here today [Nov. 12]. Secret listening posts throughout England have been collecting evidence indicating that reception of B. B. C. broadcasts in Hungarian, Czech, Polish and German have been made unintelligible by conflicting radio waves, the B. B. C. said. Only short-wave programs have been interfered with so far and the jamming is intermittent, it was reported. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Nov. 13, 1939

title: War Reporting as Art in the Flatiron District
description: Soldiers are our boots on the ground, but journalists are our eyes on the ground, said Cheryl McGinnis, curator of the artist Cindy Kanes current exhibition in Manhattans Flatiron district.

title: Chinas Climate Change Plan Raises Questions
description: BEIJING  When the presidents of China and the United States pledged on Wednesday to reduce or limit carbon dioxide emissions, analysts and policy advisers said, the two leaders sent an important signal: that the worlds largest economies were willing to work together on climate change.

title: The Things Traders Say, Foreign Exchange Edition
description: LONDON  It has become a common occurrence whenever a major bank settles with regulators over misconduct: the lewd and, sometimes, cringeworthy language traders use to communicate daily emerges in chats or emails.

title: A Sweet Breakfast Memory That Connects With the Wrong Market
description: COW WOW CEREAL MILK is a two-year-old  company that makes milk in breakfast cereal flavors. Founded by Christopher Pouy, a former advertising copywriter seeking to capitalize on a childhood love, it is based in Los Angeles and employs 10. By putting a child-friendly cow on the package and giving his flavors names like Fruity Trudy and Chocolate Chip Cathy, Mr. Pouy branded his product for 5- to 12-year-olds.

title: Americans Say They Want Privacy, but Act as if They Dont
description: Americans say they are deeply concerned about privacy on the web and their cellphones. They say they do not trust Internet companies or the government to protect it. Yet they keep using the services and handing over their personal information.

title: 53 Seats and Counting: Republican Wins Alaska Senate Race
description: Republicans appear to have pulled out another Senate victory, giving them at least 53 seats in the chamber, after The Associated Press called the Alaska race early Wednesday for the Republican challenger, Dan Sullivan, over the Democratic incumbent, Senator Mark Begich.

title: First Draft Focus: A Red Carpet Welcome
Questlove to Curate Taste Talks Food Festival
description: Questlove, the drummer, producer and culinary entrepreneur, will receive top billing at the third annual Taste Talks festival in the fall of 2015. His official title is curator for the three days of symposiums, tastings, cooking demonstrations, dinners and music offered in Williamsburg, Brooklyn.

title: Taylor Swift Versus Spotify
description: Is streaming music bad for musicians? That may be the conclusion some people have drawn from Taylor Swifts decision to pull her songs from Spotify, the popular streaming music service that is based in Sweden. But there is reason for skepticism.

title: Will Serial Change How We Talk About Crime?
description: If youre among the one million people who reportedly listen to each episode of Serial, you already know that the podcast centers on the 1999 death of the high school student Hae Min Lee, and the conviction of her ex-boyfriend Adnan Syed for her murder. Youve followed the shows host, Sarah Koenig, as she tries to determine whether Mr. Syed really killed Ms. Lee. You may or may not know (though the size of the latter category is shrinking) that parallel investigations of the crime are taking place on Reddit and elsewhere, and that those investigations are inspiring debates of their own.

title: Boehner and McConnell Criticize Climate Deal With China
description: Speaker John A. Boehner was one of the first critics of the climate deal struck between the United States and China, releasing a statement early Wednesday deploring the deal as the latest example of the presidents crusade against affordable, reliable energy that is already hurting jobs and squeezing middle-class families.

title: First Draft Focus: McConnell Addresses His Freshman Class
Marrakesh Express
description: The chef Daniel Boulud has a long history with tagine, the North African stew that takes its name from the elegant earthenware pot in which it is cooked. Thirty years ago, he said recently, he tasted a tagine cooked by a Moroccan magician and cook named Baby Dahane. The taste lingered with him. I loved the soulful, Berber-style delicate preparation, he said, the crossroad of spice and flavor and the smell, the taste, the combination of spices and vegetables.

title: The New American Love Story, Lived in the Shadows
description: Atticus Lishs first novel, Preparation for the Next Life, is unlike any American fiction Ive read recently in its intricate comprehension of, and deep feeling for, life at the margins.

title: Brooklyns Sleepy Enclave, Vinegar Hill, Awakens
description: The Brooklyn waterfront enclave of Vinegar Hill is a tiny carpet remnant of a neighborhood, a rough-edged but charmingly idiosyncratic swatch of land largely cut off from the city around it. At its northern fringe is the dystopian sprawl of a colossal Con Edison substation that separates residents from the tantalizingly close East River. To the east is the fenced 300-acre Brooklyn Navy Yard industrial park. To the south is a mountain range of public housing and the Brooklyn-Queens Expressway.

title: Obama Aims to Lift the Global Economy, and Maybe Himself
description: WASHINGTON  Facing a Republican resurgence that is blocking virtually every policy move, President Obama will arrive at an international economic meeting in Australia this weekend hoping to press European and Asian leaders to get their economies moving again  and perhaps buoy his own foundering presidency.

title: Alex From Target: The Other Side of Fame
description: Two weeks ago, 16-year-old Alex Lee was your run-of-the-mill teenager.

title: Fears Rise as Russian Military Units Pour Into Ukraine
description: KIEV, Ukraine  Tanks and other military vehicles pouring over the border from Russia into eastern Ukraine. Nightly artillery battles in the regions biggest city, Donetsk, and reports of fighting around another regional capital. And now, sightings of the green men, professional soldiers in green uniforms without insignia, the same type of forces that carried out the invasion of Crimea last spring.

title: Landing on a Comet, a European Space Agency Mission Aims to Unlock the Mysteries of Earth
description: In a technological feat that gives scientists their first opportunity to dig into a remnant of the early solar system, the European Space Agencys Rosetta mission successfully placed a small spacecraft on the surface of a speeding comet on Wednesday.

title: Website Explores Sugars Effects on Health
description: Most people know that too much sugar can be bad for you. But now a dozenscientists at three universities have started a new website called SugarScience.org to educate the public on precisely how too much sugar can make people sick.

title: Scientists Celebrate Spacecraft Landing
description: Scientists at the European Space Agency react after their Philae lander arrived at its destination on Wednesday for the first extended examination of a comet.

title: A Seasons Worth of Music in a Weekend at Knoxvilles Big Ears Festival
description: Downtown, in the musical sense, seems to be expanding southward. Big Ears, a festival in Knoxville, Tenn., in which indie classical, pop and jazz composers and ensembles rub shoulders, has announced its 2015 roster, and it reads like a season listing for Greenwich Village and Brooklyn, compressed into a single weekend, March 27-29.

title: Buddha, Paroled
description: Freddie Cox was convicted of second-degree murder. In part because he maintained his innocence, he was denied parole until this year, 28 years after his imprisonment.

title: A Claim of Innocence Is No Longer a Roadblock to Parole
description: BEACON, N.Y.  After 28 years in prison, Freddie Cox emerged from the Fishkill Correctional Facility, not quite a free man, but free enough.

title: What You Get for ...$1,900,000
description: CAMDEN, ME.

title: 1964: Medicare Foe Says Hell Act
description: KENSETT. Ark. An important opponent of the administrations health-care bill said today he would move to speed congressional action on the measure if President Johnson wishes. Rep. Wilbur D. Mills, D; Ark., chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, said he would bring up the medicare measure early next year. If the president wants it first and tells me he does thats the way well be working, he said. Mr. Johnson said during the campaign that the measure was just at the top of his legislative must list. Rep. Millss statement was good news for backers of the proposal. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Nov. 13, 1964

title: Miscellaneous Thoughts on 2016
description: My Sunday column argued that as of right now, policy-oriented Republicans should be rooting for strong showings by Marco Rubio and Rand Paul in the 2016 primaries, because Rubio and Paul are 1) the two politicians who seem to have thought most seriously about what the next G.O.P. agenda should look like, and 2) have important, interesting, worth-debating differences on the form that agenda should take. The column didnt say much about whether either man was likely to actually win the nomination, mostly because I dont think that much has changed since the last time I wrote about the two of them: Rubio still looks more like the kind of candidate who wins G.O.P. nominations, an asset that the press may be underrating the moment, while Paul still has the harder road(probably slightly more difficult now given the shiftingforeign policy landscape), because he just has more potential points of tension with the traditional Republican coalition, donors and wonks and voters alike.

title: Audio Equalizer and Enhancement Apps Beyond the Smartphone Sound
description: YOUVE probably heard musicians like Neil Young complain over the last few years about the sound quality of digital music. But thanks to a new generation of so-called audio enhancement apps, your musics sound quality doesnt have to entirely depend on your smartphone.

title: App Smart | Enhance Your Music
description: Kit Eaton reviews LouderLogic, DFX Music Player and Headquake, three apps that help enhance the sound on your smartphone.

title: 36 Hours in Dublin
description: Explore street view, find our points of interest and sign in to your Google account to save your map.

title: House Hunting in ... Toronto
description: AN EDWARDIAN MANSION IN THE ROSEDALE NEIGHBORHOOD

title: After Victory Laps, Settling In as Rookies
description: WASHINGTON  Ruben Gallego arrived here Sunday night, crashed on a friends air mattress and went apartment-hunting Monday morning, only to discover it costs $1,900 to rent a 400-square-foot studio on Capitol Hill. He spent that afternoon working from his laptop on the second floor of a Dunkin Donuts, talking on his cellphone while pacing about in his stocking feet.

title: Pickling and Chemotherapy
description: An interesting response to this weeks pickle piece:

title: Back for More: Return of the Pulp Fiction Contest
description: Updated, Dec. 23 | Meet, and read, the contest winners, and thanks again to all who submitted!

title: VW to Allow Labor Groups to Represent Workers at Chattanooga Plant
description: Volkswagen announced a new policy on Wednesday that was likely to allow several labor groups, including the United Automobile Workers, to represent employees at the companys Chattanooga, Tenn., plant.

title: A Soon-to-Be Grandma, Ready to Learn
description: With two grown daughters in stable, marital relationships, it was, according to my friends, only a matter of time before I would join the band of grandparents. Are they pregnant yet? became the standard greeting of friends who lived far away and did not track my everyday movements. And I responded in kind: how are you? Because me, Im not a grandma yet.

title: On the Trail of Paddington Bear
description: The Paddington Bear phenomenon began on Christmas Eve in London in 1956 when Michael Bond spotted a lone toy bear on the shelf at Selfridges and, feeling sorry for it, took it home to his wife.

title: The Daily Gift: A Speaker in Three Dimensions
description: Each day until Christmas, the editors of T share a new holiday gift idea.

title: As Bud Selig Prepares Exit, Roger Clemens Case Sticks Around
description: As Bud Selig prepares to depart as Major League Baseballs longtime commissioner, he is leaving a few items behind.

title: Should Cow Wow Sell to Little Children or Big Children?
description: We just published a case study about an advertising copywriter, Chris Pouy, who was tired of buffing the brands of others and started his own company, Cow Wow, to sell fun, cereal-flavored milks to children ages 5 to 12. In late 2012, Mr. Pouy introduced Fruity Trudy and Chocolate Chip Cathy near the companys Los Angeles offices.

title: Randy Jackson Ends His Run on American Idol
description: Little about the original American Idol  including big ratings  remains now that Randy Jackson has decided to leave the singing competition after 13 years as a regular participant on the show.

title: Fears of Inflation Stem From Worrisome Origins
description: The anger of the investing class has curdled into paranoia.

title: Jean-Claude Juncker Breaks Silence Over Luxembourg Tax Issues
description: BRUSSELS  Jean-Claude Juncker, head of the European Unions executive arm, took responsibility on Wednesday for the way Luxembourg was run during his time in charge, breaking his silence after a flood of embarrassing revelations about his home countrys role as a global tax haven.

title: Ways of Seeing
description: The picture-book version of the French film The Red Balloon was a treasured possession of my 1970s childhood. I was enthralled not just by the story of the lonely boy and his mysterious balloon companion but also  and perhaps even more  by the photography. Each page of the book is a still from the movie, a thrillingly lucid, beautifully stylized window into the real world. The photos were of Paris, not fancy Paris but the gray, gray Paris of crumbling buildings and dim alleyways. The camera made each pockmarked wall look like an elaborate Modernist painting, with the little boy dressed in soft dove-gray himself a lovely detail in it  and then set against all the grayness on each page was that miraculous balloon. It glided across the scene, redder than any red and bigger than any balloon Id ever seen, a beacon of pure joy and a testament to the possibility that a bit of magic could float right into your tough everyday life.

title: 36 Hours in Dublin
description: After decades of tumultuous change, a more refined wave of affluence has reached Dublin, where visitors will find a restaurant renaissance, musical creativity and a glorious sense of history.

title: 36 Hours in Dublin
Goldman Sachs Names 78 New Partners
description: The vaunted list of partners at Goldman Sachs had 78 names added to it on Wednesday.

title: A Primer on How Currency Manipulation Worked
description: LONDON  Some of the worlds biggest banks have agreed to pay regulators in Britain, the United States and Switzerland more than $4 billion for conspiring to manipulate benchmark foreign currency rates.

title: Mexicos Bold Move on Debt Restructuring Contracts
description: Take that, Paul Singer!

title: Ive Always Loved People Watching Me
description: Some people say Stings new Broadway musical, The Last Ship, is about the songs. Others, that its about the good, struggling workingmen of northern England. Others, who have seen Rachel Tuckers performance as Meg, the hometown love whom the hero leaves behind, will say that its about the woman.

title: Raging Hormones at Exam Time
description: That season in hell commonly called mid-adolescence promises to turn especially hot  and chilly  in Simon Stephenss Punk Rock, which opens on Monday at the Lucille Lortel Theater. This portrait of the evil that lurks in the hearts of unhappy teenagers, preparing for exams in a private school, evoked both shivers and huzzahs from London critics in 2009.

title: Transcript of Clemens Deposition
description: The transcript of the July, 2014 deposition of Roger Clemens in the Clemens-Brian McNamee defamation lawsuit.

title: Second Ebola Outbreak in Mali Eclipses Early Success
description: The West African nation of Mali, which just beat its first outbreak of Ebola, has confirmed a second one that is larger and more threatening, global health authorities said on Wednesday.

title: A Celebratory Air as New G.O.P. Senators Have a Look Around
description: Senate Republicans were in a celebratory mood Wednesday as the reinforcements arrived from last weeks sweeping election win. The newcomers posed for a photo with Senator Mitch McConnell of Kentucky, whom they will help make majority leader on Thursday.

title: YouTube Music Key Is Introduced as New Rival in Streaming
description: For nearly a decade, YouTube has offered a smorgasbord of free music, making just about every song imaginable  from Top 40 to ukulele covers  available at a click. But soon the site, whose more than one billion monthly visitors make it the worlds most popular music platform, will start charging for additional perks.

title: The Shadow in the Chador
description: LOS ANGELES  The heroine of A Girl Walks Home Alone at Night is not your typical Hollywood vampire. Shes Iranian, for one thing, and does most of her late-night feeding in a chador. She loves dance music and skateboarding, and has seen Elvis and Black Sabbath live.

title: A Brief History of Failure
description: From the longbow to the Dvorak keyboard, the road to innovation is paved with failed designs and forgotten artifacts.

title: Taylor Swifts 1989 Reigns at No. 1
description: Taylor Swifts 1989 remains at the top of the Billboard 200 for a second week, not surprisingly, with sales of 402,000 copies during the week ending Nov. 9, the magazine and Nielsen SoundScan reported. That is a drop of 69 percent from Ms. Swifts first-week sales, but it means that in the two weeks since the album was released, it has sold nearly 1.7 million copies, an extraordinary number these days. By contrast, the disc holding the No. 2 sales spot  the 52nd installment of the Now Thats What I Call Music!  sold 59,000 in its second week on the chart, after 103,000 last week, for combined sales that are less than a tenth of Ms. Swifts.

title: Peril, and Daring, at 1 World Trade Center as Window Washers Are Trapped
description: For more than an hour on Wednesday afternoon, two window washers commanded the concern of New York City.

title: Roger Clemens Deposition Transcript
description: The transcript of the July, 2014 deposition of Roger Clemens in the Clemens-Brian McNamee defamation lawsuit.

title: Today in Small Business: Demise of the Internet Sales Tax
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: New Orleans Police Routinely Ignored Sex Crimes, Report Finds
description: NEW ORLEANS  A scathing examination of this citys Police Department has concluded that five detectives tasked with investigating sex crimes failed to pursue hundreds of reported cases, finding records of follow-up efforts in only 14 percent of such calls over three years.

title: NATO Speaks on Russian Forces in Ukraine
description: The Supreme Allied Commander Europe of NATO, Gen. Philip M. Breedlove, confirmed that Russian troops were moving into eastern Ukraine, but that NATO was unsure of their numbers or intentions.

title: Mosque Is Damaged in West Bank Fire
description: Residents and officials surveyed the damage to a mosque in a Palestinian village in the West Bank after what was said to be an arson attack.

title: Endorsing Paul and Rubio in 2016 (for Senator, Not President)
description: The Club for Growth PAC is already backing candidates in the 2016 election, but not that 2016 election.

title: What the Climate Accord Could Change
description: The possible effects for the coal and automobile industries of the landmark agreement between the United States and China.

title: Reading The Times With Patricia Marx
description: Patricia Marx is a staff writer for The New Yorker and an author. Her latest book, Lets Be Less Stupid, publishes next summer.

title: A Tower Clock in Danger of Losing Its Purpose
description: Has the XIth hour arrived for the landmark tower clock at 346 Broadway?

title: Vegetarian Thanksgiving: Bread Salad Inspired by Stuffing
description: Panzanella is a Tuscan summer bread salad, often made to use up stale bread. The typical panzanella consists of chunks of stale bread and tomatoes, cucumbers, onion and basil, dressed with olive oil and vinegar.

title: Follow Me Around and the Long, Strange Trip to a Times Correction
description: Most corrections are simple. The Times gets something wrong  inevitable when it publishes well over 100,000 words a day  gets a complaint, and quickly publishes a correction. This may happen dozens of times in a typical week.

title: Casting Doubt on Appeal, Court Rejects Bail for Ex-SAC Capital Trader
description: Mathew Martomas bid to stay out of prison pending an appeal of his insider trading conviction did not last much past lunchtime.

title: Angel Collinson Takes Alaska
description: Get in the mind of Angel Collinson, a twenty-four year old big mountain skier who is making waves in the traditionally male dominated sport.

title: Wheelies: The Scion Concept Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: Dan Sullivan, G.O.P. Senate Challenger in Alaska, Wins Senate Race
description: Senator Mark Begich of Alaska, a Democrat who squeezed into office in 2008 by a narrow margin in a conservative state, narrowly lost his re-election bid as a count of absentee ballots a week after the election put his opponent, Dan Sullivan, over the top, according to The Associated Press.

title: De Blasio, Arriving Late, Angers Attendees of Flight 587 Memorial
description: Since taking office, Mayor Bill de Blasio has made a habit of keeping people waiting. Business leaders have languished in meeting rooms. Reporters have assembled before empty lecterns.

title: Rescuing the World Trade Center Window Washers
description: Two window washers became trapped outside the 69th story of the newly completed One World Trade Center in Manhattan.

title: Bank of England Officials Cleared of Wrongdoing in Currency Manipulation
description: LONDON  An independent inquiry released on Wednesday found that no one at the Bank of England was involved in unlawful or improper behavior related to the foreign exchange market, but a top official was fired this week after the central bank said he failed to follow internal policies.

title: Style in the Kallio Neighborhood of Helsinki, Finland
description: Sonja Sorvola likes to mix minimalism with bold pieces, something she describes as a flirty divergence from the clean and tailored look often associated with Scandinavian style. While walking recently in the Kallio neighborhood of Helsinki, Finland, Ms. Sorvola, an actress, wore vintage Cline loafers, Zara pants and an asymmetrical wrap cardigan from Stockholm. This interview has been edited and condensed.

title: On Climate Change, Voters Are as Partisan as Ever
description: The climate change agreement reached between President Obama and President Xi Jinping of China has quickly drawn a mix of praise and scorn among American lawmakers who woke up to the news. Unsurprisingly, the responses fell largely along party lines.

title: Video: Young Woman Skis Lines and Makes Waves
description: Behind the Line is a video series produced by Teton Gravity Research that takes you into the minds of skiers. In each episode, the athletes will look back on a line, a jump or a session, and discuss the moment.

title: Text to Text | The Fall of the Berlin Wall: Reporting in 1989 and Remembering 25 Years Later
description: Twenty-five years ago this week, East Germans danced atop the concrete wall that had sealed off their communist-ruled world from the West.

title: A Major Breakthrough on Climate Change
description: The deal jointly announced in Beijing by President Obama and Chinas president, Xi Jinping, to limit greenhouse gases well beyond their earlier pledges is both a major diplomatic breakthrough and  assuming both sides can carry out their promises  an enormously positive step in the uncertain battle against climate change.

title: Best Wishes, Harry Reid Style
Indian Doctors Respond to Sterilizations
description: A team of doctors rushed to central India after at least a dozen women died and others became seriously ill following mass sterilization surgeries meant for population control.

title: U.S. Accepts Trinitys Plan to Test Design of Guardrail
description: The federal government has accepted Trinity Industries plans for testing highway guardrail products that are suspected of malfunctioning during crashes and potentially slicing through vehicles, even as lawmakers and lawyers criticized their adequacy.

title: Landrieu and Cassidy Race to Be First With a Pipeline Vote
description: The Louisiana Senate fight moved to the halls of Congress on Wednesday as Senator Mary Landrieu, the Democrat, and Representative Bill Cassidy, her Republican challenger, both pushed for votes to approve the Keystone XL pipeline.

title: When All Else Fails, Embryo Donation Offers Hope
description: I doubt if anyone having trouble conceiving wakes up thinking: What about adopting an embryo? In the crushing world of infertility, that seems like an even more distant option. The fertility clinic in Seattle told me we only qualified to be a part of its embryo-donation program because we had been such failures in trying to conceive. For the first time in our four-year battle with infertility, I was happy to admit our shortcomings.

title: Financial Aid, Simplified: A Better College Calculator
description: The financial-aid calculators maintained by colleges are a case study in both flawed bureaucracy and flawed customer service. As part of a 2008 higher-education law, Congress required colleges to build the calculators  online tools to let families estimate how much theyd really have to pay to attend a specific college.

title: U.S. Tells U.N. Panel of Steps to Revise Interrogation Policy
description: The Obama administration told a United Nations panel in Geneva on Wednesday that the United States had tortured terrorism suspects after the Sept. 11 attacks but that it had since taken steps to prevent any future use of unlawful, coercive interrogation techniques.

title: Nationalist Youths Attack U.S. Sailors in Turkey
description: ISTANBUL  Members of a Turkish nationalist youth group assaulted three visiting American sailors in Istanbul on Wednesday, hurling balloons filled with red paint at them, putting white sacks over their heads and calling them murderers.

title: The Places Are Set, but Not for All
description: A bitter satire and a realist drama, a position paper and a cri de coeur, Han Ongs Chairs and a Long Table mingles rage, rational argument and bleak comedy. In a faceless New York conference room, four Asian-American actors and a white P.R. consultant gather to strategize for a coming forum. A fictional theater on the opposite coast, the Laguna Rep, has just announced it will present The Center of the World, a new play set in Imperial China. But the casting has incited controversy.

title: Busting a Barrier, Preserving the Seams
description: Beth Newell and Adil Abubakar hit a snag early in their attempt to start a clothing company. The manufacturer was having difficulty believing that their measurements were accurate.

title: Monte dei Paschi Reports Nearly $1 Billion Loss in Third Quarter
description: FRANKFURT  Monte dei Paschi di Siena, Europes oldest bank and one of its most troubled, on Wednesday reported a loss of 797 million euros, or $991 million, in the third quarter after it drastically increased the amount of money set aside to cover problem loans.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Meet the Republicans Top Guy on the Environment, James Inhofe
description: No sooner did President Obama and President Xi Jinping of China announce goals for combatting climate change than Senator Jim Inhofe denounced them. The Oklahoma Republican called the accord a non-binding charade on Wednesday and told The Washington Post that he would do his utmost to let environmental devastation continue apace. In his actual words: As we enter a new Congress, I will do everything in my power to rein in and shed light on the EPAs unchecked regulations.

title: A Private Tour of a New Brooklyn Cafes Colombian Coffee Farms
description: Since opening its first roaster in Bogot in 2006, the Colombian company Devocin has sourced and roasted what its owner Steven Sutton categorizes as third-wave coffee, a term he reserves for the highest-quality artisanal beans. Now, Sutton and his business partners sell 150 tons of coffee each year in the United States and Colombia. And this fall, in anticipation of its first stateside outpost, a flagship roaster and cafe that opens in Brooklyns Williamsburg neighborhood on November 16, Devocin invited T onto its coffee farms for a peek at where it all began.

title: Questions Raised as Barclays Takes a Step Back
description: Barclays is once again exposed.

title: Deal on Carbon Emissions by Obama and Xi Jinping Raises Hopes for Upcoming Paris Climate Talks
description: WASHINGTON  The historic announcement by President Obama and President Xi Jinping of China that they will commit to targets for cuts in their nations carbon emissions has fundamentally shifted the global politics of climate change. The agreement has given a fresh jolt of optimism to negotiations aimed at reaching a new international climate treaty next year in Paris, where the American and Chinese targets are expected to be the heart of the deal.

title: Foreign Exchange Settlement Shows the Lessons Banks Have Learned
description: The settlements by five global banks for manipulating the foreign currency markets show a strategy based on strength in numbers: The more banks that are disciplined, the less any one of them will be the focus of public attention for their violations. The total fine of $4.25 billion imposed by British, American and Swiss regulators sounds like a lot of money, but no one bank has to bear the brunt of the bad publicity.

title: Thanksgiving Office Hours: Ask All Your Questions
description: Hows your holiday planning going? You have an order in for a turkey? Youve decided whether to brine? You know what side dishes youre going to cook? What pies? Do you know how to set the table? Are you going to have place cards? (Do you know whos coming?) Whats the wine situation? Is there going to be enough?

title: Turkish Nationalists Attack U.S. Sailors
description: A video posted by a nationalist group, the Turkish Youth Union, shows three American sailors being attacked in Istanbul.

title: Ask Not for Whom the Cell Tolls
description: Phones! Phones, ringing in the concert hall!

title: Driven | 2015 Cadillac ATS Coupe
description: Cadillac builds another drivers car, now it just needs to get the word out.

title: Video: The 2015 Cadillac ATS Coupe Is Not Your Aunts Coupe DeVille
description: UPDATED

title: Who Is Xi Jinping?
description: When Xi Jinping became the president of China in 2013, New York Times reporters discussed his background.

title: Risk Model Seen as Reducing Military Suicides
description: Military doctors could reduce suicides among soldiers with psychiatric conditions by using a new screening system that flags those at highest risk of taking their own lives, a new study suggests.

title: Inside the Senates Inner Sanctum
description: Our colleague Stephen Crowley provides a view inside the inner sanctum of the Senate, which is normally closed to staff members and journalists.

title: Old Masters, Still in Glorious, Youthful Form
description: This fall, its greatto be old  or at least, older. Across a number of fields, star performers who are over the traditional retirement age are showing they can still compete with young upstarts. Below, a sampling of this seasons old masters:

title: Justices Hear Challenge to Alabama Redistricting
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Wednesday wrestled with the role race may play in drawing legislative maps.

title: A Sorrow Transcended by Beauty
description: Schuberts astonishing Winterreise is like a dramatic monologue, a tale told in 24 songs, to poems by Wilhelm Mller. The singer becomes the protagonist of this bleak story about a young man jilted by his beloved, who now fancies someone else. Bitter, despairing and longing for death, he leaves her house at night and wanders a snowy path by the river where they once enjoyed time together. His tears freeze on his face. He passes a graveyard, which in his mind seems an inviting inn. He finally encounters a pathetic man playing a hurdy-gurdy and asks to join him.

title: White House Nominates Lazard Banker to Treasury Post
description: The Obama administration said on Wednesday that it would nominate Antonio Weiss, a top mergers deal maker, as the Treasury Departments top official for domestic finance matters.

title: Inquiry Into SpaceShip Twos Crash Says Feathers Were Unlocked Prematurely
description: The surviving pilot of the space plane that crashed in the California desert on Oct. 31 has told investigators that he did not know that the co-pilot, who was killed, had unlocked the crafts feathers, movable parts at the back of the craft that are supposed to slow it down for re-entry.

title: Minnesota Orchestra Removes Interim From Presidents Title
description: The Minnesota Orchestra has appointed Kevin Smith its new president and chief executive, the chairman of the orchestras board, Gordon M. Sprenger, announced Wednesday. Mr. Smith was elected to the position by a unanimous vote of the board, in effect confirming him in the role in which he has been acting in an interim capacity since Sept. 1, when the previous president and chief executive, Michael Henson, stepped down.

title: On Income Stagnation
description: Sorry about lack of posting; Im scrambling on a couple of fronts, most crucially textbook revisions

title: A Call to Reinstate Tony Awards for Sound Design
description: Seeking to influence a Tony Awards committee meeting on Thursday, Broadway sound designers have submitted a petition with 32,495 signatures urging the committee to reverse its decision to eliminate the Tonys for best sound design for a play and for a musical. Among the signatories are the Tony winners Hugh Jackman, Lin-Manuel Miranda, Diane Paulus and Stephen Sondheim.

title: Gun Control Can Win at the State Level
description: When it comes to stronger gun safety laws, all politics is increasingly local.

title: Floating Gracefully Into Madness
description: The Mikhailovsky Ballet of St. Petersburg, reinvented in 2007 by the Russian businessman Vladimir Kekhman, is a curious entity. Natalia Osipova and Ivan Vasiliev, two of Russian ballets brightest lights, are principals. At one point, the Spanish contemporary choreographer Nacho Duato was brought in as its artistic director.

title: China Deals
description: I wish that I believed that logic and reason played any role in the politics of climate change. Because if I did, the news of the US-China deal on carbon emissions would be a moment for sudden new optimism.

title: Twitter Speaks Up With Growth Strategy Intended to Soothe Wall Street
description: Twitter is finally learning how to go beyond a tweet to explain what it is doing, and Wall Street likes what it hears.

title: Secure the Roots, Then Reach Out
description: Blame David Siteks cats, at least in part, for the urgently clanging sound, somewhere between a gamelan and a fire alarm, that opens TV on the Radios sixth album, Seeds.

title: For Some, Daw Aung San Suu Kyi Falls Short of Expectations in Myanmar
description: KAWHMU, Myanmar  The pastel-painted vocational school hacked out of the bamboo jungle is a long way from the international salons where Myanmars symbol of resistance, Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, is now an established figure.

title: Top Prospects Injury Renews Concerns About Fighting
description: Connor McDavid, the No. 1 prospect for next Junes N.H.L. draft, is expected to miss five to six weeks after breaking his right hand Tuesday night in a fight during a junior hockey game.

title: Keeping Broadways Steps Alive
description: Works of ballet and modern dance have a chance of surviving in repertory, but the choreography in Broadway musicals generally lives and dies with productions of those musicals. Even revivals dont always save what can be saved.

title: New Yorks Miserable Voter Turnout Isnt an Accident
description: New Yorkers have become much too accustomed to civic embarrassment. Youd think the state would cringe to see that it came in fourth from the bottom in voter turnout in last weeks midterm election. Only 28.8 percent of eligible voters showed up, a level of indifference that the Editorial Board called shameful in this mornings editorial. Thats the lowest turnout for a gubernatorial election since the state began keeping records.

title: Window Washers Dangle From Tower
description: Two window washers were suspended precariously from the side of the World Trade Center tower, 69 floors above the street.

title: Tours of Duty and the Price Paid at Home
description: When I was in Afghanistan, all I wanted to do was come back to America. But when I got home to America, there was this empty feeling, and I just wanted to go back to Afghanistan.

title: Good Pictures, Bad Timing
description: When a legendary curator chided Will Brown to find his way as a photographer, he set aside his pictures of his Philadelphia neighborhood. Today, they attest to the changes in the area.

title: Internet Firms Are Far Behind Cable Companies in Political Donations
description: As a debate in Washington on Internet regulation hits a new phase, the gulf in political giving between the cable industry and Internet companies  which find themselves on opposite sides of the net-neutrality issue  remains large.

title: Patricia Clarksons Beauty Routine
description: Patricia Clarkson, 54, has been acting for almost three decades, including lauded roles for film (The Untouchables and Pieces of April), television (Frasier and Six Feet Under) and theater. Her latest stage appearance is on Broadway, in The Elephant Man (previews started on Friday), in which she plays the pivotal Mrs. Kendal opposite Bradley Cooper. A native of New Orleans, Ms. Clarkson lives in Manhattan, in the West Village.

title: The Jonathan Gruber Controversy and Washingtons Dirty Little Secret
description: Suppose that Congress decides that everyone in America should have an iPhone. There are two ways it can do this:

title: Pictures of the Day: Turkey and Elsewhere
description: Turkey and More  Pictures of the Day

title: In Shake-Up, Iraqi Premier Replaces 36 Commanders
description: BAGHDAD  The recently installed Iraqi prime minister removed 36 military commanders in a sweeping shake-up on Wednesday, in his first public attempt to put his mark on the Iraqi security forces battling to retake territory from Islamic State militants.

title: In the Words of Xi Jinping: Unraveling an Ancient Saying
description: Wait  isnt belling the cat a good thing?

title: For the Hard Work of Looking Good
description: Buying clothes is easy; buying inspiration is hard. So come shop with me. Not to Blue in Green or the Real McCoys  well get to them later  but lets start in Midtown, at Kinokuniya, hot spot for Japanese printed matter. Down in the basement, plop down in the bustling magazine section, right by the full rack devoted to the mens wear bibles.

title: Kelsey Grammer to Join Broadway Finding Neverland
description: Emmy Award winner Kelsey Grammer will return to Broadway this spring in the new musical Finding Neverland, playing the largely comic role of Charles Frohman, the theater producer of Peter Pan playwright J.M. Barrie, according to a show advertisement to be published on Sunday in The New York Times.

title: J.C. Penney Reports Flat Sales
description: J.C. Penney reported flat sales growth on Wednesday in a sign that the troubled department store chain continues to suffer from sluggish consumer spending as it undergoes a major corporate turnaround.

title: Nov. 12, 2014  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Turkey, Hong Kong, Afghanistan and the United States.

title: Louis Vuitton Celebrates Monogram
description: A party for a new Louis Vuitton collection draw s lots of celebrities.

title: Louis Vuittons Famous Fans Celebrate a New Line of Bags
description: CHLO SEVIGNY COMES from a long line of monogrammers.

title: Victory for Polish Players at Rand Senior Teams
description: Bridge can be a strange game at times. Suppose you and your partner do not reach the ideal spot, suffering from a noticeable paucity of trumps. That possibility might not occur to your opponents. They might assume you have landed on your feet and as a consequence misdefend.

title: With 2 New Jets, Chinese Manufacturer May Become Global Contender
description: ZHUHAI, China  In a private room at Airshow China set aside for discreet deal making, the Commercial Aviation Corporation of China has hung a picture of President Xi Jinping sitting in the cockpit of one of its new planes.

title: Chelsea Clinton and Lupita Nyongo Honored at the Glamour Women of the Year Gala
description: It was 10:30 p.m. at the restaurant Harlow on East 56th Street, and Samantha Power, the United States ambassador to the United Nations, was making her way to her dinner table.

title: Taking a Fans-Eye View of a Much-Loved Band
description: Pulp: A Film About Life, Death & Supermarkets puts a neighborhood spin on the typical rock documentary. Though there are the expected scenes of the Britpop rockers performing onstage and discussing their careers, the film is largely an affectionate look at the Pulps fans and its hometown, Sheffield, England.

title: No Video. No Photos. No Names. Inside New Yorks Ebola Monitoring Operation.
description: New York Citys health department runs a 24-hour-a-day operation that defends against Ebola; its efforts include tracking more than 300 people for symptoms of the disease.

title: The Ace Hotel Introduces Bottled Cocktails (and a Negroni Recipe)
description: House-pickled cocktail onions and orange juice  la minute have made the contemporary barfly more sophisticated than ever, but also more demanding. Drinks must be diluted just so, the choice of ingredients exact  and it all has to be done now, now, now. Many hotel bars, like those at the Ace and the Mystic, are leading the charge, which has only furthered public perception of the hotel-room minibar as an outdated amenity: Why settle for a rum and Coke when a perfectly mixed mojito is just an elevator ride away?

title: Democrats Look to Raise Senator Warrens Profile
description: Senator Elizabeth Warren of Massachusetts was a hit on the campaign trail for Democrats and is a strong fund-raising draw  a fact that was not lost on Senate Democrats despite their pasting in last weeks elections.

title: Fashion Plus Street Wear
description: Mark Anthony Green, a writer and artist, will show his hand- and machine-stitched text-based works at Art Basel in Miami Beach and in Mexico City early next year.

title: U.S. Cracks Down on Debt Brokers Who Exposed Consumers Financial Details
description: As part of a multiyear government crackdown on scams that target people in financial distress, a federal court in Washington has ordered two consumer debt brokers to notify more than 70,000 people that they may be at risk for identity or debt fraud after the companies posted financial details and other personal information about them online.

title: Supreme Court Lets Gay Marriages Proceed in Kansas
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Wednesday allowed same-sex marriages to proceed in Kansas, lifting a temporary stay issued Monday by Justice Sonia Sotomayor.

title: Met Asks Stars to Share Fiscal Pain
description: The Metropolitan Opera, whose financial struggles led it to cut the pay of its orchestra, chorus, stagehands and other workers last summer after a labor battle, said Wednesday that it was also asking its solo singers voluntarily to lower their fees, including some of operas biggest stars.

title: The Seasons Statement Topcoat
description: Discerning buyers are opting for tailored topcoats in interesting colors, fabrics and longer and larger silhouettes. Here are some options.

title: Cisco Systems Income Falls, but Quarterly Revenue Sets Record as Pressures Mount
description: Cisco Systems, the worlds largest maker of the networking equipment that it says powers the Internet, could use a little energy of its own.

title: North of Normal
description: Its mid-November, the afternoons stop short in darkness and the polar vortex, like a seasonal allergy, is coming to town.

title: Bayou Meets Broadway: Staging Duck Dynasty
description: Theyre not exactly the von Trapps trilling about edelweiss, but the Robertson family of the reality series Duck Dynasty wants to sing to you about faith and food, duck calls and swamp moss. And theyve convinced a team from Broadway to bring their story to the stage, in Las Vegas for starters.

title: Samuel Zell Said to Be Among Bidders for Albertsons Stores
description: Samuel Zell has his sights on the grocery business.

title: Racy Gay Scenes in How to Get Away With Murder Draw a Following
description: John Grauwiler was seated on a Chesterfield sofa in the back lounge area of the Atlas Social Club, a Hells Kitchen gay bar, on a Thursday night a couple of weeks ago, watching an episode of the new ABC series How to Get Away With Murder.

title: The Sunny Palette of Jonathan Adler
description: Last year, when Jonathan Adler was asked to redesign the 309 guest rooms and suites of the Eau Palm Beach Resort & Spa in Manalapan, Fla., he worked with three colors.

title: Whats the Best Way to Accessorize a Small Living Room?
description: Q. Whats the best way to accessorize a sofa and coffee table in a small living room?

title: It Goes Up and Stays Up
description: Until recently, humid spaces like showers and kitchen backsplashes were hostile to wallpaper. But a new waterproofing system from Wall & Deco, an Italian company, allows you to paper almost any part of your home. With the Wet System, patterns are printed on 37-inch-wide fiberglass rolls and supplied along with a primer, adhesive and protective finish. Once installed, the material is resistant to dampness, yellowing, abrasion and harsh cleaning products. Wet System can be applied to most surfaces, including plasterboard, PVC and ceramic tiles. It is available in any of Wall & Decos hundreds of customizable designs, including, from left, Hanami and Hanamachi, for $250 a square yard. Information: 305-865-8577 or imoderni.com.

title: Discounts at Kikkerland, Design Within Reach, Garnet Hill and Michele Varian
description: Ole Jensen melamine kitchenware for Room Copenhagen is 50 percent off at Kikkerland, from Thursday to Nov. 19 (a colander, about $40, is now about $20); 493 Avenue of the Americas (West 12th Street), 212-262-5000, kikkerland.nyc.

title: Twentieth-Century Express Stop
description: After 18 years and two Hamptons locations, John Heilmann and Tim DiSalvo have opened a Homenature shop in Manhattan. Mr. Heilmann said that he chose the 6,000-square-foot loftlike space in the Flatiron district because the area is such a home furnishings destination  you can walk around this neighborhood and get your whole house done. Designed by Peter Weed, the shop offers upholstery and case goods, bedding, rugs and tabletop accessories all based on American midcentury designs. The owners also formed partnerships with textile companies like Libeco, a producer of Belgian linen, to develop fabrics that they sell by the yard. But the star just may be the lighting based on fixtures that once hung in the Prime Burger diner in Midtown. Mr. DiSalvo rescued the originals as the restaurant was about to be demolished and reproduced them. How could we not? he asked. Homenature is at 7 West 18th Street, 212-675-4136, homenature.com.

title: Gravy Boats: Dripping With Charm
description: A gravy boat may not be the kind of thing you use every day, but on Thanksgiving its hard to imagine doing without one.

title: In Los Angeles, a Public Display of Affection
description: When people ask Bob Hale about the house that he and his wife, Maxine Morris, built two years ago for their family in Los Angeles, he has a standard response. I like to say I have a house wrapped in love, Mr. Hale said.

title: A Wineglass Thats Always Tipsy
description: Ron Arad, the Israeli-born, London-based designer, doesnt appreciate a fussy table setting and is anything but a wine snob. Speaking at a press conference in Istanbul earlier this year, he said that the subtleties of wineglass varieties eluded him; a vintage registers on his palate as good or bad, no matter the size or shape of its container. Having been asked to create glassware for the Turkish manufacturer Pasabahce, he accepted that different vessels were necessary for red and white wine, but saw no reason that they couldnt be conjoined. That is how he came up with the Red/White goblet, into which you can pour either color simply by which way you turn the glass. The goblet is one of eight pieces Mr. Arad designed for the Pasabahce glassware collection called Nude (the name refers to the objects transparency). It will be available in spring and cost $150 for a pair. Information: 212-683-1600.

title: Frankie Grande, Ariana Grandes Half Brother, Stars in Rock of Ages
description: Ive always loved Franzs quirky lust for life and new things, said Frankie Grande, 31, as he prepared for his Broadway star turn this week in the long-running musical Rock of Ages. Everything is new and shiny and pretty to him.

title: A Rethought Bronze Age
description: Ingrid Donat, a sculptor who lives and works outside Paris, makes furniture of cast bronze. Her limited-edition pieces, which can weigh over 1,000 pounds, have streamlined forms and geometric patterning inspired by Art Deco design and primitive African art. Each is the result of a painstaking process involving drawings, wax models, prototypes, casting, welding, chiseling, sandblasting and patinating. One recent piece took two years to complete and required 15 helpers.

title: Leaving Shame on a Lower Floor
description: Among the many vertiginous renderings for the penthouse apartments at 432 Park Avenue, the nearly 1,400-foot-high Cuisenaire rod that topped off last month, is one of its master (or mistress) of the universe bathrooms, a glittering, reflective container of glass and marble. The image shows a huge egg-shaped tub planted before a 10-foot-square window, 90 or more stories up. All of Lower Manhattan is spread out like the view from someones private plane.

title: Rehabbing an Old Piano
description: Heres what youll need.

title: Crafts Classes With a Boozy Twist
description: On first glimpse, the scene at Phebes, a burger-and-beer place on the Bowery in Manhattan, had all the usual elements of Monday night revelry.
