title: Obama to Detail Immigration Plans in Address on Thursday
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama will speak to the nation in a prime-time address on Thursday, asserting his authority to protect up to five million undocumented immigrants from deportation, the White House said, and setting in motion an immediate confrontation with Republicans about the limits of a presidents executive powers.

title: An Art-Ballet Hybrid Video Scored by Chairlifts Caroline Polachek
description: [Watch the video on Vimeo.]

title: Cow Wow Picks a Target Audience for Its Flavored Milk
description: We published a case study last week about a chief executive considering a major course correction less than two years after introducing a line of cereal-flavored milks called Cow Wow.

title: Apps to Compete With Snapchat in Temporary Messaging
description: NOT all messages need to live forever. And with the right smartphone app, it is simple to deliver text messages, photos or videos with a short life span.

title: App Smart | Self-Destructing Messages
description: Kit Eaton reviews Snapchat, Wickr and Burn Note, three communication apps whose messages disappear after a certain period of time.

title: Uber Needs to Grow Up
description: Uber is one start-up that needs to grow up fast.

title: Verbatim: De Blasio on Rand Paul
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio of New York on the political appeal of Senator Rand Paul of Kentucky, whom he cited as a chief threat to Democratic presidential prospects in 2016. Mr. de Blasio was speaking with the Politico reporter Mike Allen at a breakfast in Washington on Wednesday.

title: 36 Hours in Seattle
description: Explore street view, find our points of interest and sign in to your Google account to save your map.

title: 36 Hours in Seattle
description: Seattle is in boom mode, and for visitors that means creative restaurants, a vibrant nightlife scene and stunning art.

title: Soundhawk Smart Listening System: A Hearing Helper
description: MILLIONS of Americans have some degree of hearing difficulty, but only a small percentage regularly wear hearing aids. People in the hearing sciences have long argued that technology is partly to blame.

title: 36 Hours in Seattle
description: The sky is often gray, the residents tend to be muted (except when cheering their teams), calm waters lap the green cityscape, but beneath its mild exterior, Seattle has always careened wildly between boom and bust. For better or worse, boom is the mode of the day. Though the tunnel project designed to give the waterfront a highway-free makeover is currently stalled, the rest of downtown is roaring with new construction and high-end repurposing of historic buildings. The food has never been better, and the traffic never worse. Fall days can be wet, but as any photographer will tell you, the city is at its loveliest when slicked with rain.

title: Audis Prologue Concept Marks New Styling Direction
description: LOS ANGELES  Whats next for Audi styling, which is due for a major update in the next year or two? The German automaker offered a sneak peek Wednesday at the 2014 Los Angeles auto show with the introduction of its flagship-size Prologue coupe concept. While there were no plans announced to put the Prologue into production, the company said its styling would influence the look of the next generation of A8, A7 and A6 models.

title: Low Inflation Replaces Joblessness as Reason Fed Wont Raise Rates
description: WASHINGTON  The sluggish pace of inflation is replacing unemployment as the main reason the Federal Reserve is not ready to start raising interest rates.

title: An Open-Air Bentley With Upper-Crust Roots
description: LOS ANGELES  Bentley, the British ultraluxury automaker, unveiled the Grand Convertible concept, a droptop version of its Mulsanne flagship, Wednesday at the 2014 Los Angeles suto show. The convertible is meant to compete with a similar car, the very successful Rolls-Royce Phantom Drophead Coup.

title: Bob Marley: The Face of Legal Pot
description: An enterprising Seattle marijuana investment company has struck a deal with the estate of Bob Marley, the reggae singer and pot evangelist, to market a global cannabis brand. Heirloom Jamaican cannabis strains are promised by the new company, Marley Natural, based on those that Bob preferred.

title: Brooklyn Fire Kills One and Injures Over a Dozen
description: A 24-year-old man died and more than a dozen other people were being treated for injuries after a fire tore through a building in Brooklyn on Wednesday, the authorities said.

title: Police Officer Describes Clash at Ashram
description: A police officer injured in overnight clashes with supporters of an Indian guru, Baba Rampal Maharaj, defended the police position, saying that Mr. Rampals supporters initiated the violence.

title: Activists Outline Expectations for New Ferguson Commission
description: A member of the newly named Ferguson Commission spoke optimistically Wednesday about the panels potential to create change in the St. Louis area, but some young activists said they were skeptical.

title: Driven | 2015 BMW X4 xDrive35i
description: In the end, the sure-footed X4 crossover offers more sport, less utility.

title: A Cooking Class in Sicily
description: The chef Lele Torrisi guides a visiting Canadian couple through a market in Syracuse before teaching them the basics of homemade Sicilian cooking.

title: In Sicily, Market to Class to Table
description: There is plenty for tourists to take in at the Ortigia market in Syracuse, Sicily: the distinctly southern Italian hum of the crowd; spices and vegetables so diverse they could color a rainbow and the calm blue sea in the distance.

title: Ex-Chief of Iceland Bank Sentenced to Jail for Role in 2008 Crisis
description: LONDON  The former chief executive of Landsbanki of Iceland was sentenced to prison on Wednesday, the third of the top executives of the countrys three largest banks that the government has successfully prosecuted and jailed for misconduct during the financial crisis.

title: Ferguson Mayor and Police Chief Decline Interview Requests
description: The mayor and police chief of Ferguson will not be speaking to reporters until after a St. Louis County grand jury decides whether to indict one of the citys officers, according to a statement released Wednesday.

title: TransCanada Has Bigger Problems Than Keystone XL Pipeline
description: A sparring match with an activist is a bigger deal for TransCanada than the companys troubled Keystone XL pipeline.

title: A Local Touch at Thompson Hotel in Miami Beach
description: Miamis trendiest hotels reside in South Beach, but the Thompson Miami Beach, opening Nov. 21, adds to the growing number of stylish addresses in the area just north, known as Mid-Beach.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Protesters Attack Hong Kong Legislature
description: A small group of pro-democracy protesters stormed Hong Kongs legislature late Tuesday and early Wednesday. Pro-democracy lawmakers condemned the violence, saying it damaged their movement.

title: Video: BMW Expands Its Lineup With the 2015 X4 xDrive35i
description: In a simpler time, the BMW lineup was pretty straightforward. There were 3, 5 and 7 Series offerings, and, from time to time, a 6 Series, too. There were powertrain selections, of course, and it was possible to choose among two-door coupes, wagons and convertibles. But that was about as wild as the choices got.

title: Are Some Professions Less Honest Than Others? Bank on It, Researchers Find
description: As banking scandals have mounted over the past decade, some critics have suggested that the industry simply harbors a dishonest culture. Now, three economists from the University of Zurich have tested the idea.

title: Cory Arcangel Teams Up With the Musician and Composer Chris DEon at the Met
description: When the multimedia artist Cory Arcangel was in Montreal preparing for his first major Canadian exhibition at DHC/ART last year, he couldnt resist contacting the Canadian keyboardist and avant-garde composer Chris DEon. Though Arcangel is a celebrated figure in the art world, he also studied classical guitar at the Oberlin Conservatory of Music and is a composer; he calls himself a huge fan of DEon, who has released two albums including a collaboration with his fellow Canadian Grimes. Despite Arcangels fame, he had no idea whether DEon would even know who he was. DEon did, and went on to perform some of Arcangels compositions alongside his own at an event in Montreal later that year.

title: Teachers New Pet: An App That Tracks Students
description: On Nov. 17, the Times technology reporter Natasha Singer wrote about ClassDojo, an app teachers use to track  and manage  classroom behavior. Using the app, teachers can, for example, show the class who has followed directions or forgotten homework.

title: Obama Makes Pitch to Expand High-Speed Internet Access to Schools
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama on Wednesday took a break from crisis and gridlock to advance two often-overlooked priorities focused on children, one to wire more of the nations schools to the Internet and the other to overhaul child care for low-income families.

title: Florida and F.T.C. Accuse Firms of Deceptively Selling Tech Support
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Trade Commission and the State of Florida on Wednesday announced that they had obtained a court order to temporarily shut down and freeze the assets of two telemarketing operations that the commission said had deceptively sold more than $120 million in technical support services and software.

title: Electricity in the Air
description: The most thrilling rendition of La Vie en Rose this side of Edith Piaf: That would describe Christine Andreass performance of Piafs passionate signature song, at 54 Below on Tuesday evening.

title: 10 From One Family Are Killed in Sinai Blast
description: CAIRO  Ten members of one family, including children, were killed late Tuesday when munitions struck a home in the northern Sinai Peninsula, a region that has been the site of fierce battles between the Egyptian military and insurgent fighters, military officials and witnesses said Wednesday.

title: Ryan Planning for Tax Overhaul and Health Law Repeal
description: Representative Paul D. Ryan of Wisconsin, the newly minted chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, predicted Wednesday that a broad overhaul of the tax code would move forward, whether President Obama issues an executive order on immigration or not, but its success would depend on the administration being engaged on the issue.

title: Where Theres No Smoke, Theres the Word of the Year
description: Vape has been named Oxford Dictionaries international word of the year for 2014, triumphing over a field that also included bae (a term of endearment originating in African-American English), indyref (a Twitter-friendly term for the Scottish independence referendum) and slactivism (look it up).

title: Republicans Lash Out on Immigration Plan
description: President Obamas executive action on immigration has been brewing for awhile, and within minutes of todays announcement, Republicans hit back.

title: Tommy Tune Joins the Cast of Lady, Be Good for Encores!
description: The nine-time Tony Award-winning actor Tommy Tune will appear in a New York musical for the first time in many years in the coming Encores! production of Lady, Be Good, the shows producers announced on Wednesday.

title: The Strange Religious Future
description: I had the privilege of being part of aFordham University event last nighton the future of religion, responding (along with a rather more distinguished fellow panelist) to remarks by the religion journalist and academic Molly Worthen on the roots of institutional faiths present-day developed-world decline. There was, I think, some basic agreement among all of the panelists about some of the patterns and shiftswere experiencing right now (the decline of institutional authority, the working out of the sexual revolution, the rise of the so-called nones), and then a number of interesting things were said about the possible unknowns that mighteither accelerate or redirect current trends: There was discussion ofhow institutional-cum-orthodox forms of faith might experience some sort of revival, of how spiritual-but-not-religious forms of faith might represent the vanguard of an entirely new era of religious understanding, and of how religious forces outside the developed world (Islam, Pentecostalism, Chinese Christianity) might matter more to the West itself than a Western-centric vision allows.

title: New Opposition to Lazard Bankers Nomination to Treasury Post
description: Since the Obama administration nominated Antonio Weiss, a senior deal maker at Lazard, for a high-level position at the Treasury Department, the move has drawn criticism from some unusual quarters.

title: Secret Service Arrests Man Within Block of White House
description: WASHINGTON  The Secret Service arrested an Iowa man outside the White House on Wednesday who had a hunting rifle and ammunition in his car, according to law enforcement officials.

title: First Draft Focus: A Capitol Lottery
Brooklyn Girl in Organ Donation Dispute Dies After Being Taken Off Life Support
description: With the fate of her organs decided, Thaiya Spruill-Smith, a Brooklyn girl who was declared brain-dead after being violently shaken, was taken off life support and died on Wednesday morning.

title: Polanskis Musical Gets More Nibbles
description: PARIS  For those who savor a good Broadway catastrophe, Dance of the Vampires is near the top of the shortlist of infamy. But for the Oscar-winning film director Roman Polanski, that flop 2002 musical, based on his 1967 film The Fearless Vampire Killers, deserves  no, demands  another chance.

title: Sleepy Jones Sets Up Shop on Both Coasts
description: Just in time for hibernation season, Andy Spade, Anthony Sperduti and Chad Buri have opened the first brick-and-mortar outpost for their loungewear line Sleepy Jones. The year-old label was previously housed in a pop-up shop on the Bowery in downtown Manhattan and otherwise only available online. The new store is located a stones throw from Opening Ceremony on Howard Street and stocks the brands playful pajamas as well as an array of design-centric lifestyle goods, like Postalco notebooks, Fredericks and Mae game sets, Hopewell Quilts and assorted vintage accessories. And lest those on the West Coast fear missing out, a second storewill follow on its heels tomorrow in Santa Monica. Here, exclusively for T, the brand debuts a film shot in Italy in celebration of the openings, LIsola di Sleepy Jones, created by Spade and the director Oscar Boyson.

title: Time Lapse of Lake-Effect Snowstorm
description: A rush of cold air from the north set the perfect conditions for the moisture coming off the Great Lakes to create sprawling snow bands across Buffalo.

title: For Cyber Monday, Hotel Deals With an American Accent
description: Its usually the promise of sun and sand during the cold winter months that wins the favor of Cyber Monday shoppers looking for a cheap getaway. But this year historic hotels across the country might give Caribbean beachfronts a run for their money with the promise of picturesque settings, luxury renovations and solid savings.

title: Shopping and Eating Amid History in Richmond, Va.
description: For decades, the 18th-century Church Hill neighborhood of Richmond, Va., has been a dont-go-after-dark spot. One of the citys oldest residential enclaves, its historic townhouses, gas lamps and St. Johns Church  where Patrick Henry proclaimed Give me liberty  have long been tended to by a small band of passionate preservationists in an area of encroaching crime and poverty. But undervalued real estate and unparalleled views of downtown and the James River have increasingly drawn a fiercely loyal, self-starter set of residents. These days, Church Hill has some of the citys most appealing shops and dining spots.

title: Nov. 19, 2014  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Israel, Britain, Egypt and Indonesia.

title: A Guide to Buying Just About Anything
description: The basics you probably know by now, at least for the things you buy frequently. How to buy a book online. Pick a good apple in the supermarket. Find sneakers that fit.

title: When Calls for Revenge Overwhelm Chinas Courts
description: Shut up! shouted Feng Wei, a judge from the Sichuan Higher Peoples Court, banging his gavel. We were in a courtroom here, about 60 miles southeast of Chengdu, the provincial capital. At stake was the life of Li Yan, sentenced to death in 2011 for killing her husband during an argument.

title: Food Fight: Researching and Debating the Future of G.M.O.s
description: Overview | Over 50 countries and the state of Vermont require that genetically modified organisms, or G.M.O.s, are labeled. More than 20 other states are considering similar laws. But whats the fuss? G.M.O. ingredients are already in most pantries and refrigerators in the United States  in the form of canola oil, corn cereals, soy products and refined sugar. Are these genetically modified plants a threat to human health and natural ecosystems? Or are they a biotech solution to crop blight and other diverse problems?

title: Skiing in a No Fall Zone
description: Teton Gravity Research traveled to the Grand Teton National Park to ski Mount Morans three classic lines: the Sickle, East Horn and Skillet.

title: Senate Report Finds Goldman and JPMorgan Can Influence Commodities
description: A two-year Senate-led investigation is throwing back the curtain on the outsize and sometimes hidden sway that Wall Street banks have gained over the markets for essential commodities like oil, aluminum and coal.

title: Apples Plans for Beats Music Start to Take Shape
description: Apples plans for Beats, the company it acquired for $3 billion earlier this year, are coming into sharper focus.

title: Ford Unleashes a Powerful Mustang
description: LOS ANGELES  The latest Shelby GT350 Mustang was put on display here at the 2014 Los Angeles Auto Show on Wednesday as something of a homage to the late performance guru Carroll Shelby. The car is based on the recently introduced sixth generation of Fords classic pony car.

title: Billboard, Changing the Charts, Will Count Streaming Services
description: Streaming music services like Spotify have brought big changes to the music industry. But one important part of the business has not kept up: Billboards album chart.

title: How OkCupid Has Become More Inclusive on Gender and Sexuality
description: When it comes to meeting potential partners (or, at least, looking at their profiles), OkCupid offers users lots of choices. But critics have pointed out an area where the service provides much less choice: identifying ones own gender and sexuality. At least for some users, though, thats changing  and many see it as an important steptoward inclusivity.

title: Video: Skiing in a No Fall Zone
description: Behind the Line is a video series produced by Teton Gravity Research that takes you into the minds of skiers. In each episode, the athletes will look back on a line, a jump or a session, and discuss the moment.

title: Reading The Times With Sarah McNally
description: Sarah McNally owns McNally Jackson Books in Manhattan. She says that as soon as she had a steady income, she began seven-day delivery of The Times.

title: Al Sharpton Criticizes New York Times Report on Unpaid Taxes
description: The Rev. Al Sharpton on Wednesday sharply criticized a New York Times article that explored his history of unpaid taxes, rent and other bills, calling the report misleading and totally out of context.

title: Senate Report on Wall Streets Role in Commodities
description: A two-year Senate-led investigation is throwing back the curtain on the outsized and sometimes hidden sway that Wall Street banks have gained over the markets for essential commodities like oil, aluminum and coal.

title: Keira Knightley and Benedict Cumberbatch Celebrate The Imitation Game
description: Keira Knightley had just arrived at Tavern on the Green to celebrate her new movie, The Imitation Game, but the hour was fast approaching.

title: Harvest and Thanksgiving Picture Books
description: New picture books include Salina Yoons Penguin and Pumpkin.

title: The Best Selling Sports Books
description: The best-selling sports books in October 2014, according to the New York Times best-seller list.

title: Federal Tax Liens Against Sharpton and Raw Talent
description: A list of federal tax liens against the Rev. Al Sharpton and one of his businesses, Raw Talent. Document types marked as Release of Federal Lien signify that the amount has been paid off by a prior lien.

title: Chained to the Verities of Hunger and Heartbreak
description: Ron Rash occupies an odd place in the pantheon of great American writers, and youd better believe he belongs there. He gets rapturous reviews that dont mean to condescend but almost always call him a Southern or Appalachian writer, and Mr. Rash has said he can hear the silent, dismissive just in those descriptions. He also baffles anyone who thinks that great talent ought to be accompanied by great ambition. Mr. Rash has planted himself at Western Carolina University and eluded the limelight that his work absolutely warrants.

title: ThyssenKrupp, an Old European Conglomerate, Tries to Learn a New Business Style
description: ESSEN, Germany  Heinrich Hiesinger was stunned by what he found in early 2011 when he became chief executive of ThyssenKrupp, one of Europes biggest and oldest industrial companies.

title: New York State Tax Warrants Against Sharpton and Revals
description: Open New York State Tax Warrants against the Rev. Al Sharpton and one of his businesses, Revals Communications Inc. A spokesman for the New York State Department of Taxation and Finance said the amount now due on each of the warrants has increased since they were filed, to a current total of $916,179.13, from an original total of $694,238.58.

title: Legendary Seducers, Meeting in the Twilight
description: According to Casanovas extravagant, improbable memoir, The Story of My Life, his earliest childhood memory involves being locked in a chest by a witch to treat childhood nosebleeds and hallucinating a bejeweled woman descending from the chimney. It should therefore surprise no one that Albert Serras Story of My Death, which stars Casanova, also co-stars Dracula  here, a sveltely pompadoured, pug-face figure in black who invites farm girls back to his castle with the far-out line We go way beyond.

title: Shopping With Lindsay Duncan, but Coming Home Empty-Handed
description: Just before a recent preview performance of the revival of Edward Albees 1966 play A Delicate Balance, there was a little flurry of excitement along the eighth row when Ralph Fiennes, the actor, slunk in next to his frequent companion, Amanda Harlech, the longtime muse of Karl Lagerfeld. As befits this station, Ms. Harlech was wearing a most extraordinary pair of trousers, which flared out at the hips like lamb chops.

title: The Leonora Opens in Chelsea
description: A semiprivate clubhouse for the creative set is the latest attempt to pump new life into the Chelsea bottle-service scene. The Leonora is hoping to cultivate an atmosphere of exclusivity to lure celebrities from their urban aeries for a paparazzi-free night on the town.

title: Travelogue Cocktails With Reality Chaser
description: Poor alcohol. It used to have very little competition for television time, since other mind-altering substances were illegal and thus rarely given starring roles. But lately an old newcomer, marijuana, has been generating the TV and Internet buzz, as it were, as relaxed laws have made pot eligible to be something other than the basis for stoner jokes.

title: Warren Pushes Democrats to the Left, but Not Too Hard
description: If ever there was a setting for Senator Elizabeth Warren to outline the contours of a presidential campaign, or push her party in a more liberal direction, it was Wednesday afternoon at a conference by the Center for American Progress.

title: Fall Fashion, Always in Sync
description: At a recent series of splashy events, Oscar winners, chart-toppers and ingnues demonstrated that classic black and white is back, as chic as ever. None followed a formula: Emma Watson looked divine in an off-the-shoulders top and tailored evening pants from Balenciaga; Marion Cotillard played with proportions in Dior; and Melissa George was daring in a white lace blouse that revealed her nude brassiere. If youre thinking about an investment in something special for holiday festivities, remember that black and white, endlessly versatile, is unlikely to let you down.

title: The Learning Curve Has Ups and Downs
description: Classicism evolves, Diaghilev said. But from what into what? You might well hope that Three Centuries of Russian Ballet  the name of the program presented on Tuesday night by the Mikhailovsky Ballet at the David H. Koch Theater  would show us how the grand sophistication of 19th-century ballet evolved by way of the modernist intensity of the 20th to the cultural complexity of the 21st. Or give us another arc of comparably historical seriousness. This triple bill, however, not only proved depressing and trivial, it also charted a process of flashy thrills and artistic deterioration.

title: Beer for Me, Apple Juice for Her
description: When Ashley Primis was preparing for her daughters first birthday party last year, she wanted it to be memorable. So Ms. Primis, 35, ordered a buffet of child-friendly foods; decorated the tables with toys, coloring books and bubbles; and bought a gigantic pink Geronimo balloon on Etsy.

title: Late Success for Latecomer to Late Night
description: Larry Wilmore is not about to be spoiled by sudden success.

title: Migrating Wildlife Depends on More Than Wilderness, Report Finds
description: New details of seasonal migrations in Wyoming show that deer, elk and other animals depend not only on wilderness areas but on private and multiuse government lands.

title: Social Media Bots Offer Phony Friends and Real Profit
description: I am the ruler of worlds. Let me rephrase that: I am the ruler of one very small world of social media bots.

title: A Tabloid Fake Sheikh, Bane of Crooks and Royalty, Finds Hes Now the Story
description: LONDON  Mazher Mahmood was 21 when he first posed as a wealthy sheikh. A reporter from Birmingham, England, intent on exposing a prostitution ring at a local hotel, he donned a white robe he had bought for 12 pounds at an Islamic bookshop, checked into the hotel, the Metropole, and persuaded the concierge to send women to his room.

title: A Deal From the District 3 Autumn Leaf Regional
description: The most successful player at the District 3 Autumn Leaf Regional in Danbury, Conn., last month was Alex Ornstein. He won 53.65 master points, 1.68 more than Sharon Goldman and Melih Ozdil (all of New York City).

title: Cosby Wont Respond to Allegations
description: During an interview on Nov. 6 with The Associated Press, Bill Cosby refused to respond to allegations of sexual assault after the reporter brought up recent reports.

title: Two of Golf Worlds Legends Trade Shots
description: NAPLES, Fla.  It figures. You go to a womens golf tournament and a mud wrestling match breaks out. Not here at Tiburon Golf Club, where the best players on the L.P.G.A. Tour will hit their opening shots Thursday and the last one standing Sunday in the season-long Race to CME Globe will walk away with a $1 million bonus.

title: The Lessons of a Rosetta Scientists Shirt
description: IF THERE IS any doubt that image is an equal opportunity issue  one that affects all of us, not just presidential candidates and red carpet celebrities  the Matt Taylor controversy, also known on Twitter as #shirtgate and #shirtflap (among other things), should put it to rest.

title: A Playoff, of Sorts, in Bachs Court
description: If Tuesdays Carnegie Hall concert had been a carnival, the barkers pitch would have written itself: Step right up and try to outplay the Magnificent Mutter!

title: Picking Your Cars Computerized Brain
description: EVEN with their high-tech gadgets and computerized machinery, most cars still do a pretty poor job of providing helpful information about things like mechanical problems and fuel use  and of connecting to the devices we use the most, our phones.

title: Shaving on the Edge (Both of Them)
description: After 13 years of creating products to combat razor burn, bumps on the neck and other shaving woes, the mens grooming company Jack Black decided it was time to attack the problem at the source. And so last year, the company, instead of embracing new technology, began selling a nearly 150-year-old invention: the safety razor.

title: On This Day: A New Birth of Freedom
description: If there were a Hall of Fame for presidential speeches, the one celebrating an anniversary today would be a first-ballot selection.

title: Society Dress Codes Require Decoding
description: It used to be so simple. Get an invitation to a nice dinner, and the dress code was crystal clear: black tie or cocktail attire.

title: Uprooted Syrian Youths Express Themselves
description: Brendan Bannon worked with refugee children in Jordan to help them use photography to document their environment and express themselves.

title: Discounts at Thomas Paul, Matter, Haand and Areaware
description: Thomas Pauls sample and warehouse sale takes place Friday through Sunday, with up to 80 percent off decorative pillows, bedding, bath items, kitchen textiles and gift items (22-inch square linen pillows, $110, will be $35); 9 North Moore Street (Varick Street).

title: Open With Care (for Nordic Design)
description: The success of Birchbox, the monthly beauty sample subscription box, has spawned many emulators. There are subscription boxes for nail polish, for organic snacks, for homemade food and handmade items. What there arent many of, Ana Denmark, 32, noticed, was a subscription box for housewares, particularly the clean and simple home goods from Scandinavia that she favors. After checking out dozens of boxes in the name of research, Ms. Denmark launched Skandicrush in August, sending out her first $50 package to subscribers in October. Currently running a one-woman, self-financed business, with inventory stored in her stepsons bedroom (hes at college), Ms. Denmark hopes to eventually expand the site into e-commerce, so you can get that butter dish after the box is gone. And she has ideas for some other boxes that dont involve moisturizers or mixed nuts. She spoke to a reporter from her house in San Francisco. (This interview has been condensed and edited.)

title: Bringing Sous Vide to the Home Cook
description: Appliance manufacturers have lately been building a surge of high-tech, high-end gadgets for our kitchens, but a lot of them are pretty useless. Who needs a refrigerator with a built-in tablet computer, or an oven that can be turned off from afar? My guess is youd be fine skipping many of these doodads.

title: The Connected Kitchen
description: If theres a cooking trend, chances are, theres a product for the home cook. The technology columnists Molly Wood and Farhad Manjoo review their favorite new kitchen gadgets.

title: Storybook Buildings, Authors Unknown
description: Hillsborough, N.C.  Few know exactly what to call the collection of Americana that fills Steven Burke and Randy Campbells Greek Revival compound.

title: For Teenagers, Early School Start Means More Car Crashes, Study Finds
description: Teenage drivers who sleep later have fewer car accidents, a new study suggests.

title: Obama Names Fatigue Specialist to Lead Traffic Safety Agency
description: In the face of a series of safety crises, President Obama moved Wednesday to fill a longstanding vacancy at the primary automotive safety agency.

title: Nutcrackers: Masters of the Hard Shell
description: As a child, Chris Cosentino loved using the simple wooden nutcrackers his grandfather made to separate nuts from their shells. And there were always plenty of bowls of nuts sitting around his grandparents homes.

title: The Calculus of Climbing at the Edge
description: YOSEMITE NATIONAL PARK, Calif.  SEVEN years ago, when I started free soloing long, hard routes in Yosemite  climbing without a rope, gear or a partner  I did it because it seemed like the purest, most elegant way to scale big walls. Climbing, especially soloing, felt like a grand adventure, but I never dreamed it could be a profession. However, over the years sponsors came to me one by one. I assumed that they wanted me to represent their companies because they supported what I was doing.

title: One of Our Closets Has a Mothball Smell. Should We Try to Fix It?
Inside Bunny Mellons World
description: Bunny wanted the space to present her own perfected self, Mac Griswold, the cultural landscape historian and writer, was saying on Monday evening. She had a highly developed sense of imperfect perfection.

title: Street Style in Hoboken, N.J.
description: Often considered an extension of New York City, Hoboken, N.J., is home to commuters and young families as well as college students. High-rise developments line the waterfront, while the citys storied institutions, like Carlos Bake Shop, remain intact. Caitilin Gallagher, born and raised in Hoboken, was walking along Washington Street to her parents house on a chilly fall afternoon recently. Her multicolored nearly floor-length cape stood out for its style and practicality. She kept the rest of her outfit comfy-casual but added a few polished accessories. This interview has been edited and condensed.

title: Perry and Walker Threaten to Sue Over Immigration Order
description: BOCA RATON, Fla.  Govs. Rick Perry of Texas and Scott Walker of Wisconsin said Wednesday that they were weighing lawsuits to block President Obama from taking executive action granting new legal protections to five million undocumented immigrants.

title: Home (Mostly) From Rome
description: In September 1994, Kevin Walz, a recent widower, packed up his two young daughters and left New York for Italy. Nineteen years later to the very day, he was in a plane over the Atlantic, moving back home.

title: Oud: Short Name, Big Effect
description: For those who love it, the intensely woody scent of oud incites a kind of delirium. And this fall, its fans are in luck: The heady, and usually pricey, fragrance happens to be the highlight of a handful of new products.

title: Meet Jaysea DeVoe, One of the Youngest Yoga Teachers in the United States
description: On a sunny Saturday morning on Catalina Island, a group of students planted their feet on the pebbled beach and unfurled their yoga mats. Jaysea DeVoe, their 80-pound instructor, stood before them, clad in black-and-white striped yoga pants, giggling like the eighth grader she is.

title: Blown Out of the Water
description: Davide Fuin, a master glassblower on the Venetian island Murano, was not amused to receive a box of plastic water bottles from Manuel Gorkiewicz. In fact, he was very grumpy about it, said Mr. Gorkiewicz, an artist in Vienna, who asked Mr. Fuin to create glass versions of the bottles, which had been trimmed to form a carafe, a beer glass, a wineglass and a schnapps glass. To convince him, I told him, It is like an ugly person that you will turn into a beautiful sculpture.  The collection, which will be sold starting on Friday at UrbanGlass in Brooklyn, evolved (Mr. Fuin might say, devolved) from Mr. Gorkiewiczs idea to update Adolf Looss Drinking set no. 248, crystal barware first produced in 1931 by Lobmeyr. I made an ironic comment on this by using trashy, not very ecological things, which are around us every day, he said. The carafe-and-five-glass set is $700. Information: urbanglass.org.

title: Now, a Place for All of Those Place Mats
description: Before Sandy Chilewich redefined the place mat, this workhorse of the tablescape was sometimes lacy, sometimes homely and almost always hard to clean. Chilewich, the company she founded in 2000, introduced sturdy mats woven of extruded strands of vinyl that are low-maintenance enough to be washed with a damp cloth and sophisticated enough to be sold by the Museum of Modern Art.

title: Rooms That Set the Scene
description: Lisa Borgnes Giramonti had families from books in mind when researching Novel Interiors: Living in Enchanted Rooms Inspired by Literature (due next month, $35). Scouting homes in Southern California, Manhattan and New Jersey, she found details evoking British moors and New England cottages.

title: At a Gay-Specific Bookstore, Just Books on a Shelf Wont Do
description: An independent bookstore opened last month with a performance by Gio Black Peter, a downtown artist. Wearing only black boxers, he stood on a translucent plastic tarp and read a poem entitled, The Morning Star, flanked by two beer-drinking men.

title: For Opening Ceremony and Intels MICA Smart Bracelet, Beauty Beats Brains
description: FOR A LITTLE LESS than a year, Opening Ceremony and Intel have been working together to create a bracelet that can check your email and remind you when you have a meeting. And what happens when fashion designers and techies work together?

title: Store Openings, Events and Sales in New York City
description: On Thursday, Valley Nails, the downtown salon that put nail art on the map, opens a second location in Chelsea. The cozy space, fitted with Kubikoff chairs and custom nail tables created by the owner Nina Werman and the architecture and design studio Aviva Novick, will provide services like classic nail art for all 10 fingers ($15 to 25) and accent nail art to be applied to two digits ($10 to 20), with basic manicures starting at $30. At 237 West 15th Street.

title: Is That Chervil Winking at Me?
description: A seed should be fecund, no apologies. Yet certain vegetables may advertise their potency a little too insistently. That is, anatomically. O.K., pornographically.

title: The Killings at a Jerusalem Synagogue
description: To the Editor:

title: A Partnership With CNBC Adds Context to Its News
description: Fans of CNBC will wake up on Thursday to see a new set of sophisticated analytics putting daily financial news into historical context. The analytics will tell viewers and visitors to the CNBC website, for example, how energy stocks have historically responded after a huge snowstorm, or how stocks of Apple suppliers have typically performed after an iPhone release.

title: Do School Behavior-Tracking Apps Help or Hurt?
description: To the Editor:

title: The Senates Vote on the Keystone Pipeline
description: To the Editor:

title: Nurses Urge Leniency Over Refusal to Force-Feed at Guantnamo Bay
description: The case of a Navy medical officer who refused to force-feed prisoners on a hunger strike at Guantnamo Bay prompted the countrys largest nursing organization on Wednesday to petition the Defense Department for leniency, citing professional ethical guidelines that support the officers decision.

title: My Leftist Dentist
description: To the Editor:

title: Indonesias View on Growth
description: To the Editor:

title: Republicans Fed Up With NBC Hosts Immigration Questions
description: BOCA RATON, Fla.  How much do Republicans dislike talking about immigration these days?

title: Cashing In on a Mortgage
Meeting U.S. Envoy, Putin Appears to Soften His Tone
description: MOSCOW  President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia said Wednesday that Moscow and Washington could find avenues of practical cooperation if the partnership were based on mutual respect and pragmatism.

title: NASA CO2 Animation Recalls 1859 Account of the Global Flow of this Gas
description: A new NASA visualization shows how heat-trapping carbon dioxide from human sources mixes and spreads around the planet, and in so doing recalls for me a stirring 1859 description of the atmosphere written by Matthew Fontaine Maury, widely considered Americas first oceanographer. I quoted him in my 1992 book on global warming, centering on this phrase: It is only he girdling encircling air, that flows above and around all, that makes the whole world kin. Heres the relevant excerpt:

title: Mail Monitoring Rarely Denied, Postal Service Says
description: WASHINGTON  The United States Postal Service granted almost all of the nearly 6,700 requests from law enforcement agencies last year to monitor the mail of Americans for use in criminal and national security investigations, Postal Service officials told a House panel on Wednesday.

title: Harvard Students Move Fossil Fuel Stock Fight to Court
description: A group of Harvard students, frustrated by the universitys refusal to shed fossil fuel stocks from its investment portfolios, is looking beyond protests and resolutions to a new form of pressure: the courts.

title: Colombia: Agreement Is Reached to Release General Held by Rebels
description: The countrys largest rebel group has agreed to free an army general and four other captives, officials said Wednesday. The generals capture on Sunday led President Juan Manuel Santos to suspend peace talks with the rebel group, the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia, or FARC. The deal to free the general, Rubn Daro Alzate, was announced in Havana by representatives of the governments of Cuba and Norway, facilitators of the peace talks, held in Havana for the past two years. The announcement said that the Colombian government and the FARC had agreed on the conditions necessary for the captives release and that they would be freed as soon as possible. The general will be released along with an army corporal and a military lawyer who were captured with him. Two other soldiers taken captive in a separate episode this month are also to be released, the officials said.

title: For Goldman, Government Gift From 2008 Crisis Keeps Giving
description: During the financial crisis in 2008, the government made a supremely generous move that most likely saved Goldman Sachs from collapse.

title: Dressing Like My Mother
description: My mother used to dress up for airports and emergency rooms. When I was 3 and cracked my forehead open on a doorjamb, she had me change  I believe into a smocked white dress, an interesting choice for a child with a head wound  before we drove to the emergency room at NewYork-Presbyterian.

title: Protesters Return to Cairos Streets to Mark an Anniversary
description: At least 48 protesters were arrested in downtown Cairo on Wednesday as small groups of activists marched and chanted slogans in memory of colleagues killed in clashes with the police three years ago.

title: A Pitch to Persuade Smartphone Snappers to Step Up to Nikons
description: WHEN Paul Simon sang, I got a Nikon camera, I love to take a photograph so, Mama, dont take my Kodachrome away, the idea of Kodachrome film disappearing was unexpected enough to make for a memorable lyric. All these years later, Kodachrome has indeed gone away, a fate that Nikon is fervently hoping to avoid.

title: Ubers Privacy Practices Questioned by Senator Franken
description: The relationship between the media and Uber has been strained as of late. It is not going so well on Capitol Hill, either.

title: Thursdays Matchup: Chiefs (7-3) at Raiders (0-10)
description: 8:25 p.m. Eastern, NFL Network

title: The Solid South Will Rise Again
description: Democrats have abandoned Senator Mary Landrieu of Louisiana, who is in a tough runoff election. (Tough is the mild way of putting it. Polls show her down by double digits to her Republican opponent.)

title: Do Politicians Love Kids?
description: We Americans love children.

title: Immigration Has Republican Governors Seething and Facing Practical Challenges
description: BOCA RATON, Fla.  President Obamas impending executive action on immigration is unleashing the fury of Republican governors who now control a clear majority of the nations statehouses  and not entirely for the reasons that partisans might expect.

title: Chinese Interests Look to Malaysia for Cheap Iron Ore, and Profits
description: BUKIT BESI, Malaysia  Giant mining equipment has stripped away the palm trees and other vegetation from a jungle bluff here with a Malay name that translates to Iron Hill. Huge power shovels gouge long furrows down cliffs of fuchsia clay, scooping out the shiny black iron ore at their base.

title: Firefox Makes Yahoo Its New Default for Search, Replacing Google
description: After a lucrative 10-year relationship, Mozilla is breaking up with Google and switching to Yahoo as the default search provider for its popular Firefox web browser.

title: Times Squares Costumed Characters Resist Push to Rein Them In
description: Hello Kitty, the Big Apple, the Penguin, the Joker and several other heroes, villains and pop culture icons appeared before the New York City Council on Wednesday to testify against a proposed bill that would regulate the ubiquitous and, occasionally, aggressive presence of costumed characters in Times Square.

title: Missouri Attorney General Puts Limit on Contributions
description: Attorney General Chris Koster of Missouri, a Democrat whose plans to run for governor in 2016 have been hurt by reports that his office may have given preferential treatment to campaign contributors and lobbyists, announced a new policy Wednesday banning donations from any company that he had targeted for investigation.

title: More Than a Battle, Kobani Is a Publicity War
description: SURUC, Turkey  Two months after the United States began bombing militants attacking Kobani in northern Syria, the fate of the obscure border town has become the defining battle of the broader contest with the Islamic State  to solidify, or roll back, its borders and ambitions.

title: Chrysler Unveils a More-or-Less New 300
description: LOS ANGELES  The 2015 version of Chryslers 300 sedan is just new enough to be noteworthy. The 300, the brands flagship, was unveiled Wednesday at the Los Angeles Auto Show with a new front-end treatment, new electronic technology and new trim lines named after hip-sounding American cities. Hip-sounding, at least, to Chryslers marketers.

title: Pakistani, Held in Iraq, Wins a Round in Court
description: LONDON  A British court ruled Wednesday that a Pakistani man who was detained by British troops in Iraq on suspicion of links to terrorism but never charged could sue the British government over how he was treated.

title: New Management Layer Suggested for Port Authority
description: In the 14 months since the unannounced closing of lanes of traffic to the George Washington Bridge, the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey has faced truckloads of criticism. But few, if any, of those critics have suggested that the problem was not enough layers of management.

title: Three Bills to Curb Corporate Wrongdoing
description: When it was learned this year that General Motors had long failed to notify regulators and the public about fatal ignition-switch defects, the outrage in Congress was bipartisan. Recent reports in The New York Times that the Japanese manufacturer Takata hid deadly airbag defects are also sure to inspire rebukes from members of both parties. Takata has rebutted the reports, but lawmakers have appropriately scheduled a hearing for Thursday and called for a criminal inquiry by the Justice Department.

title: Ukraines Slow Collapse
description: The crisis in Ukraine has reached an impasse. The cease-fire signed in Minsk, Belarus, in September never really took hold, but at least it provided a cover for efforts to reduce the level of fighting and focus on stabilizing and reforming the Ukrainian economy as a prelude to a serious, long-term search for a resolution of the crisis. Now even the fig leaf of cease-fire is gone. Russian armored vehicles are rolling into eastern Ukraine  disowned, of course, by Moscow.

title: Jordans Open Door Is Now Only Cracked, Leaving Syrians Stranded
description: AMMAN, Jordan  Thousands of Syrians, mostly women and children, have been stranded for weeks on Jordans border, according to international aid agencies who say Jordan appears to be increasingly turning away Syrians fleeing war at home.

title: Unicef Plans a Global Singalong of John Lennons Imagine
description: Have you always thought you had the perfect harmony vocal line for John Lennons Imagine  or just thought the recording would have been a bit more interesting if you were singing along? The United Nations is offering you that chance.

title: New Whitney Museum Building to Open in May
description: The Whitney Museum of American Arts new Renzo Piano-designed building in Manhattans meatpacking district is to open on May 1.

title: N.S.A. Phone Data Collection Could Go On, Even if a Law Expires
description: WASHINGTON  A little-known provision of the Patriot Act, overlooked by lawmakers and administration officials alike, appears to give President Obama a possible way to keep the National Security Agencys bulk phone records program going indefinitely  even if Congress allows the law on which it is based to expire next year.

title: Analyst Sues New York City Council Over Firing
description: A former policy analyst for the New York City Council filed a federal lawsuit on Wednesday claiming he was fired in September for publicly voicing his criticism over testimony given by William J. Bratton, the police commissioner, at a public hearing.

title: At Long Last, Immigration Action
description: President Obama says he will speak to the nation on Thursday night about making major changes to immigration policy, including shielding several million unauthorized immigrants from deportation. He intends to do this under executive authority, because he has given up waiting for Congress to act.

title: New Scrutiny of Goldmans Ties to the New York Fed After a Leak
description: From his desk in Lower Manhattan, a banker at Goldman Sachs thumbed through confidential documents  courtesy of a source inside the United States government.

title: Your School Lost Every Game? Hey, Better Luck in the Postseason
description: LOGANSPORT, La.  The Louisiana high school football playoffs opened last Friday, but it hardly felt encouraging as the East Iberville Tigers boarded a bus for a five-hour ride north toward certain defeat. The team was 0-10 for a second consecutive season, so overmatched that four players decided not to make the trip.

title: Ebola Response in Liberia Is Hampered by Infighting
description: The global response to the Ebola virus in Liberia is being hampered by poor coordination and serious disagreements between Liberian officials and the donors and health agencies fighting the epidemic, according to minutes of top-level meetings and interviews with participants.

title: Takatas Switch to Cheaper Airbag Propellant Is at Center of Crisis
description: The new airbag propellant was supposed to be the next big thing for Takata in 1998. An engineer for the company, Paresh Khandhadia, declared it the new technological edge in an interview with a trade magazine then.

title: Reaction to Uber Tactics Highlights Tech Journalists Fine Line Between Critic and Booster
description: Monday night, BuzzFeed reported that an Uber executive had considered investigating the private life of the tech journalist Sarah Lacy because of her negative coverage of the company. Ms. Lacy responded almost instantaneously  and she was not happy.

title: University of California Is Set to Raise Tuition
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Over the protests of hundreds of angry and chanting students, a panel of the University of California Board of Regents gave preliminary approval Wednesday to a plan to raise tuition 27.6 percent over five years, turning aside a last-ditch effort by Gov. Jerry Brown to block it.

title: Ebolas Economic Cost Re-Examined
description: Ebolas economic cost to sub-Saharan Africa may only be a fraction of the worst-case forecast made last month because of progress since then in halting the spread of the disease, a World Bank official said Wednesday, but he warned against relaxation in the containment effort.

title: Criminal Complaint Against Kevin Darden
description: Mr. Darden was arraigned on charges he killed a man by shoving him in front of a subway train in the Bronx.

title: Tough Times for Penguins
description: Scientists say that fur seals in the Antarctic are having sex with the penguins.

title: Suspect in Fatal Bronx Subway Push Has a History of Legal Trouble
description: For most of his adult life, wherever Kevin Darden went, he found trouble with the law. There were arrests on minor charges, like theft and marijuana possession, and on bigger ones  choking a girlfriend; punching a 73-year-old stranger; and menacing Midtown Manhattan pedestrians with a metal broomstick.

title: A Hammer Comes Down in Colombia on an Honor for Britain
description: CARTAGENA, Colombia  The strange events that unfolded here in recent days involved, in one way or another, Prince Charles of England; George Washingtons older brother Lawrence; the British admiral after whom Mount Vernon was named; a one-eyed, one-legged Spanish seaman who has been dead for 273 years; and an angry animal rights activist with a hammer.

title: Cuomo Discusses Response to Snowstorm
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said that equipment from all over New York and neighboring states would be taken to Buffalo and western New York to deal with the powerful storm.

title: As Ferguson Grand Jury Report Looms, Police Say They Dont Fear Protests
description: As a grand jury in St. Louis nears a decision on whether to indict a white police officer in the fatal shooting of a black teenager, activists are planning scores of protests across the nation, leading the F.B.I. to warn of potential violence and some cities to take the threat seriously.

title: Hometown Boy, Recycled
description: Having your own personal Greek chorus has never sounded all that appealing. Who wants to be surrounded by a lot of second-guessing Everypeople, the way poor Oedipus and Electra were, while having to listen to observations like: Boy, that was a stupid move, you shortsighted fool. Youre doomed, doomed!?

title: Having a Sense of Pride
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  Today we learn that our constructor, Timothy Polin, may have a secret identity. Once you finish the puzzle and read the notepad, which says, After completing this puzzle, connect nine appropriate letters in order to discover an image associated with 44 Down, you will find out who he really is.

title: Bills Get Snow Day and Logistics Headache
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Allen Iverson, the former point guard of the Philadelphia 76ers, questioned the value of practice in a 2002 rant that became as memorable as anything he did on the court. The Buffalo Bills can only hope he is correct.

title: A Social Climber in Pursuit of Love, Literature and Other Things
description: Edmund Wilson, what a sweetheart! Seems that before he became a pre-eminent literary critic, he was a really swell guy, a hell of a pal.

title: Passing Rate Declines by 20% as State Uses New Certification Exams for Teachers
description: New York State saw a significant drop in the number of candidates who passed teacher certification tests last year as tougher exams were introduced, state officials said on Wednesday, portraying the results as a long-needed move to raise the level of teaching and the performance of teacher preparation schools.

title: Willy Burgdorfer, Who Found Bacteria That Cause Lyme Disease, Is Dead at 89
description: Willy Burgdorfer, a medical entomologist who in 1982 identified the cause of what had been a mysterious affliction, Lyme disease, died on Monday at a hospital in Hamilton, Mont. He was 89.

title: Massachusetts Town Votes to End Bid for Tobacco Ban
description: In the face of a revolt by townspeople, the Board of Health in Westminster, Mass., voted Wednesday to drop a proposal to ban the sale of all tobacco and nicotine products.

title: Jimmy Ruffin, Singer of a Memorable Motown Hit, Dies at 78
description: Jimmy Ruffin, a soul singer best known for his plaintive 1966 Top 10 hit What Becomes of the Brokenhearted, died on Monday in a Las Vegas hospital. He was 78.

title: Indiana: Rites Set for American Killed by Islamic State
description: A funeral service for a former Army Ranger who was beheaded last weekend by Islamic State extremists will be held Friday at an Islamic center in Fishers, Ind. The center, the Al Huda Foundation, said in a statement that it was honored to host this service in memory of Peter Kassig, an aid worker who disappeared in Syria while delivering medical supplies. Mr. Kassig, the third American killed by the Islamic State, adopted the Muslim name Abdul-Rahman after spending more than a year in captivity. Over the summer, Mr. Kassig was able to smuggle a letter to his family in which he detailed fears for his life. Just know Im with you. Every stream, every lake, every field and river, Mr. Kassig wrote. In the woods and in the hills, in all the places you showed me. I love you.

title: The Secret Life of Passwords
description: We despise them  yet we imbue them with our hopes and dreams, our dearest memories, our deepest meanings. They unlock much more than our accounts.

title: North Korea: Plutonium Extraction May Be Restarting, Institute Says
description: An American research institute reported Wednesday that North Korea might be preparing to reprocess spent nuclear fuel to extract weapons-grade plutonium at its main nuclear complex north of its capital, Pyongyang. The organization, the U.S.-Korea Institute at Johns Hopkins University, reported on the website 38 North that recent commercial satellite imagery of the Norths Yongbyon Nuclear Scientific Research Center showed evidence of a lengthy reactor shutdown. It suggested fuel rods might have been removed from the reactor in preparation for extracting plutonium from the spent rods. Also on Thursday, North Korea warnedthat the recent vote at the United Nations to refer the Norths leaders to the International Criminal Court for prosecution for crimes against humanity left the country no option but to consider another nuclear test..

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Nov. 19, 2014
U.N. Security Council Calls to Block Recruiting of Militants
description: The United Nations Security Council unanimously adopted a statement on Wednesday asking all countries to thwart foreign-born militants who have sought to join the Islamic State, the Nusra Front and other extremist groups whose violent campaigns have convulsed the Middle East. The Security Council statement, which reflected the recommendations of a United Nations panel made public on Monday, said all countries should take steps to block the sale of smuggled oil and antiquities that the Islamic State uses to help finance itself.

title: Knicks Fall Once More As Defense Is Listless
description: MINNEAPOLIS  The hunt for encouraging moments during another dreary Knicks loss  their ninth in 10 games  began and ended with Carmelo Anthony.

title: The Secret Life of Passwords
description: Howard Lutnick, the chief executive of Cantor Fitzgerald, one of the worlds largest financial-services firms, still cries when he talks about it. Not long after the planes struck the twin towers, killing 658 of his co-workers and friends, including his brother, one of the first things on Lutnicks mind was passwords. This may seem callous, but it was not.

title: New York City Council Hearing on Fee for Bags Becomes Heated
description: For years, the plastic bag has doubled as a sort of urban tumbleweed, sweeping across New York City sidewalks and encroaching ominously on its waterways, clustering on subway tracks and drifting airborne to the tree limbs of residential blocks.

title: R.A. Montgomery, 78, Dies; Published Choose Your Own Adventure Series
description: You are a young publisher searching for the next trend in childrens fiction in 1975 when a first-time author submits a peculiar manuscript that lets readers decide the protagonists fate. Do you publish the book or send the author packing?

title: As Nets Take On Bucks, the Boos, and the Win, Go to Jason Kidd
description: The sounds coming from the stands at Barclays Center shifted wildly over the course ofWednesdaynight, from hissing jeers to raucous roars to stunned quiet.

title: A Lesson in the Cost of Resilience From a Mother Securing Her Familys Future
description: Protecting her family has come with costs that Yolanda Peguero is willing to pay. They are part of parenthood. Getting her children to understand them, however, has proved more challenging.

title: Sharing Password Stories
description: People explain the origins of their most personal keepsake passwords.

title: The Secret Life of Passwords
description: For some people, passwords protect dreams, secrets, even fears, and serve as a daily reminder of what matters most.

title: Lost Numbers
description: Howard Lutnick had to rebuild Cantor Fitzgerald after losing nearly 700 people on Sept. 11, 2001, beginning with a search for the passwords only they knew.

title: Google Play Store Opens to Chinese Developers
description: One of Silicon Valleys favorite parlor games is to guess when Google will push to do more business in mainland China, a market it mostly left in 2010 over concerns about censorship.

title: John T. Downey Dies at 84; Held Captive in China for 20 Years
description: John T. Downey, a former C.I.A. agent who became the longest-serving American prisoner of war by surviving more than 20 years in Chinese prisons after he was shot down over Manchuria in 1952, died on Monday at a hospice in Branford, Conn. He was 84.

title: National Book Award Goes to Phil Klay for His Short Story Collection
description: Phil Klay won the National Book Award for fiction on Wednesday night for his debut short story collection, Redeployment, which draws on his experience serving as a Marine in Iraq and captures the terror, boredom and occasionally the humorous side of war.

title: Facebook Shuttle Bus Drivers Vote to Unionize
description: In a rare win for labor in Silicon Valley, the shuttle bus drivers who ferry Facebook employees to and from work voted on Wednesday to unionize, 43 to 28.

title: The Elder Statesman Opens Its First Retail Outpost in L.A.
description: Greg Chait founded his playful luxury knitwear line the Elder Statesman on the principle that classic craftsmanship and the finest materials dont have to feel stuffy. The same is true of the brands first store in its hometown of Los Angeles, which opens this weekend in a converted West Hollywood bungalow just off Melrose Avenue. The good news about the space is that it isnt locked, Chait says of the open floor plan. I left it with a living, breathing vibe, one that would represent the creative freedom instilled in the goods we make. The 1,600-square-foot structure is housed next to an outdoor courtyard of equal size, while the interior, created in collaboration with the influential design firm Commune, features skylights and succulents as well as more personal details like Chaits grandmothers artwork and a carefully chosen assortment of found objects. Its really all about less details, Chait says, but ones that are strong and honest.

title: Finlands Foremost Fashion Line Introduces Housewares
description: For Samu-Jussi Koski, the founder and head designer of the emerging Helsinki-based fashion brand Samuji  whose richly textured, well-tailored mens and womens pieces are carried by such influential boutiques as Maryam Nassir Zadeh and Mohawk General Store  launching a home line has been on the to-do list since day one. I wanted a complete world, not only a fashion label, but something deeper, says Koski, who previously served as the creative director at Marimekko. We started with womens clothes a year ago, we introduced mens and now, theres Koti, the Finnish word for home.

title: Times Square Seen Through Fresh Eyes
description: In this weekly series, Ts photo editors share the most compelling visual projects theyve discovered.

title: Minivans Fare Poorly in Tests Mimicking a Collision
description: The Insurance Institute for Highway Safety said on Thursday that three minivans had failed its small overlap front crash test, with one van experiencing the deepest intrusion into the passenger compartment of any vehicle ever evaluated in the test.

title: Word of the Day | impenitent
description: impenitent \im-pe-nn-tnt\ adjective

title: Undermanned and 0-10: Welcome to the Playoffs
description: The East Iberville High School football team, like other teams across the United States, reached the playoffs despite having a losing record.

title: General Motors Is Sued by Arizona for $3 Billion Over Recalls
description: The attorney general of Arizona said on Wednesday that the state had filed suit against General Motors, claiming that the automaker had defrauded the states consumers of an estimated $3 billion.

title: Knicks New D-League Team Mirrors the Parent Club, Right Down to the Losses
description: WHITE PLAINS  As soon as he was named the coach of the Knicks new Development League affiliate in early October, Kevin Whitted attached himself to everything the big club was doing: shadowing practices, coaches meetings and film sessions, soaking up all he could.

title: Giants Eli Manning Defends His Play and Deflects Criticism of Tom Coughlin
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Eli Manning had one of the worst games of his N.F.L. career on Sunday, throwing five interceptions as the Giants lost to the San Francisco 49ers. But the performance has not shaken Mannings confidence or his desire to remain a Giant for the rest of his career.

title: With Cam Talbot in Net, Rangers Continue Mastery of Flyers at the Garden
description: The Rangers would be thrilled to see the Philadelphia Flyers visit as often as possible.

title: Kevin Long, Mets Hitting Coach, Also Works From the Mound
description: Kevin Long is left-handed.

title: Fantasy Football: Week 12 Matchup Breakdown
description: The Colts defense has somehow managed to allow the most fantasy points in a single game this season to a quarterback (Ben Roethlisbergers 56 in Week 8) and, after Patriots running back Jonas Grays 44-point performance last weekend, a running back. Is it Jaguars receiver Cecil Shortss turn this weekend?

title: Whats on TV Thursday
description: 10 P.M. (Starz Cinema) THE PATIENCE STONE (2013) A beautiful young Afghan woman (Golshifteh Farahani) confesses her fears, resentments and dreams to her much older husband (Hamidrez Javdan, above, with Ms. Farahani), a comatose guerrilla fighter with a bullet in his neck  things she might never say if he were awake  in this drama directed by Atiq Rahimi, adapted from his 2008 novel. The films outline mirrors an Afghan myth, The 70-Year-Old Corpse, which Richard M. Dorson, the editor of the book Folktales Told Around the World, said had been told by women as a healthy expression of their stifled feelings in a male-dominated world, Manohla Dargis wrote in The New York Times. That pretty much distills the fictionalized world represented in The Patience Stone, although Mr. Rahimi takes a rather more poetic approach to the same subject, using universals (Man and Woman) as proxies in a battle that, as the story progresses, takes on an abstract quality. Yet while there may be truths in some universals, its hard to forget that this tale has its roots in a bitterly real world.

title: North Korea Threatens to Conduct Nuclear Test
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea said on Thursday that the country had no option but to consider another nuclear test after the recent political provocation by the United Nations to try to indict the Norths leaders for crimes against humanity.

title: Gunman at Florida State Spoke of Being Watched
description: The gunman who shot three people at a library on Florida State Universitys main campus in Tallahassee early Thursday was an alumnus who said the government was watching him, and he detailed his fears in a written journal and videos, the authorities said.

title: Corrections: November 20, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Its getting so hard to call my mom. Ive had to tell her, There is a victory coming, and I dont know if youre part of it.'

title: Deadly School Van Crash Revives Concerns Over Safety Standards
description: A school van crash in the eastern Chinese province of Shandong has reignited longstanding fears about the safety of the countrys children as they travel to school each day.

title: ThyssenKrupp Posts First Annual Profit in 3 Years
description: ThyssenKrupp, the German steel maker and industrial conglomerate, reported its first annual net profit in three years on Thursday. And in an apparent sign of confidence, the company proposed paying a small dividend of 11 cents a share for the first time in three years.

title: Test Yourself | No More Ms. Nice Gal
description: Below are the first eight paragraphs of the Oct. 29 article No More Ms. Nice Gal.

title: Handed-Down Sounds
description: After months of repair work, the classical music station WQXR began giving out instruments received during a donation drive to some passionate young musicians.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Extreme Snowstorm Pummels Western New York
description: In Extreme Snowstorm Pummels Western New York, Sara Dinatale, Lauren DAvolio and Marc Santora write about the weather emergency facing the Buffalo area.

title: China Detains an American Who Assists North Koreans
description: BEIJING  A Korean-American aid worker who lived in China on the border with North Korea for more than a decade has been detained by the Chinese authorities, his lawyer said Thursday.

title: Chris Christie Is Back
description: If I fix this, you have to start the story with it, Chris Christie told me, yanking the string of the venetian blind in the diner window. We were eating a late lunch at a place called Howleys, next to a motor lodge on South Dixie Highway, in West Palm Beach. It was the last Sunday in October, nine days before the midterm elections, and the 4 p.m. twilight was beaming directly into the eyes of the governor of New Jersey. Christies communications director, Maria Comella, had already tried and failed to lower the blinds, inadvertently bunching them up even more. I had given it a shot, too. Finally, Christie rose and maneuvered himself across the booth to make his own attempt. Walking with a slight limp, which he occasionally does after sitting for a while, Christie grabbed the strings, one in each hand, tugged a few times and grunted. Then, after a final jerk, the blinds fell splendidly into place.

title: Uprooted Syrian Youths Express Themselves
description: In 2003, Brendan Bannon was teaching photography to H.I.V.-infected Romanian children in a workshop titled The Most Important Picture. One girl, Carla, moved him deeply when she explained why she chose a self-portrait as the most important picture she had taken: When she was gone, others could look at it and remember her.

title: Drive Brings Thousands of Instruments for Aspiring Musicians in Public Schools

Yet India persists in a cruel strategy of bringing down birthrates through mass female sterilization. In poorer states with high birthrates, health workers are driven by threats and induced by incentives to cut any corners necessary to meet government targets.

title: Morning Agenda: Goldmans Ties to New York Fed Under Fire

A Goldman Sachs banker received confidential information from a former colleague who was still working at the New York Fed, providing Goldman a window into the New York Feds private insights, including details about at least one of Goldmans clients, lawyers briefed on the matter said. The incident illustrates the blurred lines between Wall Street and the government and the potential conflicts of interest that can result.

title: Up From Rubble to Lead a Revolution
description: Theres a clever bit in the latest Hunger Games in which Katniss Everdeen, the boundary-smashing butch goddess of dystopian cinema, acts in a propaganda video. The idea is for Katniss, whos both the spark of a revolution and its flinty strength, to rouse the masses with a heroic scene. Slicked up in lipstick and a Joan of Arc breastplate, she delivers her lines  with energy, the video director hopefully instructs her  but the scene needs tweaks. Eventually, they get it right, and the video ends with a call to join the fight, an exhortation thats clearly addressed to more than one audience. Its a funny, self-aware moment, given how extreme the stakes have become in this fascinating and strange pop epic.

title: That Medical Test Costs $50, or Is It $500?
description: When I was growing up in Lexington, Ky., in the late 1970s, we used to go to an all-you-can-eat buffet called Duffs. It was the cheapest restaurant in town. My father and mother ate for $2 apiece, my brother and I were charged $1, and my little sister, who was 3, ate free. After my father paid the cashier, wed sprint over to the smorgasbord and fill our plates. Wed fill them again and again. If the fried chicken got cold, my father would tell us to throw it out and get more. We gorged; we took advantage; we were wasteful  because we perceived it as free. Wed eat so much that one of us would invariably get sick on the way home.

The New York Herald, European Edition, Nov. 21, 1939

title: Vegetarian Thanksgiving: Food Allergies and Autumn Quinoa
description: On a Friday night a little more than a year ago, my hands blanched to white and began to shake as intense nausea hit me over dinner at a favorite neighborhood restaurant. My gums and tongue tingling, I nearly yelled to my boyfriend as we walked out, I think we need to go to the emergency room. Now. I didnt know it at the time, but I had developed life-threatening food allergies that would change the way I eat and the way I live.

title: Burning the Franchise At Both Ends

description: The Obama administration seems to be trying to dispatch all its immigration business in a single day.

title: A Mother and Daughter, Reunited After Foster Care, and Talking

These constant portrayals of child deaths leave most Americans under the impression that parents who have had their children removed committed horrific abuse  and deserve no compassion.

description: TEHRAN  Far from the flashing cameras and microphones in Vienna, where Secretary of State John Kerry is joining Iranian and United States diplomats in a final push to reach a compromise on Tehrans nuclear program, a different sort of political drama unfolded in the Iranian capital this week: Hard-liners got together to criticize the objects of their worries, as they put it, the moderates advocating a deal.

title: Living an Upright Life, as a Nun and a Coach
description: DULUTH, Minn.  The celebration after the College of St. Scholastica won its fourth consecutive conference football championship resembled an extended family gathering this month. Oblivious to the numbing cold, players, coaches, family members and students lingered on the field, exchanging hugs and posing with the Upper Midwest Athletic Conference championship banner.

title: Take My Wife. Sil Vous Plat.
description: Hortense Fiquet Czanne is one of the great mystery women in art. She sat for 29 paintings by her husband and smiles in none of them. More often than not, she is portrayed indoors, a matronly woman with her hair primly parted in the middle and her dress buttoned up almost to her chin. Yet there is something appealing about her plainness. She is nothing like her contemporaries in Impressionist pictures, who pass their days at boating parties and picnics, their long dresses billowing in the breeze, sunlight warming their skin. Madame Czanne, by contrast, looks as if she does not get out of the house much and could use a break.

title: Mazda Enters the Small Crossover Market With the CX-3
description: LOS ANGELES  Automakers claim to have discovered a new segment of vehicle: the small, city-friendly crossover.
