Hes also obsessed with the Albanian legend of Konstandin and Doruntine, which goes like this: When his sister Doruntine marries and moves far away, Konstandin promises his mother he will ride to fetch her for weddings and funerals; when he and all his brothers are killed, his ghost does the job, delivers his sister to the church and leaves her at the gate, saying, You go on, I have something to do here. This story would be the basis for Kadares novel The Ghost Rider, and by the end of Twilight of the Eastern Gods the narrator has become a sort of Konstandin figure himself. The Albanian dictator Enver Hoxhas schism from the U.S.S.R. is occurring, and the narrator knows his days in Moscow are numbered. Hes become a ghost in the city, and its become ghostly to him. Once upon a time there used to be a giant state whose name was Soviet Union, he thinks.

title: Short Stories
description: WHEN MYSTICAL CREATURES ATTACK!

title: Nothing but the Clouds Unchanged: Artists in World War I
description: World War I was the first modern war, with the major combatants Britain, France, Russia and the United States facing off against Germany and Austria-Hungary. But it had a less than straightforward relationship to modern art. It interrupted the intellectual work of Cubism, but answered Futurisms calls for speed and violence. In unleashing horrifying devastation and disfigurement, it may also have incubated Dada and Surrealism.

title: Ponytails and Pompoms
description: For the throngs of high-school cheerleaders and marching-band musicians in New York City to perform at the Macys Thanksgiving Day Parade, a poem from a reader.

title: E.P.A. Ozone Rules Divide Industry and Environmentalists
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration on Wednesday announced a long-delayed environmental regulation to curb emissions of ozone, a smog-causing pollutant linked to asthma, heart disease and premature death.

title: 36 Hours in Santa Fe
description: No matter what the season, food, culture and nature buffs will find ample reason to linger in and around Santa Fe.

title: 36 Hours in Santa Fe
description: In summer, Santa Fe bursts at the seams with arts fairs, opera and other flashy events. In winter, though, the schedule is less hectic, and the few tourists spend their days skiing outside town. This is when residents effectively reclaim the center, the walkable area from the old plaza to the newer Railyard district. The only glitz and glitter is the snow sparkling under a sunny blue sky and paper-bag lanterns glowing in the black night. In recent years, many of the citys most loved institutions have expanded, been renovated or have even returned from the dead  and theres no better time to enjoy them than the colder months, alongside Santa Feans who have been appreciating them for decades.

title: 1964: Liner Slices Ship in Two
description: NEW YORK  The 25,338-ton liner Shalom, pride of the Israeli merchant fleet, sliced a Norwegian tanker in two early today in heavy fog off the New Jersey coast. Nineteen of the tankers crew of 43 were killed, the Coast Guard said. No one was hurt on board the Shalom, which was en route to the Caribbean for a cruise. Most of the dead crewmen were in the stem section of the 12,723-ton tanker, Stolt Dagali, which sank almost immediately after the collision. Others were flung into the water, where they were picked up by helicopters and lifeboats.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Nov. 27, 1964

title: Whos Winning? The Nights Quickest Wit
description: Beware professional athletes in suits telling jokes. They are rarely funny.

title: Asking for a Raise, After 10 Years
description: Recently, your Workologist made a return visit to a Minnesota Public Radio program, The Daily Circuit, and again had the pleasure (and challenge) of entertaining questions about workplace quandaries in real time.

title: Changed Life for Brooklyn Boy Hit by Crossfire
description: Shifting slightly in a doctors office chair one day this month, Gama Droiville, 13, put on his new glasses.

title: Coco Young, Muse to Artists and Designers, Steps Behind the Camera
description: Coco Young appreciates physical beauty, just like the photographers and artists  John Currin, Ryan McGinley, Richard Kern  who celebrate her as their muse. Now, in Vanity, her debut photography monograph (30, out Monday from Bemojake), she shoots lovingly close images of skin, from color-saturated body scans to portraits of insouciantly nude subjects.

title: Resignation of Top U.N. Relief Official Sets Up Clash
description: Valerie Amos, the top relief official at the United Nations, is resigning, Secretary General Ban Ki-moon said Wednesday, paving the way for a potential political showdown over her successor.

title: Peter Boal to Perform in New York City Ballets Nutcracker
description: Those balletomanes who have never quite recovered from Peter Boals retirement, 10 years ago, as a principal dancer at New York City Ballet, can throw off the mourning garb. Mr. Boal, who left to become the artistic director of Pacific Northwest Ballet, will be back at City Ballet  for just one performance  as Herr Drosselmeier in George Balanchines The Nutcracker at the matinee of Dec. 13. (The season begins on Friday and runs through Jan. 3.)

title: Helene Cooper on Chuck Hagels Resignation
description: Helene Cooper, Pentagon correspondent for The Times, joined MSNBCs Morning Joe to discuss Defense Secretary Chuck Hagels resignation.

title: Newly Released Books
description: THERE MUST BE SOME MISTAKE

title: G.M.'s Futurliner to Take Its Place Among Historically Important Vehicles
description: WASHINGTON  One of the 12 buslike Art Deco Futurliner vehicles General Motors built for its Parade of Progress in the late-'30s has been scheduled for inclusion on the National Historic Vehicle Register, the Historic Vehicle Association said in an interview. Futurliner No. 10 is now here in advance of its scheduled display appearance at the Washington auto show in January.

title: Realm at Stake, Playoff Masters Prepare to Collide
description: SANTA CLARA, Calif.  After the San Francisco 49ers won another close game on Sunday afternoon, Coach Jim Harbaugh watched that nights nationally televised N.F.L. game with his family. During one network promotion for San Franciscos game on Thanksgiving against the N.F.C. West rival Seattle Seahawks, NBC showed a gang of live turkeys. Harbaughs three youngest children were excited.

title: Now, Anyone Can Buy a Drone. Heaven Help Us.
description: Amateur photographers and Hollywood filmmakers turn to them for lush overhead shots. Geologists use them to look above the seas for oil-bearing rocks. Amazon executives are pushing to use them to plop packages onto doorsteps.

title: In First Week, More Than a Million Apply for Health Insurance on Federal Website
description: WASHINGTON  Obama administration officials said Wednesday that more than one million people had submitted applications for health insurance in the first week of this falls open enrollment period under the Affordable Care Act, and 45 percent of them had already selected health plans.

title: A Letter From Camus to Sartre, Before They Were Enemies
description: PARIS  The two men were known to be bitter rivals. Jean-Paul Sartre once denounced the philosophical incompetence of Albert Camus and was said to have thrown out most of the letters he and Camus had exchanged.

title: Marc Jacobs and Damien Hirst Team Up for Charity
description: Five years ago, the artist Damien Hirst was invited by Disney to develop a piece inspired by Mickey Mouse. The result, Mickey, which recalled Hirsts iconic spot paintings, was reproduced into a series of poster-size prints sold by the art publisher Other Criteria. In early 2014, Christies auctioned Mickey for just over $1.5 million, donating a portion of the proceeds to Kids Company, an organization that supports inner-city children in the U.K.

title: Finding Takers for Lonely Leftovers in a Culinary Nook of the Sharing Economy
description: BERLIN  Fresh from a bracing workout at the gym, Anton Kaiser gazed hungrily into a refrigerator, considering arugula, pineapple jam, salted butter and two bags of green grapes before reaching for a white bread roll, baked that morning. I havent eaten all day, he said, so its great.

title: Bank of New York Mellon Fires Currency Trader After Internal Review
description: LONDON  Bank of New York Mellon terminated a currency trader in London earlier this year for violating its code of conduct after an internal review of its foreign exchange operations, according to a person briefed on the matter.

title: Drones Misbehaving
description: Drones are now soaring beyond their practical and recreational uses and are landing firmly in the hands of troublemakers and pranksters.

title: U.S. Adds Planes to Bolster Drive to Wipe Out ISIS
description: SHAW AIR FORCE BASE, S.C.  The United States is shifting more attack and surveillance aircraft from Afghanistan to the air war against the Islamic State, deepening American involvement in the conflict and presenting new challenges for the military planners who work here in central South Carolina, far from the targets they will pick for those aircraft.

title: Diabetes Screening Lags in People With Hypertension
description: As many as a third of adults who have high blood pressure have not been screened for diabetes, despite the fact that guidelines call for them to be checked regularly, new research suggests.

title: Jian Ghomeshi, Canadian Radio Host Facing Sexual Assault Charges, Is Granted Bail
description: OTTAWA  Until a month ago, Jian Ghomeshi was a celebrity with few peers at the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation. His weekday arts and entertainment radio program, Q, had brought younger listeners to the public broadcaster and raised its profile in the United States through syndication. Separately, he hosted both the networks annual competition to select a book for all Canadians to read and Canadas most valuable literary award, the Scotiabank Giller Prize.

title: The Chefs behind Via Carota
description: Jody Williams and Rita Sodi invite T Magazine inside their new West Village restaurant, Via Carota.

title: British Brothers Imprisoned for Attending Terrorist Training Camp in Syria
description: LONDON  As the British government introduced a new counterterrorism law on Wednesday to increase surveillance on people suspected of involvement in jihad, two British brothers were jailed for conspiring to attend a terrorist training camp in Syria and unlawfully possessing ammunition.

title: Thanksgiving Recipes: Reader Responses
description: Well be posting some reader responses and questions to our article on distinct Thanksgiving recipes, based on a state-by-state analysis of Google searches. If you have a question, feel free to leave it on Facebook or ask via Twitter.

title: Some More Coffee, Mom?
description: From a brief plot summary  a son moves back to his hometown to help his mother deal with her blindness  you might expect the set for Naperville to be some sort of living room-bedroom combination, a domestic backdrop for yet another play about the Problem of Aging Parents. Instead, your eyes are greeted by a coffee shop, where the entire story unfolds. It is far from the last time that Mat Smart, the playwright, surprises you in this intricate, delightful comic drama, which is receiving a fine production by the Slant Theater Project at the June Havoc Theater.

title: Telling My Son About Ferguson
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio  MY son wants an answer. He is 10 years old, and he wants me to tell him that he doesnt need to worry. He is a black boy, rather sheltered, and knows little of the world beyond our safe, quiet neighborhood. His eyes are wide and holding my gaze, silently begging me to say: No, sweetheart, you have no need to worry. Most officers are nothing like Officer Wilson. They would not shoot you  or anyone  while youre unarmed, running away or even toward them.

title: Wells Fargo Is the First Big Bank Simple Enough to Fail
description: Wells Fargo is the first big bank to get its affairs in order. The $1.6 trillion lender secured a conditional stamp of approval from regulators for its living will. Less credible plans from 11 other titans suggest size isnt the main issue. The real problems are complexity and interconnectedness.

title: A Film That Might Inspire an Armchair Singalong
description: Not every piece of seasonal television fare is a sitcoms Thanksgiving episode or a Hallmark Channel Christmas movie. On Thursday night, BYUtv broadcasts Handels Messiah, a decently made documentary about how one of the most beloved pieces of music ever created came to be.

title: A Double Bill Riffs on Two Mystiques
description: For its inaugural performance series at the newly renovated space at 280 Broadway, the Gibney Dance center passed the curatorial wand to a handful of respected choreographers. Each was asked to choose two up-and-coming artists to share a double bill as part of a six-week endeavor, DoublePlus.

title: Greek Navy Aids Disabled Ship With Hundreds of Migrants
description: ATHENS  Mounting its biggest and riskiest sea rescue in years, the Greek Navy towed a disabled freighter carrying hundreds of migrants toward the Aegean island of Crete on Wednesday, fighting strong winds and high seas, officials said.

title: New Smog Rules: Good But Later Than They Had to Be
description: The Obama administrations announcement on Wednesday of a proposed rule limiting emissions of smog-causing ozone in the atmosphere is, on one level, great news. Smog contributes heavily to asthma and other respiratory diseases, leading to needless deaths and hundreds of thousands of otherwise avoidable hospitalizations and emergency room visits. The proposed new standard would reduce the level of allowable ozone in the atmosphere from the current 75 parts per billion  a weak standard in place since 2008  to a range of 65 and 70 parts per billion.

title: Agency Issues Ultimatum on Nationwide Recalls to Airbag Maker Takata
description: In a continuing standoff over the recall of defective airbags, federal safety regulators have demanded that Takata, the Japanese supplier of automotive parts, expand the recall nationwide, beyond the limited geographic area it currently covers.

title: TransCanada Cuts Ties With Edelman Over Energy East Communications Plan
description: TransCanada has cut ties with the American public relations firm Edelman, amid controversy over a proposed communications strategy for a major pipeline project.

title: One Direction Outsells Taylor Swift
description: Eventually, someone had to bump Taylor Swift from the top of the Billboard album chart. This week, that distinction belongs to One Direction.

title: Another Feline Incursion From Russia Into China
description: BEIJING  The two dead goats in a farm building in northeast China each had a hole in its head the size of a human finger. Their skulls had been crushed. Three other goats were missing.

title: What If Were Wrong About Depression?
description: What is depression? Anyone who has dealt with the condition knows what it can feel like  but what causes it, what sustains it, and whats the best way to make it subside?

title: Thats Amaro: Jody Williams and Rita Sodi on Their Favorite Postprandial Sips
description: A few weeks ago, when I first stepped into Via Carota, the forthcoming restaurant from Jody Williams and Rita Sodi in New Yorks West Village, the two chef-entrepreneurs were taking care of a very important task: They were arranging bottles of amaro on the shelves behind the bar. Were hands-on, Williams told me.

title: Hotel Review: D.O.M. Hotel in Rome
description: Starting at 220 euros, (about $267, at $1.21 to the euro) for a Deluxe room.

title: First Draft Focus: A Presidential Tradition, With Cheese
The Coolest Girl at the Party
description: A few words of advice for those looking for a little party magic.

title: Fashion Tips for a Little Holiday Party Magic
description: The coolest girl at the party knows the secret: perfectly done is overdone.

title: Fantasy Football Isnt Just a Mans Game
description: When Odell Beckham Jr. of the New York Giants caught a 43-yard touchdown pass last Sunday by snagging the ball from behind his head with one hand, among the beneficiaries of his impressive skill was Kim Meyer, head of public relations for Christian Dior Beauty.

title: Chinese Artwork Brings Auction Record of $45 Million
description: BEIJING  A Chinese collector bought a Ming dynasty silk wall hanging for $45 million at a Christies auction in Hong Kong on Wednesday, setting a record for a Chinese artwork sold at international auction.

title: At Concept Shops, Thinking Matters as Much as Buying
description: PARIS  Like curate and capsule collection, many of which I wish would be shot straight to the moon, concept shop is a term that has gradually infiltrated the retail lexicon, especially in philosophical Paris.

title: Browns Parents Appear With Sharpton
description: The relatives of Michael Brown, Eric Garner and Akai Gurley attended a news conference with the Rev. Al Sharpton, where they prayed that their loved ones deaths would inspire positive change.

title: Sunset Overdrive, This War of Mine, Super Smash Bros. and Civilization
description: SUNSET OVERDRIVE

title: Inside the Truck
description: For mobile retail trucks, space is at a premium. Jessie Goldenberg of Nomad, based in New York City, gives a peek into the design of her 120-square-foot boutique.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: So Is It a Murder, if the Corpse Is Undead?
description: Christopher Fowlers latest book is the 11th installment in his delectably droll Bryant & May Peculiar Crimes Unit series, and his second book published in America this year. The other is Film Freak, described as a grimly hilarious and acutely observed trawl through the nether regions of the British film industry, where Mr. Fowler embarked on a try-anything career in the late 1970s.

title: Being a Confident Redhead (Without Eyebrow Angst)
description: One day in high school, when Adrienne Vendetti Hodges was being teased yet again about her copper-colored hair, she realized she had two choices. Give the guy the satisfaction of knowing he was bothering her or tell him: I love my red hair. Its awesome.

title: Germany Planning Quotas for Women in Boardrooms
description: BERLIN  Germanys coalition government pledged Wednesday to introduce a bill mandating quotas for women on the supervisory boards of the countrys top companies, after a feud erupted this week when a leading conservative lawmaker told the minister of family affairs, a woman, to stop whining about the proposal.

title: Are Flip Phones Having a Retro Chic Moment?
description: On Sept. 4, one image sent jolts through the disparate worlds of fashion and technology: Anna Wintour, the editor of Vogue and doyenne of all things chic, was photographed using a flip phone at the United States Open tennis tournament.

title: Stuck Russian Plane Gets a Push, Possibly Symbolic, From Passengers
description: MOSCOW  If ever there was a moment to award bonus frequent flier miles, this would seem to be it.

title: An Exercise in Stripping to Essentials
description: Dawn, by the Hungarian choreographer Adrienn Hod, is a very naked dance. At the beginning of this work, seen Sunday at the Abrons Arts Center Playhouse, four dancers  from Ms. Hods company, Hodworks  enter the stage in warm-up clothes and matter-of-factly undress. Over the next 45 minutes, they execute a series of daring physical tasks in this most unencumbered state.

title: Angel Collinson Showcases Talent
description: Angel Collinson went to Alaska this March to test herself against some of the worlds largest mountains. What she accomplished pushed the boundaries of what women can do on a pair of skis.

title: Toyota Recalls 30,000 Minivans for Airbag Problem
description: Toyota is recalling about 30,000 Sienna minivans from the 2015 model year, including about 25,500 in the United States, for a problem with plastic hand grips mounted near the side-curtain airbags, the automaker said in a news release Wednesday afternoon.

title: A Deal From the Von Zedtwitz Life Master Pairs
description: The American Contract Bridge Leagues Fall North American Championships begin Thursday in Providence, R.I. The winners of the national titles will be experts at reading the defenders discards, one declarer-play skill that does not receive as many column inches as it deserves.

title: When Glamour Speaks Your Name
description: A new book looks at the history of how black women used style and substance to counter stereotypes  or invisibility  in the mainstream.

title: Beyond the Galaxy
description: Roland Mouret has arrived on Madison Avenue, eager to extend his brand and reach beyond his signature dress, the Galaxy.

title: A Last-Minute Sensation
description: Sonya Yoncheva, a Bulgarian soprano on the brink of stardom, received a phone call with a bold request last month at her home in Switzerland. Could she quickly learn the role of Mim in Puccinis La Bohme, fly to New York and sing the part onstage, for the first time, at the Metropolitan Opera just five weeks after giving birth to her first child?

title: Is Roland Mouret More Than a One-Hit Wonder?
description: On Nov. 11, as the Whitney Museum was preparing for its final wingding uptown, the first Roland Mouret boutique in America opened for business directly across the street on Madison Avenue. It was what they call a soft opening  so soft, it was difficult to hear. There was no party with flutes of Champagne sloshing perilously near the clothes, sparse media coverage and, during a visit a few days later, only one customer.

title: A Wrenching Grief Assuaged With Beauty
description: Theres a calmly heartbreaking moment near the close of Beautiful Life, a poignant new album by the saxophonist Jimmy Greene. It arrives in Little Voices, an original poem read by the actress Anika Noni Rose. All those precious little voices, she says over a fluttery gospel groove. Brightening our day, stealing our hearts, shaping our lives. Then: In the blink of an eye, theyre gone. Now theres just silence where those little voices used to be.

title: What Waze Users Can Tell Us About Thanksgiving Travel Patterns
description: People who use Waze, a social mapping app that lets participants post real-time reports on traffic and weather to help users find the fastest routes, are helping the service better understand Thanksgiving travel patterns.

title: Video: Angel Collinsons Award Winning Segment from Alaska
description: Angel Collinson impressed in a Teton Gravity Research film, Almost Ablaze. The first woman to open a Teton ski film, she was nominated for Best Female Performance at this years Powder Awards and was a finalist at the Banff Mountain Film Festival.

title: Pictures of the Day: Hong Kong and Elsewhere
description: Hong Kong and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Nov. 26, 2014  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Hong Kong, China, Syria and the United States.

title: Readers Respond: On Ferguson
description: Following a grand jurys decision this week not to bring charges in the police shooting of an unarmed black man in Ferguson, Mo., readers poured out their skepticism, disappointment and distrust of police professionalism in comments to the Times.

title: Obama Builds Environmental Legacy With 1970 Law
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama could leave office with the most aggressive, far-reaching environmental legacy of any occupant of the White House. Yet it is very possible that not a single major environmental law will have passed during his two terms in Washington.

title: An Optimistic Realist Tours Earths Age of Humans
description: When I spent a week in Ithaca, N.Y., as a visiting professor at Cornell earlier this fall, I finally got to meet Diane Ackerman, the author and poet best known for a string of lyrical and popular books on natural history and human nature. She had spent the last couple of years dug in on terrain thats familiar here  the Anthropocene, a k a this era in which humans are powerfully jogging a host of planetary systems.

title: Asian-American Admissions at Harvard
description: To the Editor:

title: How Three It-Girls Turn It Up for Holiday Dressing
description: The D.J. Mia Moretti and the violinist Margot (real name Caitlin Moe), who perform together as The Dolls, and the artist and poet Cleo Wade are almost always dressed as if for a holiday party. Its kind of hard for us to turn it up any more, Ms. Moretti said. We dont really hold back other parts of the year. These night life denizens are unafraid to clash prints or go for it with an oversize headdress. So we asked the threesome, who, with two other friends, are a part of a female art collective called Conversations, to put together a few party-going looks reflective of their signature styles. Perhaps youll take away a tip or two on how you can turn it up for the holidays.

title: A Selfie for the Road: Me, Myself and Eiffel
description: To the Editor:

title: In Austen and Chekhov, a Test of Versatility
description: Gossip gallops in Bedlams invigorating stage version of Jane Austens Sense and Sensibility, which runs through Dec. 21 at the Sheen Center. The would-be and might-have-been lovers in this enchantingly athletic take on the perils of Austen-style courtship, adapted by Kate Hamill and directed by Eric Tucker, find themselves pushed and pulled by the forces of speculation run rampant.

title: When Cuban Doctors Are Lured to the U.S.
description: To the Editor:

title: Office Cubicles Are the Worst
description: To the Editor:

title: In Newport, Historic Homes for the Holidays
description: Thanksgiving tables still havent been set, but that hasnt stopped Christmas celebrations from starting in Newport County in Rhode Island. For the next five weeks, visitors can step back into the Gilded Age as part of Christmas at the Newport Mansions.

title: The Downside of Eating Too Locally
description: BERKELEY, Calif.  TO appreciate the depth of our national political divide, look no further than our Thanksgiving tables. The organic turkeys and farmers market produce of coastal urbanites face off against the frozen Butterballs and rich gravies of our rural interior, each side equally contemptuous of the other. Or so it might seem.

title: Fantasy Football: Week 13 Player Tiers
description: In this statistical model, I apply a clustering algorithm called the Gaussian mixture model to an aggregation of expert ranking data provided by Fantasypros.com. The algorithm finds natural tiers and clusters within the data. The charts that result visualize the tiers and help you decide your starting lineup each week.

title: This Thanksgiving, Setting My Family Free
description: This year, my brain finally grasped this obvious truth: As you grow older and your family expands, your chance of coming together for the holidays has to go down. Somehow, for decades, I had failed to see it coming. I had failed to do the math.

title: Lasker Rink in Central Park Is to Reopen on Thanksgiving
description: Lasker Rink in Central Park, a popular skating and hockey site that was expected to be closed for most of the winter, will reopen on Thanksgiving after undergoing extensive repairs.

title: Lovegun, a New Gay Bar in Williamsburg
description: If Grindr killed the gay bar, no one told Benjamin Maisani. After opening bars in the East Village (Eastern Bloc, Bedlam) and, more recently, the crowded Hells Kitchen fray (Atlas Social Club), Mr. Maisani set his sights on Brooklyn, giving the gay night-life circuit in Williamsburg a much-needed shot in the arm with Lovegun.

title: Openings, Sales and Shopping Events in New York City
description: Beginning Black Friday, the South Street Seaport Holiday Pop-Up Shops will host a new group of seasonal retailers. They include Whisper Editions, an online retailer that collaborates with artists and designers on limited-edition works, like a whisper clutch by Edie Parker and Fabian Baron ($1,400), and Brother Vellies, the desert boot label that creates artisanal jobs in Africa. At 89 South Street.

title: New F.A.A. Report Tallies Drone Sightings, Highlighting Safety Issues
description: Sales of drones to civilians are taking off and so are safety concerns about the proliferation of the unmanned vehicles buzzing the skies.

title: Discounts at Ladies & Gentlemen Studio, Alessi, Artemide and Vermont Woods
description: All Ladies & Gentlemen Studio Superior servers, right, are 15 percent off through Sunday (originally $30 each, they are about $25 each); 425-610-7408, ladiesandgentlemenstudio.com/shop.

title: Textbook Beautiful
description: Flora Illustrata (Yale University Press, $50) is a book about books about plants, particularly the 123-year-old LuEsther T. Mertz Library of the New York Botanical Garden. Timed with an exhibition there through Jan. 19, the book is a history of research and scholarship, with subjects including the production of medieval and Renaissance herbals, 17th-century specimen hunts in South America and the commercialization of horticulture through seed packages. Because these activities depended on artistic renderings, Flora Illustrata is a treat for the eyes, whether reproducing a seven-headed hydra assigned by Linnaeus to the category paradoxa, or a 19th-century Rareripe Peach. Nostalgists will ache for the circa 1855 gardens that bordered the Hudson River near Newburgh, N.Y., and even a Victorian ad for Hanson Lettuce Seed, with a lettuce head unfurling as if ready to embrace the seed buyer in a crisp, cool hug.

title: One Vase Can Lead to Another
description: Having turned out some 120 candlesticks in a marathon creative session last year, Tung Chiang, the studio director of Heath Ceramics, has shifted his attention to vases. Over five months beginning in June, he threw, fired and glazed 158 of them in different sizes and shapes. (He was especially attentive to customers who had been asking for larger versions.) The results of his experiments will be unveiled on Dec. 6 at Heaths San Francisco shop.

title: Space Age Doodles Still Know How to Charm
description: Dan Cooper, an Amherst, Mass., producer of cotton lace curtains with Victorian and Arts and Crafts motifs, has leapt into the mid-20th century with a new design, Galaxy.

title: A Prefab, Fully Stocked
description: Vipp, a Danish company known for its industrial-chic garbage cans, has created a prefab house. The 600-square-foot galvanized-steel-and-glass structure comes completely furnished, mostly with Vipp products. It includes all interior furniture and lighting, a fully functional kitchen down to the dishes and glassware, a bed (in a sleeping loft) with linens, a bathroom, an outdoor shower and a fireplace.

title: Fixes Came Too Late
description: The 1984 Pontiac Fiero made its debut with a captivating design, a midengine layout that conveyed sports car aspirations and a name that meant proud in Italian. The $8,000 base price attracted young buyers.

title: 2 Fieros for Want of a Ferrari
description: PATERSON, N.J.  A visit with Onix Taveras and his Pontiac Fieros begins with a basement tour in his neat Cape Cod style home  and a chat about television. Displays of action figures, wall posters and scale models from the various Star Trek series give away his favorite show.

title: Staying True to 80s Cool
description: Onix Taveras fell in love with the Pontiac Fiero during the cars brief 1980s heyday and has remained a faithful devotee ever since.

title: Anatomy of a Scene | Imitation Game
description: Morten Tyldum narrates a sequence from The Imitation Game, featuring Benedict Cumberbatch.

title: Dealers Move Beyond Doughnuts
description: FORT WORTH  Corrie Watson and her twin brother, Will Churchill, wanted a strategy to attract younger customers to their three sizable family-owned automobile dealerships and to keep them coming back for decades.

title: Manual Locks: A Love Story
description: After a 12-year tour of duty in Michigan, my stalwart purple Plymouth Voyager finally succumbed to the road salt and crumbled into what looked like Martian dust. I was about to sign for a solid little Ford sedan with all the sex appeal of pleated khakis when I caught a bright flash of presidential blue out of the corner of my eye.

title: A Terrestrial Rocket That Defies Gravity
description: The Lamborghini Huracn is quick. How quick? Quick enough that if you jumped off a cliff, you wouldnt reach 60 miles per hour quite as soon as the Huracn can do it on a flat stretch of pavement. Car and Driver clocked this newest Lambos 0-to-60 run at 2.5 seconds, which means that youre basically experiencing acceleration greater than gravity, but on a novel new vector  forward, toward the horizon.

title: Thanks for Ripping Up Our Home
description: Last year, James LaForce, a co-owner of the public relations firm LaForce & Stevens, and Stephen Henderson, a writer, bought a 4,000-square-foot loft in Chelsea that was in need of major work. It had been owned since the 1970s by a photographer and his wife, and the entire back of the apartment had been turned into a darkroom and a graveyard for ancient photography equipment. It looked like Thomas Alva Edison left 15 minutes ago, Mr. Henderson said.

title: Taunting the Big Bad Wolf
description: CENTREVILLE, Md.  The two-story home Vicco von Voss built for his family here is more like a giant piece of custom-made furniture than a house.

title: Sierra Leone to Eclipse Liberia in Ebola Cases
description: Sierra Leone will soon displace Liberia as the worst-hit of the West African countries ravaged by Ebola, the World Health Organization said Wednesday.

title: In France, New Review of 35-Hour Workweek
description: PARIS  On a recent weekday, Ahlem Saifi caught a 5 a.m. Mtro to get to her job as a passengers assistant at Orly Airport, where she often works 44 hours a week  well over Frances official 35-hour workweek.

title: Just Dont Call It a Lab
description: When Joy Bergelson was planning the new field station here for the University of Chicagos department of ecology and evolution, she wanted it to be environmentally responsible. She just wasnt sure exactly what that meant.

title: What Can I Do to Make My Outdated Parquet Floors Look More Presentable?
Video Shows Police Shooting 12-Year-Old
description: The Cleveland police released surveillance video showing officers fatally shooting a 12-year-old boy who was playing with a toy gun.

title: Victorians Rejected Oddities
description: Victorians loved their gizmos. As Julie Halls writes in Inventions That Didnt Change the World, out next month from Thames & Hudson, eager amateur inventors sought copyright protection for such piquant devices as an Anti-Garotting Cravat. Ms. Halls, a specialist in 19th-century registered designs who works at the National Archives in London, uncovered books and books of schemes moldering on the shelves while she was researching her Ph.D. She does a lovely job investigating the social and cultural back stories that led to the design of an Improved Pickle Fork and a Bona Fide Ventilating Hat, to name just a few, revealing the Victorians to be not just ingenious but wildly insecure about their social status, their bodies and their safety. (This interview has been edited and condensed.)

title: Simple, Even Retro, Toys Gain Favor This Christmas
description: There is a moment in Seth MacFarlanes comedy A Million Ways to Die in the West, set in the 1880s, where a boy rolls a hoop down the street with a stick.

title: Video Shows Cleveland Officer Shot Boy in 2 Seconds
description: A police officer who shot and killed a 12-year-old boy outside a Cleveland recreation center fired within two seconds after the patrol car he was riding in pulled up next to the boy, a video released on Wednesday by the Cleveland police showed.

title: New York City and Officer Found Liable in Fatal 05 Shooting of a Teenager
description: In the hours after a Bronx teenager was shot and killed  by a New York City police sergeant on an October night in 2005, accounts of a tragedy crystallized into an orderly tale.

title: Legal Fight Pits Sellers of Energy Against Buyers
description: Over the past few years, the federal government has nurtured the growth of an odd kind of player in the energy markets: companies that recruit consumers to unplug themselves when electricity use is high, in exchange for a price break.

title: Thursdays College Football Games to Watch
description: 6 TEXAS CHRISTIAN at TEXAS

title: Turkeys Receive Presidential Pardon
description: In an annual tradition, President Obama pardoned two turkeys, Mac and Cheese, who wont become Thanksgiving dinner.

title: An Executive Action Unlikely to Be Faulted
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama granted amnesty on Wednesday, but Republicans did not issue dire warnings of a constitutional crisis.

title: Calories on Menus: Nationwide Experiment Into Human Behavior
description: Now its official. Starting next November, menus in many places where Americans eat  like chain restaurants and some movie theaters, convenience stores and amusement parks  will have to list calories.

title: Egypt: Rafah Border Crossing Is Opened Temporarily
description: Egypt temporarily opened its crossing on its border with Gaza on Wednesday for the first time in 30 days, allowing more than 250 Palestinians who had been stuck in Egypt to return to the coastal territory. The Rafah crossing was expected to open again on Thursday. More than 2,500 Gazans are waiting to return from Egypt, according to the Palestinian diplomatic mission in Cairo. Egypt has strictly limited passage through the crossing and has clamped down on smuggling tunnels beneath the border in recent months amid accusations of Hamas involvement in attacks on Egyptian soldiers in Sinai. A recent United Nations report stated that the borders closing had prevented thousands of Gazans from accessing medical treatment or education in Egypt and beyond.

title: Fantasy Date With Twins Turns Sour for Manhattan Man, 84
description: The website billed itself as a place where older men with money could meet young women interested in dating someone who could support them financially.

title: The Power of Language in Ferguson
description: Protesters talked about the meaning behind the words on signs and T-shirts as demonstrations over the grand jury decision not to indict Officer Darren Wilson continued Tuesday evening.

title: Rebels in Yemen Strike at Rivals
description: SANA, Yemen  The rebel group known as the Houthis seized control of a compound belonging to one of Yemens most powerful tribal clans on Wednesday, in the latest sign that the rebels, who stormed the capital in September, were seeking to consolidate their newly won power.

title: Europes Modest Investment Plan
description: In announcing a plan to spur investment in public works and loans to small businesses, the European Union is finally acknowledging that it needs to do more to bolster its economy. Unfortunately, the new plan is inadequate and overly complicated.

title: Oligarchs of Eastern Europe Scoop Up Stakes in Media Companies
description: BRATISLAVA, Slovakia  Across Eastern Europe, local oligarchs and investment groups  some directly connected to their countries political leadership  are snapping up newspapers and other media companies, prompting deep concerns among journalists and others about press freedom.

title: Thursdays N.F.L. Matchups
description: Bears (5-6) at Lions (7-4)

title: Making Calorie Counts Visible
description: The new regulations for posting calorie counts on menus and vending machines are a welcome response to combating the nations obesity epidemic, one person at a time. The rules posted by the Food and Drug Administration on Tuesday are surprisingly sweeping in the range of food items and establishments covered. They were well worth waiting for.

title: For Son and Mother, a Relationship Scarred by a Brutal Crime Is Redeemed
description: Prince McClennahan was 15 when his mother killed. It was a summer Sunday six years ago, at his Bronx apartment. He was babysitting for three younger siblings and the infant son of his mothers partner, Olympia Peck. She and his mother, Angelique McClennahan, were at the movies.

title: Mass Imprisonment and Public Health
description: When public health authorities talk about an epidemic, they are referring to a disease that can spread rapidly throughout a population, like the flu or tuberculosis.

title: Counting Benghazi Blessings
description: This year, in a break from tradition, I am giving thanks for the House Intelligence Committees final report on Benghazi.

title: After Closing Schools, a Principal Fights to Save a Bronx High School
description: By 2:25 p.m. every school day, Santiago Taveras takes his position on the corner of Paul Avenue and the Mosholu Parkway in the Bronx, two muscled security guards by his side. A pair of police vans, lights flashing, park just across the street, and a half-dozen school safety agents in police uniforms patrol on foot.

title: Germany: Merkel Repeats Tough Stance on Ukraine
description: Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany told Germanys Parliament on Wednesday that no military solution to the crisis with Russia was possible, but also that there was no way to lift sanctions under the present circumstances. Patience and the long view are needed, she said. While Russia might have concerns about Ukraines joining a European Union trading and association agreement, she said: None of that justifies or excuses Russias annexation of Crimea. Nothing of that justifies or excuses the direct or indirect participation by Russia in the fighting in Donetsk and Luhansk, the separatist strongholds in eastern Ukraine. Also, NATOs top commander in Europe visited Ukraine, and monitors for the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe reported Wednesday that they had been fired on in the east.

title: Bill Cosby, UVA and Rape
description: The worlds wrath and revulsion seem to be focused on Bill Cosby these days, as he goes in the public mind from Americas Dad to an unofficial serial rape suspect.

title: Shades of Pond Hockey in 3-on-3 Overtime Experiment in A.H.L.
description: Few things in sports are as roundly reviled as the hockey shootout, but this season the American Hockey League is conducting an experiment that has become so successful it may render the shootout an endangered species.

title: Nepal: Agreements Stall at South Asian Summit
description: South Asian leaders discussed trade and energy cooperation and regional peacein Katmandu on Wednesday, but did not reach a consensus on expected transportation and energy agreements. Hopes for a meeting between the leaders of India and Pakistan also appeared to fade. In opening remarksWednesday at the South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation summit meeting, the first since 2011, Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India noted that it was the anniversary of the 2008 attacks on Mumbai, in which Pakistani gunmen killed 166 people. Relations between India and Pakistan were frozen after the attacks, and little progress has been made since. The signing of deals on the sharing of railroads, highways and energy had been expected, but unless one is achieved during a retreaton Thursday, the meeting could end without any agreements signed.

title: Afghans Finally Get Good Governance, Without the Government
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Afghans are being treated to the unfamiliar spectacle of their leaders trying to outdo one another in good governance, even as they remain hopelessly deadlocked on actually forming a new government.

title: Minnesota Loses to St. Johns After Daquein McNeil Is Charged With Domestic Assault
description: St. Johns used an impressive second-half effort to beat Minnesota, 70-61, in the N.I.T. Season Tip-Off at Madison Square Garden on Wednesday night, in a game in which the Gophers were missing an important reserve guard who was arrested Monday afternoon on charges of domestic violence.

title: In New York Public Housing, Policing Broken Lights
description: Four days before a grand jury refused to indict the white police officer who shot and killed Michael Brown during an encounter in Ferguson, Mo., in August, Akai Gurley, an unarmed 28-year-old man, died as a result of a law-enforcement bullet in the Louis H. Pink Houses in East New York, in Brooklyn.

title: Experts Weigh Officers Decisions Leading to Fatal Shooting of Michael Brown
description: In his first public interview this week, Darren Wilson, the white police officer who fatally shot an unarmed black teenager in Ferguson, Mo., was asked whether he could have done anything differently that would have prevented the killing.

title: Fury After Ferguson
description: The reaction to the failure of the grand jury to indict in the shooting of an unarmed black teenager, Michael Brown, by a white police officer, Darren Wilson, touched something deep and ancient and anguished in the black community.

title: No Shame in Giving Thanks for Some Story Lines
description: In a sports year darkened, if not dominated, by domestic violence, child abuse, concussions, drunken driving and college academic scandals, those who stood tall deserve a Thanksgiving thank-you note more than ever.

title: Allan Kornblum, Independent Publisher, Dies at 65; Sought the Undiscovered
description: Allan Kornblum, whose love for poetry and printing led him to start Coffee House Press, an independent publisher widely respected for finding and nurturing new authors, died on Nov. 23 at his home in St. Paul. He was 65.

title: New York Police Dept. Aims to Curb Officers Cursing
description: Most New York City police officers may not grow up cursing. But many learn the lingo, or perfect it, on the streets and then use it in encounters with civilians.

title: Jill Martin Puts On Her Game Face
description: Jill Martin covers New York Knicks games for the MSG Network, has a line of home organization products and is the author of several books. She also likes to undertake challenging projects for the Today show, including a 30-day technology detox and more recently, an attempt to break the Guinness world record for constructing the worlds largest high-heeled shoe, with the help of the designer Kenneth Cole (they were successful). A native of Plainview, on Long Island, Ms. Martin, 38, lives with a four-pound teacup Maltese named Bella who splits time between Ms. Martins two-bedroom apartment just off Gramercy Park and her parents home on Long Island.

title: Thanksgiving Phrase
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  Happy Thanksgiving to our American readers, who, by now, have put away the turkey and the trimmings for those delicious leftover sandwiches.

title: Rescuers in Yemen Sought American, Officials Say
description: WASHINGTON  An American journalist held hostage in a remote part of eastern Yemen by Al Qaedas affiliate there was one of the main targets of a predawn raid carried out this week by United States Special Operations commandos and Yemeni troops, according to American and Yemeni officials.

title: Bunny Briggs, Tap Dancing Virtuoso, Dies at 92
description: Bunny Briggs, the elegant and versatile tap virtuoso whose career bridged dance eras, from Bill (Bojangles) Robinsons to Savion Glovers, died on Nov. 15 in Las Vegas. He was 92.

title: After Disputed Verdict, Reckoning for Ferguson
description: FERGUSON, Mo.  It was never much, a faded commercial strip on a stretch that drew people from the apartments nearby for most of the essentials. You could pick up milk at the convenience store, get a manicure at Crystal Nails, wash your clothes at the Ferguson Laundry. On a busy Friday night, men would gather to talk and watch sports on television at the barber shop as they got straight razor shaves.

title: Francis Fraser, Who Cashed In on His Cruelty, Dies at 90
description: Francis Fraser, a British underworld enforcer known as Mad Frankie, whose life of crime and torture led to a lucrative retirement chronicling his own grisly deeds in books, films and lectures, on stage and television, and as a gangland tour guide, died on Wednesday in London. He was 90.

title: In NFL Networks Partnership, Benefits Outlast CBSs Schedule
description: The motivation behind CBSs carrying a half-season of Thursday night N.F.L. broadcasts was to broaden the audience for games that had been the exclusive domain of NFL Network.

title: Venezuela: Presidents Rival to Be Charged as Plotter
description: The national prosecutors office said Wednesday that it would charge a prominent opposition leader in what it called a plot to kill President Nicols Maduro. The announcement did not provide details of the charges against the leader, Mara Corina Machado, but this year senior government officials accused her of organizing a conspiracy to kill the president. They showed what they claimed were a series of emails that they said implicated Ms. Machado and other opposition figures. They also said that Kevin Whitaker, a former State Department official who is now ambassador to Colombia, was implicated in the scheme. Ms. Machado is a former legislator and an ally of another politician, Leopoldo Lpez, who was jailed this year after weeks of protests against the government. Mr. Maduro, a leftist who faces a severe economic crisis, has frequently said his enemies are plotting to kill or overthrow him.

title: Judge on the Spot
description: During the month that followed the Supreme Courts refusal to take up any of the same-sex marriage cases that awaited the start of the new term on Oct. 6, I filled an occasional idle moment with this thought: What would it be like right now to be Jeff Sutton?

title: Bill Cosby Gave Interview to Keep Charges Secret
description: Bill Cosby gave an exclusive interview to The National Enquirer in 2005 in exchange for a promise by the tabloid that it would drop a more damaging article about previously undisclosed sexual assault allegations, according to his testimony in a federal lawsuit.

title: 11 Brooklyn Churches Hit in a String of Burglaries
description: One Sunday morning this month, as worshipers streamed into the Fourth Avenue Presbyterian Church in Brooklyn, police officers inspected shattered glass and took note of an air-conditioner that had been pulled from a wall, clues in the theft of a few hundred dollars from the churchs coffers.

title: Struggling Nets Find Team Even They Can Beat
description: PHILADELPHIA  Brett Brown, the coach of the Philadelphia 76ers, could sense that his teams prolonged futility this season was reaching historic levels, but he did not quite know the specifics.

title: Cranberry Growers Search for Ways to Share Their Bounty
description: WARRENS, Wis.  As you pack away the leftover Thanksgiving cranberry sauce (and there is always leftover cranberry sauce), consider the plight of Wisconsins cranberry growers.

title: Lucien Clergue, Master and Promoter of Art Photography, Dies at 80
description: Lucien Clergue, one of the most acclaimed photographers in France and a founder of an annual festival in Arles that has become a mainstay of the art photography world, died on Nov. 15 in Nmes, in the South of France. He was 80.

title: U.S. Smoking Rate Dips Again
description: The smoking rate in the United States declined to 17.8 percent in 2013, down slightly from 18.1 percent the previous year, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reported Wednesday.The report found a decline in the number of smokers in the United States  42 million in 2013, down from 45 million in 2005  despite an increase in population. The smoking rate has been dropping for decades, but the pace of the decline has slowed in recent years. The smoking rate was 20.9 percent in 2005 and stood at about 42 percent in 1965, when the federal government began systematically tracking it.

title: Wyoming Devises Plan to Expand Medicaid
description: WASHINGTON  With a plan released Wednesday by the administration of Gov. Matt Mead, a Republican, Wyoming has become the latest state seeking to expand Medicaid.

title: Knicks Fare Badly in Reunion in Dallas
description: DALLAS  Carmelo Anthony made an early appearance at American Airlines Center on Wednesday night.

title: Pregnant Woman, 27, Is Fatally Shot in Queens
description: Shortly after dropping off her children at school on Wednesday, Anastasia Massey, 25 weeks pregnant, returned home and found a gunman waiting outside her Queens apartment, the police said.

title: Winnings Lottery Numbers for Nov. 26, 2014
A Parthenon of Produce at United Brothers Fruit Market in Astoria
description: If Queens is the borough of the world, Astoria is its Mediterranean outpost. On 30th Avenue, where it is easier to order souvlakia on pita than a slice of pizza, and olive oil seems to exist as common currency, you will find United Brothers Fruit Market, the supply store for this enclave along the East River. Its signature yellow bag, a common neighborhood tumbleweed, is carried by Greek grandmothers and hipsters alike.

title: Like a Spy, He Photographs Marriage Proposals in New York City
description: Im like a spy, said Vlad Leto, 30, before pointing his long-lens camera down on the crowded Rink at Rockefeller Center.

title: Party Shoes for a Night on the Town
description: A festive low stacked heel is a joyfully practical choice.

title: Dressed-Down Diamond Timepieces
description: The new evening watches have an oversize masculinity that makes them fitting even for day.

title: Entering the Void
description: The Spanish artist Miquel Barceló closely examines the basic materials of life in response to Edward Hirsch questioning his own belief in a higher power.

title: Whats on TV Thursday
description: 9 A.M. (NBC) MACYS THANKSGIVING DAY PARADE Matt Lauer, Savannah Guthrie and Al Roker host this 88th installment, with appearances by the Big Apple Circus, Cirque du Soleil, Rene Fleming, Nick Jonas, Kiss, Idina Menzel, Meghan Trainor, Quvenzhan Wallis and the Muppets of Sesame Street, as well as the Broadway casts of A Gentlemans Guide to Love & Murder, Honeymoon in Vegas, On the Town, "Side Show and The Last Ship with Sting. Soaring above it all: Snoopy and Woodstock, Spider-Man, SpongeBob SquarePants, Paddington Bear and, new this year, Eruptor from the Skylanders video game. The Taney Dragons Little League team from Philadelphia will lead the procession.

title: With a New League, a Sports Sleeping Giant Begins to Stir
description: NEW DELHI  Indian soccer fans still dream of an alternate reality, one where their sport, not cricket, is the national obsession.

title: Corrections: November 27, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Its now in the hands of all types of people  good people, bad people, tricksters, pranksters, kids.

title: Q. and A.: Zhang Lifan on the New Chinese Nationalism
description: The Chinese historian Zhang Lifan has become outspoken in recent years on the need for China to undertake ambitious economic and political changes. His family has been deeply involved in modern Chinese political life: Mr. Zhangs father, Zhang Naiqi, served as the head of the national Food Department during the first years of the Communist government, but in 1957, he was labeled a rightist by Mao Zedong and tortured. He died in 1977, one year after Maos death.

title: Toyota Widens Recall of Cars With Takata Airbags
description: TOKYO  Toyota widened a global recall on Thursday of vehicles containing potentially dangerous airbags made by the Takata Corporation, announcing its first recall of cars to fix problems with drivers-side airbags. All of its recalls so far have been for passenger-side units.

title: North Korea: Leaders Sister Has Post in Ruling Party
description: North Koreas state-run news media revealed Thursday that the younger sister of the countrys leader, Kim Jong-un, had become a senior official at the ruling Workers Party, bolstering a widespread suspicion among outside analysts that she was emerging as an important player in his government. The North Korean media identified his sister, Kim Yo-jong, as a deputy departmental director of the partys Central Committee. Ms. Kim, believed to be 27, is considered the relative closest to the North Korean leader. She has often accompanied her brother on his tours of factories and farms. Mr. Kim, believed to be 30, has no known male heir yet.

title: British Embassy Vehicle Among Targets in 2 Kabul Attacks
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  A dramatic increase of Taliban violence in Afghanistans capital in recent weeks culminated in two attacks on Thursday.

title: Players Death From Cricket Injury Stuns Sport
description: LONDON  Two days after he was struck by a ball in what was called a freakish accident, an Australian cricketer, Phillip Hughes, died in a Sydney hospital on Thursday, drawing expressions of grief, shock and disbelief from fellow players and sporting figures around the world.

title: Mayors Race Could Alter Balance of Political Power in Taiwan
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan  A doctor and political novice is favored to win Taipeis mayoral election on Saturday, one of many races in which Taiwans governing party faces the prospect of its most serious setback in years.

title: Indonesia Formally Pledges to Join China-Sponsored Regional Bank
description: BEIJING  Indonesia has signed an official memorandum of understanding to join a China-backed regional development bank intended to rival organizations like the World Bank and to further Beijings aspirations for a leadership role in Asia.

title: British Firm Starts Hedge Fund for Social Services
description: When a potential hedge fund investor recently visited a mental health charity, he asked what the organization would need to help more people.

title: Panel Details Plan to Give Scotland More Powers
description: LONDON  Scotland was promised sweeping powers over taxation and welfare spending on Thursday under a proposed deal meant to address concerns that helped drive a Scottish attempt to secede from the United Kingdom in September.

title: Malaysian Premier Says Sedition Act Will Stand
description: BANGKOK  Malaysias prime minister on Thursday backed away from his promise to abolish a sweeping law that in recent years has been used against the governments opponents.

title: Hungry City: Fitzcarraldo in East Williamsburg, Brooklyn
description: Music rains down from a gramophone horn hung from a ceiling that curves like a ships hull. Spiky ferns half-spill out of hanging baskets; peacock-blue flowered tile runs underfoot. The front wall is all window, 12 feet tall with a grid of steel, looking out on almost unrelieved darkness.

title: A Very Modern Take on a Classic Chinese Painting
description: For a visual survey of recent headline-grabbing events in China, look no further than the latest photographic project by the artist Dai Xiang, inspired by the 12th-century scroll painting Along the River During the Qingming Festival.

title: On Holiday, Ferguson Seeks to Salve Wounds
description: FERGUSON, Mo.  The people who came to this boarded-up downtown on Thursday morning knew they could not do much to salve Fergusons wounds. But it was Thanksgiving, and they felt they could not just sit home, either. So they brought paint brushes and prayers, thermoses of coffee and trays of drop biscuits, hoping to counterbalance the arsons, angry protests and racial strife.

title: Thanksgiving Through the Years, Viewed Through Its Vocabulary
description: As you prepare your Thanksgiving dinner, theres a good chance that some of the dishes that were family traditions have been supplanted.

title: E.U. Parliament Passes Measure to Break Up Google in Symbolic Vote
description: BRUSSELS  Europes resentment of the American technology giant Google reached a new noise level on Thursday as the European Parliament passed a nonbinding vote to break up the company.

title: Greek Navy Tows Disabled Vessel Carrying Migrants to Safety
description: ATHENS  A disabled freighter carrying hundreds of migrants anchored off the Aegean island of Crete on Thursday after being towed by a Greek Navy vessel for more than 30 hours through strong winds.

title: Five Economic Trends to Be Thankful For
description: They say the news media likes to dwell on the bad, swapping silver linings for dark clouds. And in this miserable year of the Islamic State, Ebola and Ferguson, Mo., there have been plenty of dark clouds for us to report about.

title: Morten Tyldum Narrates a Scene From The Imitation Game
description: In this video, the director Morten Tyldum discusses a sequence from his film, featuring Benedict Cumberbatch as the British mathematician and code breaker Alan Turing.

title: Mikhail Baryshnikov and Robert Wilson Take On Nijinsky
description: After their successful collaboration on adapting Daniil Kharmss short story The Old Woman for the stage, Mikhail Baryshnikov and Robert Wilson are taking on another project. They will create a work based on the diaries of Vaslav Nijinsky, to have its premiere at the Festival di Spoleto in Italy in July 2015.

title: Irans Supreme Leader Backs Further Nuclear Talks
description: TEHRAN  Irans supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, expressed support on Thursday for the extension of talks with Western powers on the countrys nuclear program.

title: When Should You Shop? Right After Black Friday
description: Want the best deals on electronics, but dont feel like camping out for two weeks in front of Best Buy? Stay home on Friday, but dont wait too long after that to shop online.

title: The Daily Gift: Gourmet Jerky Made From Filet Mignon
description: Each day until Christmas, the editors of T share a new holiday gift idea.

title: Rape Ruled Out in Case of 2 Indian Girls
description: NEW DELHI  When the bodies of two teenage cousins were found hanging from a mango tree in the northern state of Uttar Pradesh in May, the police initially said the girls had been abducted and raped, in what seemed like yet another grisly crime against women in India.

title: Build a Team, Then Rebuild a Musical
description: Jack Tantleff thought he knew what the director Bill Condon would say. But when he asked Mr. Condon, Why Side Show and why now? at a talkback after a recent performance of that Broadway musical, Mr. Tantleff didnt realize the spotlight would turn on him.

title: Gingerbread for a Cause
description: Gingerbread houses are a popular holiday tradition, and the Great Wolf Lodge, a group of 12 indoor water-park resorts in North America, is embracing it by giving guests and the public a chance to dine inside life-size versions.

title: Seeing Is Disbelieving
description: By his own admission, Adam Trent has never held a real job  or at least not one that doesnt involve plying a deck of cards. At 29, he has been a magician for nearly two decades, having been entranced by David Copperfield when he was 8. Growing up in Boulder, Colo., Mr. Trent began performing in a pint-size tuxedo while still in elementary school. Eventually, he put himself through college by doing sleight of hand.

title: Italian Thanksgiving Shopping, a Cappella
description: Dear Diary:

title: P. D. James, Creator of the Adam Dalgliesh Mysteries, Dies at 94
description: Phyllis Dorothy James White, who became Baroness James of Holland Park in 1991 but who was better known as the Queen of Crime for the multilayered mystery novels she wrote as P. D. James, died on Thursday at her home in Oxford, England. She was 94.

title: Broken Codes, Both Strategic and Social
description: The Imitation Game is a highly conventional movie about a profoundly unusual man. This is not entirely a bad thing. Alan Turings tragically shortened life  he was 41 when he died in 1954  is a complex and fascinating story, bristling with ideas and present-day implications, and it benefits from the streamlined structure and accessible presentation of modern prestige cinema. The science is not too difficult, the emotions are clear and emphatic, and the truth of history is respected just enough to make room for tidy and engrossing drama.

title: International Arts Events Happening in the Week Ahead
Gigi  This One a Play  to Have an Off Off Broadway Run
description: The Anita Loos play Gigi, in which Audrey Hepburn made her Broadway debut in the title role in 1951, will be revived by Off Off Broadways Storm Theater Company in January, executives there announced on Thursday.

title: OPEC Holds Production Unchanged; Prices Fall
description: VIENNA  The oil cartel OPEC decided on Thursday not to cut petroleum production, despite the plunge in prices in recent months that has indicated the diminishing clout of the organization.

title: International Red Cross, Citing Numerous Crises, Plans Record Spending
description: GENEVA  Under pressure from the number and intensity of humanitarian crises around the world, the International Committee of the Red Cross said Thursday it was trying to raise a record $1.6 billion to fund its 2015 operations.

title: 1939: Eleanor Roosevelt Ready to Testify
description: Mrs. Eleanor Roosevelt today said that she would gladly testify before the Dies Committee on the Investigation of un-American activities regarding alleged Communist control of the American Youth Congress.

title: A Tight Budget and a Tighter Schedule
description: When Lyndsie Guy moved to New York after completing a stint with AmeriCorps, she crashed with a friend in a Chelsea one-bedroom.

title: On Ukraine Front Line, Sniper Fire and Shelling Leave Cease-Fire in Tatters
description: PISKY, Ukraine  Since a cease-fire was declared in eastern Ukraine on Sept. 5, nearly 1,000 soldiers and civilians have died in a grinding conflict with rebel separatists that is being waged largely out of sight. That is almost a quarter of the 4,317 killed since April and an average of 13 a day, the United Nations estimates.

title: Hong Kong Court Orders Joshua Wong, a Protest Leader, to Stay Away From Cleared Camp
description: HONG KONG  Joshua Wong, a student who is the best-known face of Hong Kongs pro-democracy protest movement, was ordered by a court on Thursday to stay away from the area where he and other demonstrators were arrested when the police cleared away their street camp. Mr. Wong said he had been hit by police officers during the tense sweep.

title: Growing Herds of Deer Arent Welcome at New York Parks
description: Bucks Hollow, in Staten Islands Greenbelt, might sound like a natural home to whitetail deer, but the New York City parks department is doing its best to keep them out.

title: Activists Help Pay for Patients Travel to Shrinking Number of Abortion Clinics
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  The young woman lived in Dallas, 650 miles from Albuquerque, but that was where she would have to go for an abortion, she was told. New state regulations had forced several of Dallass six abortion clinics to close, creating weekslong waiting lists. By the time the woman could get in, she would be up against the Texas ban on abortions after 20 weeks gestation.

title: Gratitude, Woodworking and Music on the Home Front on Thanksgiving
description: I spend a lot of time analyzing global climate and energy trends, far-flung conservation efforts, work aimed at improving prospects for the worlds least fortunate and new technologies with promising future applications, the latest being a novel coating, described in Nature, that can in theory cool a building even on sunny days. Much of this screen and road time takes me away from my family, students and home.

title: Bobby Storey, Veteran of Irish Republican Army, Detained in 1972 Murder
description: DUBLIN  A former senior Irish Republican Army commander was detained for questioning in Northern Ireland on Thursday in connection with a notorious 1972 murder case, his associates said.

title: 1889: Priest Questions the Meridian of Greenwich
description: Father Tondini is a priest who proposes to sanctify geography, navigation and a quantity of other sciences by a very simple process. At present the civilized world marks distances and time from the meridian of Greenwich. Now, Greenwich is a purely secular place, and its meridian has not the least tinge of piety about it. This dissatisfies the good Father Tondini, and he therefore proposes that all the world should adopt the meridian of Jerusalem. In which case we should reckon time and distance from the Holy City, and thereby  so he thinks  prove ourselves to be Christians.  The New York Herald, European Edition, Nov. 28, 1889

title: Macys 88th Annual Thanksgiving Day Parade
description: New balloons this year are a Red Mighty Morphin Power Ranger, Thomas the Tank Engine and Paddington Bear.

title: Best at Everything? Its Closer to True
description: There is a comforting adage that many players on the football team at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology regularly use among themselves: The game on Saturday is the easiest part of their week.

title: Deadly Attack on Indian Base Near Pakistan as Leaders Meet in Nepal
description: KATMANDU, Nepal  At least 10 people were killed on Thursday in Kashmir when gunmen attacked an Indian Army base near the border with Pakistan, just as leaders of the two longtime rivals were exchanging pleasantries in Nepal.

title: Using Doctors With Troubled Pasts to Market a Painkiller
description: Dr. Judson Somerville, a pain specialist in Laredo, Tex., received $67,000 in speaking fees, travel and meals in 2013 to promote a powerful and addictive painkiller called Subsys, according to a new federal database of payments that drug companies make to physicians.

title: British Library Acquires Letters of Harold Pinter
description: LONDON  The British Library announced on Thursday that it had acquired more than 100 letters that Harold Pinter wrote to two of his longtime friends, Henry Woolf and Mick Goldstein, mostly while he was in his 20s. The letters  written over a 12-year span  will join the librarys Harold Pinter Archive, a trove of manuscripts, photographs and personal correspondence that it acquired in 2007.

title: From Carole King to a Waitress: Jessie Mueller Takes on a New Musical
description: Jessie Mueller, who won a best actress Tony Award in June for her acclaimed performance in the title role of Beautiful: The Carole King Musical, has found her next big theater project. She will star in the new musical Waitress, based on the 2007 film about a put-upon southern diner server (played by Keri Russell in the movie) who has a gift for making inventive pies and shares her thoughts about life as she prepares them.

title: British Property Developer Files $3.5 Billion Claim Over Iceland Bank Inquiry
description: LONDON  The British property developer Vincent Tchenguiz has filed a $3.5 billion claim in London against the accounting firm Grant Thornton, the Icelandic bank Kaupthing and three individuals, contending that they were behind a flawed criminal inquiry into the banks collapse.

title: Shell Be There
description: Few cabaret performers are more welcoming than Baby Jane Dexter, a singer with a booming gutbucket contralto who projects an open-armed empathy to her loyal fans. For the last several years, the message she has conveyed in her inspirational signature song, the R.E.M. classic Everybody Hurts, is an unspoken: Come to Mama. Were all in this together.

title: Under Pressure From Uber, Taxi Medallion Prices Are Plummeting
description: In major cities throughout the United States, taxi medallion prices are tumbling as taxis face competition from car-service apps like Uber and Lyft.

title: Ohio Exhibitions Highlight Ferdinand Brader
description: FOLK ARTIST WHO LEFT

title: Study on Cultural Memory Confirms: Chester A. Arthur, We Hardly Knew Ye
description: Quick: Which American president served before slavery ended, John Tyler or Rutherford B. Hayes?

title: Macys 88th Annual Thanksgiving Day Parade
description: Crowds gathered in Manhattan to watch the Macys Thanksgiving Day Parade.

title: Ann Lislegaard Presents Three Intriguing Pieces
description: The Norwegian artist Ann Lislegaards exceptionally elegant show presents three intriguing pieces based on famous works of science fiction.

title: British Hedge Fund Titan Is Ordered to Pay Ex-Wife $531 Million
description: A London high court judge has ordered Chris Hohn, founder of one of Britains largest and most successful hedge funds, to pay his former wife $531 million to settle their messy public divorce, according to statements made in court on Thursday.

title: Running Against the Wind in Tandem
description: The CMT series Crossroads demands patience of its fans, generally doling out new installments only every few months. But that patience is always rewarded, and the episode having its premiere Friday night is particularly tasty.

title: Songs Without an Expiration Date
description: Steve Tyrells opening-night show at Caf Carlyle on Tuesday was a milestone, both for the club and for Mr. Tyrell, who 10 years ago took over the cafes holiday slot previously occupied by Bobby Short. It didnt seem so at the time, but Mr. Tyrells ascendance signaled a changing of the guard at the chic Upper East Side club, where the elegant Mr. Short had entertained bohemian socialites for more than three decades.

title: Greeks Go on Strike Over New Austerity Measures
description: ATHENS  Thousands of Greeks walked off the job on Thursday in a general strike to protest further austerity measures, while government officials wrangled with the countrys international creditors over economic policy and whether to extend Greeces financial bailout.

title: Moby Presents Innocents, a Series of Photographs
description: MOBY

title: At Macys Parade, Bands, Balloons and, This Thanksgiving, Protesters
description: The usual helium-filled characters, like Snoopy and the pudgy Pillsbury Doughboy, were out in force at the Macys Thanksgiving Day Parade on Thursday. But this year, the parade had an edge: Pockets of protesters marched intermittently along the route, seeking to call attention to a grand jurys decision on Monday not to indict the police officer who shot and killed Michael Brown, an unarmed black teenager in Ferguson, Mo., in August.

title: Francesco Clemente Offers Contrasting Shows
description: The nomadic Neo-Expressionist painter Francesco Clemente is back, with two concurrent but very different shows: a spare, almost monastic solo show at the Rubin Museum and an abundantly sensual exhibition at Mary Boone in Chelsea. The gallery show, which enfolds visitors in Mughal-style canvas tents with vibrant painted interiors, plays to his strengths: a fluid hand and a rich, knowing synthesis of Eastern and Western figurative art.

title: At a Paris Flea Market, Tips for Treasure Hunters
description: St.-Ouen. The name made me shudder. Whenever visitors asked me to take them to that vast set of flea markets just north of the Paris city line, I did my best to divert them elsewhere.

title: A Doctor Will See You Now
description: If you were unaware that there are people in the United States who dont receive proper health care, Remote Area Medical, a documentary about the nonprofit organization of that name, certainly shows you what they look like, in blunt, tooth-decaying detail. But beyond that, it maddeningly refuses to take a stand or explore the questions it raises.

title: Beethoven, Cyrano and Samplings From Film Scores
description: The Dutch conductor Jaap van Zweden has been thriving as the music director of the Dallas Symphony Orchestra since his tenure began in 2008. At the time of his appointment, he was little known in the United States. Now 53, he is still introducing himself to the players and audiences of the New York Philharmonic. After making an impressive Philharmonic debut in 2012, he did not return until last week, for a program that included a well-received account of Shostakovichs Eighth Symphony.

title: Slashing His Wrists When the Phone Rings
description: All mood and no substance, Before I Disappear is Shawn Christensens feature-length expansion of his Academy Award-winning 19-minute film, Curfew, from 2012.

title: A Touring Dancers Packing Steps
description: As a dancer who tours nine months a year with the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater, Glenn Allen Sims has learned a thing or two about traveling. To maximize limited time in a city, he and his wife, Linda Celeste Sims, also a dancer with the company, rise early, getting in sightseeing before rehearsal that afternoon and eating dinner before their performance so they can turn in right after it.

title: Euro Bond Yields
description: The turkey gobblers arent here yet, so lets take a moment to note the record lows being hit in European bond markets:

title: When Fractions of a Second Can Change Whole Lives
description: There is a bit of A Star Is Born in Touch the Wall, a documentary that traces the diverging fortunes of two Olympic-level swimmers. We watch Kara Lynn Joyce, a four-time silver medalist, as she joins a team in Colorado, where she trains alongside Missy Franklin, then in high school. Together, they prepare to try out for the 2012 United States Olympic team.

title: New York Citys Week in Pictures: Nov. 28
description: Photographs from the past week in New York City and the region include the Macys Thanksgiving Parade and protests after the decision in Ferguson, Mo.

title: Go Read a Book, Kid. It Couldnt Hurt You.
description: I was an easily frightened child, and nothing scared me more than certain picture books. Something about the static images, the simple words and the unseen menaces hidden between pages made books much more sinister than, say, movies, and quite a few volumes that now seem perfectly innocuous were banished from my bedroom shelves. I had forgotten about this youthful phobia until I saw The Babadook, the debut feature by the Australian director Jennifer Kent. Or rather, until I came home from the screening, went to bed and woke up in the throes of the kind of nightmare that was the reason I had shunned those books in the first place.

title: Spike Lee Script for Do the Right Thing to Receive Public Reading
description: The actors Michael B. Jordan (Fruitvale Station) and John Turturro (Barton Fink) will join in a free reading on Friday evening of Spike Lees screenplay for Do the Right Thing at the Film Society of Lincoln Center, according to Blackout for Human Rights, a social justice group presenting the event.

title: Remembering P. D. James: Times Reviews
description: The mystery novelist P. D. James became known as the Queen of Crime over her writing career. She died on Thursday at 94. Following is a collection of Times coverage of the author and reviews of her work.

title: From Here (or There) to Eternity
description: David Alvarado and Jason Sussbergs The Immortalists at first looks to be a horse race portrayal of two men competing to achieve eternal life through scientific means. Aubrey de Grey  his name seems lifted from a Poe story  is an amply bearded British scientist with a multipronged strategy for combating the deleterious effects of aging. His counterpart here is Bill Andrews, an American who likes to run ultramarathons and has his own petri dish proposal for cheating cell death.

title: This Dieter Is Different (Trivial and Personal)
